review: I know this isnt your average review but it needs to be told. I was in a motorcycle in the desert map i had stopped to get a new vehicle a bmw van. suddenly when i stop i notice he continue to hear a engine sound. 2 seconds later I get hit by a man on a Buggy crashing into me still on the motorcycle and multiple broken down cars around me. It made a huge crashing on bending metal and it made me jump. The man shot me dead with two shots. I lost around 20#. These are the details I love to see in all video games. I love the accelerating jump and scream I make and feel in me head as i go over a big hill in my jeep wondering if I would make it. This is the game of 2017 and possibly even 2018

review: How a promising game became a cashgrabAfter about 150 hours played since 2017 June i just can't recommend this game. I did fell in love it first because it was so promising but now it's just nothing but a cheap cashgrab by the developers.After about a year since it was first released at steam the gameplay still feels clunky the servers are still crap with low tickrates. And back then it wasn't that much of a problem because it was an early acces title and there were attempts and communication from the devs that they're working on fixing the game.Since the past few months all i can see that we're getting weapons skins more crates more cosmetics a new map which is a great thing in itself but this game is rotten in the core and from where i stand it seems like the devs are milking out what they can from this game before it collapses. They have no intentions (or capabilities) to adress the most urgent issues so they just blind us with "shiny new stuff". But it isn't enough. Ask yourself when was the last time we did get a patch that improved stability servers or anything that about the core of the game and not just cosmetics/new map?I really want to love this game because when it works it's so much fun and i can't mention another game where winning feels so good like in PUBG. So please devs prove me wrong and make this into the awsome game that it deserves to be.

review: I've gone back and forth on whether to recommend this or not but the bottom line is this it's a challenging game (both in physical gaming ability and the strategy necessary to outsmart other players' tactics) and it's fun to play. Is this a AAA game? Not quite but I think it will be there soon. However it also doesn't currently have a AAA price tag either.Are there major glaring issues with the gameplay? Yes namely the server lag when there are still 80 100 players left alive. That being said my most recent matches since the official 1.0 release have had very little or no lag at all the entirety of the match. Within the first day or two of release the lag was as bad as ever so I think the large influx of new players has tapered off and combined with fixes released for the game/servers the lag is at an all time low.Playing on NA servers I have not knowingly come across any hackers. I also usually watch my deathcams and have not seen anything that would suggest I have been killed by any hackers. That being said it sounds like hacking is still rampant and needs a more permanent solution.Crashes also need a permanent fix. Overall I believe this has been improved over the past couple months but I have still experienced a few game crashes that seem to have been completely random.Again the driving factor for me is whether or not this is a fun experience overall in spite of the issues with the game. That answer is still 'yes'. If you can survive the first 30 90 seconds of intermittent server lag (if/when it actually occurs) the next 20 30 minutes you spend fighting to the death are worth dealing with the minor frustrations that still exist.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG is for the most part an amazing example of how to correctly do a survival shooter that mixes difficulty tension strategy and most importantly fairness. You might never get a Chicken dinner but you don't need one to feel like you've had a satisfying game. It's an almost perfect blend of what makes these types of games so popular to play and watch and if it wasn't for a large amount of bugs and performance issues the game would be up there with the best multiplayer games steam has to offer.I can't say that I have actually personally experienced many bugs at least bugs that I can remember. But from the feedback all over the internet I can't refute that the game is actually bug free the game is in early access and I wholly expect to find bugs eventually. Rather my largest issue with the game has been performance it might as well be unplayable for me as most of the time I get stuck on a loading screen until a couple of minutes after I hit the ground. I will still highly recommend this game because without this issue the game is fantastic and because other than that the game runs amazingly. A friend of mine runs this game at nearly constant 60 on his potato of a PC even if it's on minimal graphics. If you want to play this game I can only recommend you make sure you either have an SSD or a good HDD I have a great PC and my friend I mentioned earlier has a potato. But his HDD happens to be faster than mine. Without a fast SSD or HDD this game just wont load fast enough. I can't say anything else about performance because despite what I've heard this game can run on a wide vareity of PC's.Chinese players are also another problem I've heard being brough up I've seen them and there definitely needs to be a region lock for them because from my experiene Chinese players that region hop are hackers. But it's not a massive invasion killing the game like I've heard. I'll hear a couple occassionally for 30 seconds before the game starts and never see a Chinese player again. That being said you need to region lock the Chinese for the sake of fairness and balance.The game has been given a lot of money and it has been in development for a long time now. Still give the game a break. Developing a perfect netcode for a game that is designed to handle 100 people on a surprisingly large map and bullets in real time on top of that. Is actually a surprising challenge. Especially when you're doing that for far more servers than the average game has in spite of not being a large publisher. The game is technically Korean and as a result Korean servers will get priority fixes as well as other Asian regions. Games take a surprising amount of time and resources to develop especially when there's a massive list of things you need to fix and add. If you aren't prepared to deal with the issues a game still in development has then wait for the game to be in a more finished state.tl dr/final thoughts The game is great and it's fantastic when it works perfectly. It's not for everyone but you don't have to be a survival game buff or a god at shooter games to have fun. It's brought down by a number of issues most of which are fixed by having a better computer or ISP. The game is still in development and the most important factor you should consider when buying this game is whether or not you are prepared to deal with the issues a game in development is going to have. I definitely recommend this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Playing PUBG is like having an abusive relationship. To you everything PUBG tries to do seems like love and affection. However when you take a step back and actually look into it you can see that PUBG is actually beating the outta you. It's the abusive relationship trap. You had good times with it and geniunely believe that PUBG can fix its act and be better. However it keeps doing the same thing to you each update is a brutal beating hidden behind false affection. Example would be the recent Event Pass. You think that it's a good idea its a box of chocolate....with a fist coming right at you after you buy it. BlueHole is sticking its nasty practices as a mobile game company into PUBG. I will still keep playing PUBG but I cannot recommend it to new players. It's an abusive relationship that you don't want to be in.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 300+ Hours Played. A huge thumbs up. Despite all the tweens raging about the same things over and over "OPTIMIZE SERVERZ MAP SELECT FIX BUG" this game is actually HELLA fun! Every match is thrilling every kill incredibly satisfying and when you actually win a game you will feel a wave of emotion throughout your entire body. How many games offer that? If you ever played and enjoyed a first person shooter then you will love this game. If you have ever wanted to try a Battle Royale game look no further. As for the negative reviews 90% of them are trolls/teens. Here are their most common complaints BUGS/CRASHING My game crashed TWICE in the 300 hours I played.MAP SELECT If you don't like the desert map you can literally back out of the match with zero penalty and join another match.No clue why they keep whining about NET CODE I get the lowest pings I've ever gotten in any game I've ever played with PUBG. HACKERS The ONLY legitimate complaint. Yes there are hackers just like in every FPS ever made. Do hackers ruin the entire game? Short answer No. Is it annoying to be killed by a hacker? Short answer Extremely.Is Bluehole addressing this issue as one of their primary objectives? YEP.I give this game a 95/100. They kept the game true to itself throughout all the updates including the 2 new maps. And you only pay once to play this game. There is literally nothing else you need to buy.

There is SO much stuff wrong with this game. This game has to be one of the most poorly executed games I have ever played. Gun play is player control is graphics aren't very good and the servers are Boy oh boy... the ing servers. I haven't been able to play at all today because the servers are down AGAIN. Even when they are up the connection is horrible and you will lag no matter how fast your internet is. If the devs actualy get their together and fix this game up then it would be fun but for now the only time it is ever fun is if you're playing with friends and are just ing around.

review: I like playing with my friends and one of them bought this game in alpha about a year ago. He convinced me after harrassing me for weeks to buy it as well so we could play together. I didnt have much faith but the thing that convinced me to buy it in the end were the promises bluehole made around those times. The game was going to have full mod support and dedicated servers. This made the game way more interesting to me. The first few weeks i played but it was barely running at all. This improved over the course of time to a certain extend. As you see ive played for almost 250 hours now before finally giving up on this game and bluehole as a company.A year later the game still runs like absolute garbage and so do the servers. Bluehole have been ignoring community suggestions and are silent regarding any of these issues for months now. They do not admit it or try to fix it at all. Servers suffer from horrible desync and getting 60fps steady on high setting would need a $2k rig at least because of the poor coding quality.I could probably look past this to some extent when the rest of the game would be great but unfortunately its just not. The only updates we are getting are skins. Rewards for playing are points to spend on loot crates. When you can finally afford a few you have to pay for keys to open them. Really bluehole? Those points are literally the only reward system and dont get me started on your BS season pass. Secondly there is no sign of dedicated community servers an update or ETA is it even on the roadmap anymore? Mod support is something I'm laughing at I ever believed in. Bluehole could not even pull that off if they tried. TLDR Ignorant company ignoring all the issues makes for a game suffering from all the t you would expect from an early access game made by a small studio.. Except they are making literal billions and development has come to a standstill. The game in its current state is an embarrasment and i'm now one of many who have quitstill 30 bucks for 250 hours isnt abysmal only if half of the time wasnt spent rendering /s

review: At time of writing I have 175 of gameplay on this game and have to say for $30 that also practically paid for itself by being able to sell in game rewards I am pretty happy. Game runs smoothly between 50 60 fps (I'm on a laptop so it is about the best I can expect for what I paid) and compared to the game a few months ago the devs really have fixed lots of problems. Yes of course the is still more optimization to be done and lots of people are salty because the devs are introducing lots of locked loot crates. However do you remember when games didn't have loot boxes at all and you just played the game because it was fun...? Yah so just ignore the loot crates and occasionally you get lucky and get to sell some stuff for some steam credit.It is much more fun to play with 1 3 friends then by yourself but still fun solo.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: How the hell does one write a review on this game. Either you love it so much or you hate it with a passion. You can't be in the middle because of how broken it is. I got it after the 1.0 patch and things have only gotten worse for the game. I want to love it soooo bad but I cant because everytime the devs try to move one step forward they end up moving two steps back. Maybe if they could work on the frames I'd love it more but everyone says that but nothing ever fixes. Putting all the hard work in to looting and dying in a way that makes you want to punch your monitor is not fun. All the negatives I've said I'll still play this over fortnite anyday of the week. It's like a bad drug you want to stop but you can't.

review: Am vazut jocul prima data pe YouTube m am indragostit de el din primele clipe peste cateva zile l am luat si eu.La inceput nu prea stiam ce trebuie sa fac doar era distractiv apoi cand am mai dat si de persoane care apoi sau transformat in niste prieteni foarte buni jocul a devenit si mai FUN pentru ca aveam cu cine sa ma joc doar acum nu mai este asa greu sa gasesti pe cineva care se joaca PUBG deoarece jocul este foarte popular.Sursele mele juca cat mai mult si a deveni tot mai bun au fost Shroud si Tynnon.Pe Tynnon l am cunosct si am jucat foarte mult cu el este un jucator foarte bun de PUBG si il admir pentru acest lucru imi da mereu sfaturi pentru a deveni mai bun.Daca ai joul sigur il sti si pe Shroud este este unul dintre ce i mai buni jucatori de PUBG din lume ! Dupa ce am invatat sa ma joc mai bine am hotarat sa caut niste persoane cu care sa imi fac o echipa doar pentru fun! si asa i am gasit pe Vanilie si pe Rares doua persoane foarte de treaba.Tot respectul pentru ei!Din fun am inceput sa ma joc din ce in ce mai mult pentru ca imi place jocul mai ales ca in fiecare saptaman vinea cate un update nou pe care il asteptam mereu!Acum jocul este si mai bun sunt mai multe mape jucatori buni deci daca vrei sa devii mai bun trebuie sa te joci foarte mult!Jocul isi merita bani pentru ca te pune in niste stari de fericire maxima cand castigi un meci dar sa nu uitam si de partile rele cand mori si devi nervos atunci mai da i odata Start si asa reintri intr un meci nou unde poti sa iti repari greseala din meciul precedent si asa poti sa devii mai bun ! Recomand jocul tutrol persoanelor care au mai avut intalnirii cu jocuri FPS deoarece te ajuta experienta din alt joc in accest joc.Grafica este unde foarte buna chiar daca uneori mai ai si lag sau nu se incarca texturile developerii fac tot ce pot pentru a face jocul cat mai bun si cat mai bine optimizat!Comunitatea este una foarte de treaba poti da de jucatori care sunt tari poti da de jucatori buni etc.Poti da si de jucatori cu CHEATS doar stai calm daca le ai dat report in scurt timp o sa primeasca ban deoarece anti cheat ul este unul foarte bun!Recomand Jocul din tot sufletul!

review: This game is the perfect blend of blind aggression and tactical game play. Every game is different sometimes you're a pan wielding god and other games you will be target practise for other players. This game is fun to play on your own however it really shines with friends. Me and my friends have spent many an evening just playing squads and having a blast every time. Some games we will really try hard and go top 10 or even get a chicken dinner ! But others we will mess around and meme the whole game these are equally as fun as when we try hard. I think I will spend a lot of time I should be revising trying to block bullets with pans 10/10.

review: A lot of people are complaining about performance. For Early Access it's not bad at all. Comparing it to H1Z1 a lot of people are saying they're not the same. This is a better looking and more fun version of King of the Kill. You can open your crates by just playing the game and earning a reasonable amount of credits per match. The health system is more simplistic than that of H1Z1. There is no bleeding to worry about. Overall I'm having a blast playing. Watch out for air strikes and the anomaly zone!

Then they started rolling out "optimization" updates and COMPLETELY destroyed this game i jump from a plane and the ground textures for the buildings NEVER load...i stare at the blocky sky texture versions of buildings that refuse to load so i cant enter or interact with any building or object. and if i try and shut the game down or mess with any graphics setings it completely crashes my computer. after months of updates and me giving this game an unbelievable amount ofchances i give up....this game is LITERALLY unplayable. maybe they should focus on fixing this of unoptimized garbage before trying to get it on Xbox and Ps4.....prioritize....but since hes made so much money off the initial sales it seems like just like Dayz this game is destined to be an early access nightmare thats eventualy abandoned due to lack of support....or caring. i wanted to love this game and really suported the small team but this is unnaceptable

review: PlayerUnknowns Battleground is the culmination of years and years of passion from the man himself PlayerUnknown. A long time staple in the Battle Royale community this man single handedly pushed these types of games into the spotlight. What originally started out as a mod for Arma 2 then eventually H1Z1's KOTK. This is the first true standalone battle royale game of this quality and scale. Although this ghme isn't perfect its fantastically fun the action packed into this game never ceases to amaze. Some of the highlights for this game look like something straight out of a Die hard movie.

review: This is an excellent game to play with friends. While still excellent in Solo mode playing with one to three other friends is an absolute blast! While still imperfect it is the best of the available "battle royale" genres.The shooting mechanics are similar to the hyper realistic ARMA series. That is either highly appealing or appalling. I quite enjoy it despite the immense learning curve.The only downside to this game is that practice makes perfect and this game won't allow you to practice aside from throwing your life away by landing in hot zones to engage with other players who are either just like you (trying to learn and practice the shooting mechanics) or confident in their skills enough to tangle with the worst (and far more competent than you). So prepare for some frustration in the learning curve.However there is always the next game. Which is what keeps me playing. There's always another chance to get a chicken dinner!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The birth of this game was also the death of H1z1 and the reason behind it is so clearThis game is far better from every single point of view. For example it has better graphics better fights and no filthy "h1z1 car mechanics" and there is much more. This is literally the ONLY battle royale game to this date that is actually skillbased and fun compared to laggy H1z1 and the minecraft look alike game Fortnite which only purpose is to scam 12 year olds of their parents money. In all seriousness though. This game is too much about the "looting phase" and there is little to no fighting ever occuring. When those short and rare fighting moments actually happen though they are the most thrilling and exciting thing in the battle royale game world. But they are just too rare. And that is literally the only downside to this game. People are scared to fight and it is not as rewarding to fight than to just loot.The game is just too slow in comparison to Fortnite and H1z1. Meaning that the looting phase takes too much time. What the developers could do is to balance weapon somewhat and make the players not rely as heavily on attatchments and medic supplies as they do today. Another option may be to shrink the maps removing the open spaces between the major cities. This could lead to less long range battles and thus maybe more clusmy and messy battles on the other hand.I would give the game 10/10 on a good day without a doubt.But to be honest it depends on so many different variables so a more accurate rating would be 7/10.

review: Im not gonna lie this is the first time ive done a review on steam! I heard about pubg from various people mostly my friends about how awesome the gameplay was and let me tell you it is exhilirating! Seldome do games have my heart pumping with adrenaline and my fingers tingling while crouched in dense grass as the game circle gets ever smaller and smaller!The game is still in its early stages but the developer has promised more updates that will not only make the game infinitely better but also offer a varied experience through new maps and possibly game modes. This game is all about stealth and cunning. When you first start off you are dropped via airplane (c130) into this island with a 100 other people. It is your job to find a safe haven to loot and find as many weapons/health packs as you can. The thing that makes this game great is its weapon realism. Weapons work like how they are in real life and when other players start shooting you can literally make out where they are based on the echo of their gun shots. The only gripe i have about this game is that there are certain bugs that still annoy the living heck out of me. One of those things are there are no vaulting animations. When you encounter a barricade or a wall in this game and try to jump over it most the times your character can get stuck because you cant jump high enough to clear the obstacle even though your not scaling some 10 foot wall but a mere picket fence!Despite all that i think this game is wonderful and should be on your TO BUY LIST!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Cannot really recommend this games as it is really rng heavy from the loot to the zones. Everyone saying that this is tactical and skill based shooter are talking poop. Also the performance on AMD cpu is really subpar as my framerates fluctuate from 25fps to 100fps usually when a firefight occurs it drops drastically hindering the experience.You can say that "this is an early access so deal with it" but a game should be somehow playable without the fps fluctuation with a PC that exeeds the system requirements easily. Even more so when it implements microtransactions.Of course no one would play a game for 140+hours if it was really bad. I have had fun with the game mainly because I have been playing with friends but fun nonetheless. The problem for me is just that all the bugs FPS drops and glitches start to wear you down as time goes by. So now the game mainly invokes feelings of frustration and anger as the small things start to ad up.

review: Battle Royale survival shooter for real hardcore gamers.Coming from a background in BF franchise Dayz H1Z1 etc I love this game. Get a few buddies to play with or make some new friends in game (it is possible to meet some nice people!) That other BR shooter is aimed at console kids PUBG is for the real gamers. Get some cover or run and gun work out the bullet dip on that 1k headshot and throw some smoke down for some tactical play do whatever it takes to win that chicken dinner!I am running on a decent mid spec new build i7 16gb ram and a 1050ti 0 issues running on mid/high settings 0 crashes.The price is worth it especially considering you can make you money back selling crates ont he steam market.

review: Well i took the plunge after ready so many review with many complaining of poor optomisatio and lag.lests start with the setting and performance im runnig with most everything high and ultra and view distance ultra and im getting dam good fps and smooth running so far and little to no network lag. I have played both the standard and test servers with these settings with no issue at all and apart from a few very minor graphical glitches all is well.Im loving the gameplay and running around trying to loot good weapons to stay alive has been really cool and at times heart pumping. Hiding while cars and jeeps drive past and sneaking into buldings never gets old.Im not sure why so many are getting such poor perfomance from the game on thier systems but mine is by no means a gaming rig and im running 1080p with very high in game graphics settings just fine considering its still in alpha at the moment.so far i have no regrets buying the game and look forwards to seeing it grow and get new maps and weapons ect

review: This game has boomed to now 1.7 2 Million players at one time. These reviews make me laugh they complain about the game when the people who wrote them have literally played them in the past couple of days. At the moment yes it is hard to run but they are working on improving fps which is seen the test servers. This game is fun to play with friends and strangers though can be ruined by hackers if the devs don't keep updating the anti cheat. Soon (surprisingly) kill cams are now added (i really hope this isn't the next ing CoD) however this is going to make it harder for the hackers to hide themselves so the game is slowly getting rid of them. People do get salty in this game cause no one wants to watch your teammates play if they die (It aint csgo so if you die early go watch youtube or some cause you are gonna be waiting for atleast 15 mins if your teammates aren't dumb. Although this game is fun listening to how people complain about hackers is funny as hell they will suggest dumb things such as "if people hack they shouldn't be able to play any steam games it ruins the commuity". This game has pretty much gathered all gamers together to play the one god damn game and now LoL isn't the top Twitch game (get on dota).

review: It's a great game everything that I wanted that DayZ wasn't. Very polished for an Early Access game and content is consistently added. Only issues are with the developer's communication with the playerbase. They added microtransactions which they had promised they wouldn't. For me it's not a problem because they're purely cosmetic. It's an early access game they need to test stuff before it is released. Of bigger issue to me is their constant coddling of streamers and handing out unfair bans. Though is will never affect me as stream sniping and honking around streamers is a bit childish it's not banworthy and PU has gone about this the wrong way.It's a great game and if you're morally okay with supporting a developer that may break some promises and handle PR poorly you should buy it
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG is a Multiplayer based game which involves you a player who will be dropped in to a land by a plane with another 90+ players. You're main objective is simply be the LAST PLAYER ALIVE. Aside from all Battle Royale Games Genre this is is quite unique from others. Yes there all the game mode but each on is different style and gameplay. 1.Getting into the game.You'r gonna be in a plane along with many other players with you and have the choice to get out of the plane to drop any landmark you wish to go for a plan to commence. Once you dropped you'r first thing to do is FIND A GUN Because there is a chance a player has landed next you and have to defend yourself from any danger ahead. First thing is rush to the nearest building that either may provide you with a gun or possibly small supplies which is helpful for any type of unexpected scenario. And remember luck determines on what the building is hiding a gun for you or might have nothing at all.2. Loot hunting.For a higher chance to survive you must grab any possible Medkits drinks/painkillers which is considered ESSENTIALS to porgress the game easier. And ofcourse having a gun is a MUST or whatelse you have a choice of rushing to the enemy bare hands. You can easier be bothered of looting every house you find since it can be a small waste of time or simple kill a person who has looted since most likely they have done the looting for you. And one more thing The best place to every get loots that will EXTREMELY have HIGH VALUE to increase your situations tactically are Loot boxes that can be dropped from the plane after the game progresses with time. HOWEVER remember a dropped loot crate means MANY player will try to get it as well. And some will use it as some sort of bait. So better check the area for any suspicious Vehicle/bushes/buildings and mountains since they have an angle to snipe you.3.Equipment Value. Armours have levels of quality which how they absorb and levels reach from 1 3 and level 3 helmets are now ONLY can be optained by loot boxes. Guns however... sometimes can be a preference and so far the BEST/ MOST FAVORED gun is the m 416 since its considered as the BEST assualt rifle for all situations. Snipers are powerful in early games but gets useless in the last final circle. and the game has attachments who helps to upgrade your guns and favour its gimmicks like recoil vertically or horizentally. Its your choice yo decide. Also it varies from sights from Red dot to x8 scopes even a 15x which is only for sniper rifles. so yeah.4. The circle. The circle is VERY IMPORTANT to keep up with so always remember to watch the map from time to time to know where is the next circle to plan your next move. Because the game has something up its sleeves. Something called the RED ZONE. Once your in it FIND SHELTER is a must to survive the dropping bombs of death. and knowing the circle before your enemy will give you the advantage to think your time which is the BEST spot to hide and fire at will. Because if not. Your gonna die before you know it as the enemy will be in various spots which will most likely a death for you.btw don't player in asian servers cause Chinese hackers are always there to kill you. Stay in either EU or NA servers since there most likely away from hackers that will ruin your experience.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

The kills are satisfying to get especially when you snipe someone 500 meters away. The gun mechanics are spot on because of the realistic bullet drop and sounds. In terms of optimization I get 100 fps constant and never dip below 60 that's probably because of my beefy rig. I actually have not come across a cheater but I probably will in the future. The only thing I can say I don't like is random people in your squad that don't even speak English like how am I gonna understand your callouts.

review: As a married man with a full time job I did not think that online multiplayer shooters were for me. I don't have time to practice handling all the weapons learn every nook and cranny of every map and then work out strategies. Still for me PUBG delivers a solid gameplay experience with some kinks but all the while very enjoyable. I can try to play sneaky I can try to play hard I can play however I want. And even though there are sometimes weeks between my play sessions every trip into PUBG is a thrillride.I really want to praise the devs which are doing a great job to GIVE US A LONG LASTING EXPERIENCE. Yes they had huge inital success and could have hired hundreds of programmers. But then pubg corp would have to shut down after a year because they cannot pay the salaries anymore. Instead they accept that their product does not improve as fast as it theoretically could but stick to a promise I read Playerunknown give PUBG will be maintained actively for 10 years. So all those dollars they made in the inital year have to last a while.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

It is a Battle Royal Game. However this is an Early Access game and you shouldn't expect too much from the game yet. If your a big fan of the ARMA series then you'll absolutely love this game. TLDR this game will your face with how fun it is. buy it now. dont look back pleb.

review: Best game i've ever played makes me want to play more and more everyday. Such a good stratgey game that constantly has you thinking even with only one map it seems so large. Every game is completely different and amazing if I die or not because every time I know i'm getting better. I still can't believe this game is great and is still in early access beta. This game will have life for the next 2 3 years and I can't see myself getting burnt out quick. For $30 considering how in a month you make that back on cases and start making profit can't beat that anywhere else. I would recommened to anyone I know. 10/10 Blue Hole you have created an excellent game and have a fan for life well done )!

review: There s this number it changes at times it also gets higher more often then lower . What is it ? # 2 181 396 In Game right now as 02 25 HRS 2017/12/16. That s two million one hundred eighty one thousand three hundred ninety six people currently playing the game. PUBG (Source Guinness world Records) 1.) Fastest time to sell 1 million units for steam early access. 2.) Fastest steam game to gross $100 million 3.) First video game to to reach 2 million concurrent players. 4.) Most actively played game on steam with a record smashing of 2.64 million players at one time with Dota 2 coming in at 1.23 million players concurrently respectively. 5.) most concurrentl players on steam early access game . 6.) most concurrent players on steam for a non valve videogame. 7.) First non valve videogame to be most played game on steam. NOTE These are Guinness world records not awards. PUBG has also received numerous awards. Also PUBG has made constant improvements versus other early access games that are still not close to having their VERSION 1.xx near final release. All the negative reviews I see are peoples opinions and some are rightfully respected but what I can not respect or which ones I won t respect is that when see multiples' of copy cat reviews which all that do read negative are all of a sudden negative for issues occurring since back when people have started back to the beginning of their 100 hours. Even more hours going back to when the ones complaing about alot of the issues which have been prevalent in discussions reviews google searches etc. Simply put I m not going to play a so called crap game from me seeing what some people are saying calling bad crap game for 100+ hrs then hop and a band wagon to throw in snarky reasons that are trivial in their attempt or an attempt to un fairly are trying to bring down the rating in m opinion of one of a sincere game developer and with their team whom genuinely shows effort constantly listening to feed back you can get support if needed .Also they are not trying to make you gamble with micro transactions or up charge you make a quick buck. Also they're not trying to screw over early adopters of the game with the release of 1.0 coming this week. If this shoe fits wear it . My cons of PUBG are as follows I also know the main issues plaguing the game right now the most serious is cheaters . Also can we talk about region locking to have teamates to communicate to such as english speakers with english speakers whether from asia to australia and the USA. This is a team game after all isn t it? Then let s talk about how stupid it is that i have to constantly ask people if they have a mic so I can work with them as a team.It s 2017? Isn t it ? So why isn t it addressed that the game isn t able to put mics wiht mics no mics with no mics together also did I mention cheaters ?!? My pros OF PUBG are as follows Addicting Fun Team driven Communication driven Every game is different for me Entertaining Mild to wild random personalities Able to meet new gaming buddies You get to have chicken dinners all the time I recommend this game and would recommend PUBG 10 out of 10 times for the pc.

review: I don't know why people are saying that there are so many cheaters but there are not especially since they started cracking down on them. Don't believe those theories you hear about them keeping the cheaters so they can buy marketplace items for more profit. It's utter BS and stupid (and very time consuming for a said cheater which makes no sense in today's world). This is a great game that I would highly recommend as long as you don't have a crappy computer. An Intel i5 2500k and GTX 760 should be fine on optimal settings 1080p. You don't want some of the settings high anyway. Hope I helped and again it's worth $30. Could've been $59.99 like the rest.

This is a long review but at the end of the day i would really recommend just buy another BR game tons are coming out and we already have some amazing ones i will end the review here.

review: You either love this game or you hate it. I've been playing this game since early access and it has gotten much better since then but there's still a lot of improvement this game requires in order to be on the same level as other shooters. The worst part of this game is the netcode. In high action situations (lot of people battling) you will get desync. Doesnt matter how baller your PC is or how many hundreds of dollars you pay per month on your ISP desync will happen. The game code is there but Its impossible to get 144FPS constant unless you're playing at Ultra Low graphics and you don't hot drop.All that being said this is still on of my favorite gaems to play currently. How the metagame has developed over all the balance patches makes this game interesting. Up until the last balance patch ARs/SRs/DMRs were by far the best guns to have in any situation. Now the shotguns will 1shot people much more prevelantly and SMGs as a whole are very strong even in mid range situations. Optics are very interesting now since they added 3x and 6x. You don't have to grind for that Red Dot and 4x/8x or you are useless like before.The best part about this game is the fact that you can choose your playstyle. Its not like COD where you have to play Hyper Agressive or you're a bad. You can play super risk averse and do well. To be a great PUBG play you need to know how to be risk averse but still be able to bang like clutching a CS GO match.TLDR 7/10 good game but it could be way better if PUBG corp had better devs.

review: This is one of those games that can be super exhilarating when you reach the top 10 and you're duking it out for that chicken dinner. I put some time into it on account of a friend's recommendation but it just isn't for me.I regularly find myself looting for 10 20 minutes only to die in a gun fight. I find the gun mechanics for this game to be extremely frustrating with little feedback on improvement. I try to shoot just like how I see them do it on youtube and I can't seem to get enough shots to land. Sure I secure a kill now and then but regularly am I outgunned at longer ranges by people with crappier guns. The gun mechanics feel like your arms are pool noodles and you're trying to hold your aim steady while the enemy is landing every bullet on you. Often you will have a long 30 minute match to die from some unknown location. You will never get this time back. Playing with friends is probably the best way to go since you'll have communication. However because the looting is super random or if you have played so long you know some of the guarnateed loot locations you can find yourself without a proper weapon to help your team. The worst being if you die to some suicidal guy at the beginning of the match and have to watch your three buddies play for 30 minutes on spectate. The survival factor is great it really is but it quickly becomes a rinse and repeat with little depth. If you can aim with these unweidly weapons great you'll make for some impressive youtubing. However I would strongly recommend you pick up a game with a little less RNG determining how much time you'll be wasting. I really don't know how latency factors in when there's 100 people but I know there have been lots of rumors of cheaters and when you just get smoked by some guy with a shotgun from super far away you kind of scratch your head and ask wtf am I doing.Also they won't let you mute global voice so you have to hear people scream and try to annoy you. It hides behind the alpha sign but we all know this game won't be done for a couple of years and when that happens the player base will have lost interest and moved on. Seriously like 90% of games out there. Play solo at your own risk. It's a camping fest until you've dumped hours into this game to adjust for the aiming mechanics and then it's luck.

review: Here i was thinking this was just another FPS multiplayer until i actually played it. I was drawn off of multiplayer shooters like CSGO and similar online games because of the community and how competitive it got. I just wanted to have a fun experience and this game is bringing me back. Whats good about it is that the players dont have a rank system and you start off with nothing but your fists. You are first seen in a crashing jet and when it jets over the island it will give you time to choose where you start by jumping out of the plane. the only problem with this is that people leave at the same time and there could be like 20 people in the same area making it a hunger games simulator and you would just die as soon as u landed.The game itself is bugged but thats to be expected from an early acc. game. I also dont like how quickly they shrink the map. if you are too far away because say if you wanted to start at the edge of the map. you only got a few minutes to sprint towards where the border will be. i know thats to prevent players from doing nothing but its too short i feel. i have experianced lag spikes mid game dropping to zero frames and getting killed. Its fixable tho. im not picky or about it.I do wish for there to be a kill cam or something. when im checking corners in what i think is a empty town. bam im dead. I dont know where it came from and would like to know.Finding guns and equipment is a good concept and if they add a strict anti cheat policy and keep polishing the game and keep adding cool stuff. It has alot of potential. Overall Go for it.

review: RIght now is probably the best game out there that worth your time....its fun competitve and a great overall experience.I am dissappointed from the game perfomance tho but due to the fact that it is on early access state i wont consider it a negative and i will keep recommending this game.It is laggy slow responsive bad optimization atm rarely crush my whole system but it does and it is annoying I am using i7 6700k at 4.6ghz 32gbs ddr4 3200mhz ram samsung 850 evo ssd and gtx 1080 evga ftw oc'ed to 2000+mhz gaming on asus asus mg279q 2k 144hz ips panel monitor.Now this is not a specs show off and i underestand nobody gives a damn about my specs but i have pretty high end machine and i am having 70 90fps on main menu....50 105 fps in game...mostly around 60 70fps.I felt the need to write down my specs so people wont consider telling me "upgrade your potato". Still the game has really poor perfomance. I know is the early access but still....games that doesnt runs smooth kind of push me away...i will give it a couple weeks to get patched then i will be back for more....

review: Sheesh these Negative recommending this game is not good guys seriously. I'm in South Africa and this is the best update i have seen with my below minimum cpu requirement i3 220 cpu but gtx 970 and 200 240 KBps internet speed. You guys got what you want so bad the graphics quality and a few other things but all you care about is the cheaters/hackers and decide to give negative reviews on a game that has so many players playing that the game went down a bit and devlopers had to fix it. I think they are doing their best at trying to ban/stop all the cheaters/hackers. They probably don't want to loose their reputation of the amount of playing e.t.c. if they do then the game won't be much talked about on the internet loosing people hearing reading about about and thinking or trying to buy the game (Advertisment news achievements). Okay we get about the cheaters part but really their are so many players out that it is hard to be able to ban/stop all the cheaters in the game so just live with it or play something else until there are less hackersOMG the new Update/the 1.0 pc launch is better than i expected. nice and smooth even on my i3 220 cpu with gtx 960dispite the cheating that people are talking about (get over it you got the most out of the 1.0 pc launch sheesh).Thnx you developers for this update and all your hard work. i am loving the update and the game itself.My Graphic qualit has up the anti even though i have a i3 220 cpu which is below the minimum. texture "medium" rest "low" but with very little lag once every minute. before 1.0 my graphic settings were all "Very Low"I pay my respect to the developer for their hard work and this game and what they have done so far. I would pay them a lot of money just for this and their hard work.

review: Product received for free. Truly one of the most hated games which I just found revolutionary.Yes PUBG has become quite the storm in the PC gaming community. What makes this game really cool is that it's also a PC exclusive for the time being. And at this point in time probably 15 matches later give or take it's a game I cannot NOT recommend. And quite frankly I feel a lot of the hatred is due to the popularity which is fine with all things popular comes hatred.There are a few elements I just adore. One being the cooperative aspect the need to work together to achieve one goal victory and survival. So this game has some what little room for just trolling around. It has a very open world environment which is quite refreshing coming from a game like Counter Strike. There's nothing more pleasurable than enjoying a ride on this gorgeous map especially with your squad mates. Something special about the open environment kind of like GTA5 the graphics in this game are also beautiful even on medium. Yes it has a difficult learning curve even for those familiar with the FPS genre. But I embrace the challenge because it feels authentic. I fully understand why this game is so popular it's a lot of fun. And I haven't even been playing with English gamers but I find a way to speak Mandarin maybe I'll learn a lot in a month or two.Learning curve is tough but once you get the hang of it things become more straight forward. Extremely team oriented in good ways. With these types of online games it really makes you hooked. Enjoying the game so far even with people who don't even speak the same language. That says a lot about a game.

review: Ive played PlayerUnknowns with friends for quite some time. We've had good and bad experiences but the bad seems to be reacurring more and more. Cons/Random framrate drop and network lagHigh ping or bad connection for a quick second means auto disconnection.Walking Running and just moving in general feels clumsy and odd.Jumping is the horrid when trying to get over a wall or obstacles.And our biggest pet peeve... SHOTGUNS!!! JESUS CHRIST! We can pump a guy full of 5 rounds of 7.62 or 5.56 with him having almost no armour and he doesnt go down! Then he turn around on us while we have full level two and level three helmets on occasion and shoots us twice killing us immediatly!! It renders the SK12 a god weapon! The verticle and pump are on par with the SK12!ProsIf forgetting about the shotguns... Most firefights are intense and interesting always with the better marksman coming out on top.Driving is fun and hilarious! Especially doing backflips on motorcycles!Airdrops add hot zones with intense action and a "good" reward.Grenades are done decently with the accuracy of the through being ok but if its a smoke or flash its fine.The map although MASSIVE AND ANNOYING TO TRAVERSE adds area to hold down and engage enemies.Sadly this doesnt pull PlayerUnknowns out of the sad and frustrating place it currently is in. Personally I would give it a 6/10 and will play only to mess around and not to play for the Winner Winner Chicken Dinner.

review: The plane enters in from the side of the map and you make a decision as to which cluster of houses you will raid first.Not too close to the plane as to entice other players to jump out with you and not too far as to be a running target the entire game as the playable area shrinks.While in freefall you look around at the dozens of other people jumping away from you. You think you will have a safe land and an easy time finding your first few weapons. Then suddenly in the corner of your eye you see another parachute land the same time if not moments before your own touches down. It's now a race to the death.Whoever finds the first gun survivies.Running to the shed you think you see a shotgun and you were right. You pick it up hoping the other parachuter hadn't found a gun of his own already. With barely enough time to think he comes around the corner and you shoot praying for the best.His body topples over and there are now 93 players remaining. All of which will be differently handled and none of which will be easy.For early access this game is 10/10. For a "almost fully developed" title it's like a 6/10. But it is definitely the best battle royal game on steam right now. Can't wait to see the things they'll add. Constantly on the edge of my seat.

review: after having played this game for over 200 hours I feel I can address all these negative reviews by saying for the most part they are completely unjustified the game is brilliant and yes there are permformance issues and server issues but they aren't game breaking or worthy of a negative review and are being addressed with every patch as you would expect with an early access game. Just in my opinion though the game is much more enjoyable with friends but solo is still very fun. so overall don't listen to these negative reviews you will like the game and if you are on the fence about getting it buy it there's a steep learning curve but the game is great. (note if you have a low end PC the game will not be as enjoyable)

review: PUBG or Player Unkown's Battlegrounds. The concept of this game is to persevere against all odds and win. So how do you do that? Well you don't.Now hold your pitchforks and let me explain. First of all let's start with the hackers. There is an abundance of them everywhere you look. The hacking client is not hard to install and it gives you x ray vision so you can see through walls. The other issue that must be addressed is the player circle. You will get a notification that says 'player circle closing in one minute' but that is not true you get half of the time needed. Try it out right now if you don't believe me. Also the lag and latency when dropping down does not help this game either.This game is in early access but I hope some of these issues will be fixed. It should not be that easy to download a hacking client for a game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Easily the best game on Steam.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've never been interested in multiplayer games I tried WoW years ago for a few days and I've played Rocket League with friends for maybe 7 8 hours but that's it. PUBG however has really got me hooked big time. I play on Solo servers and it's ideal for me because I don't need to or want to talk with other players. To save your ears CTRL + T mutes the chat.I like that each match is fairly short at about 30 minutes max if you can keep yourself alive to the final circles and if you do get killed in a few minutes you'll be again in a plane heading for Erangel with the other psychos. Jump out of a plane parachute to a promising huddle of houses find a gun and some ammo maybe a car and try to survive until someone shoots you. Rinse and repeat. Bit like Groundhog Day really. Except with the sound of your heart thumping in your ears. It's quite intense sometimes.My few complaints are that jumping is quite annoying but Bluehole are working on a vaulting/climbing mechanic so that should fix that annoyance. Also the game can get a bit repetitive with one map so far but they are working on new maps which will be different in size and location there will be smaller maps than Erangel maybe more fitting for close combat. They also recently added forced first person servers and it's a nice addition as a first person viewpoint feels more claustrofobic and when you peek around corners or over the walls you run the risk of exposing your position. I've no preference between the viewpoints myself I like to play on both.Paid crates and their introduction in Early Access against promises seem to have riled some people up but as these are cosmetic items that you don't need to win I don't mind.My PC (i7 4771 3.50GHz/8Gb/GeForce GTX 780M) isn't a powerhouse (mobile GPU and all) and I have to set settings quite low to get good frame rates (fluctuating around 50 fps) but as the game is in Early Access it is being optimized and frame rates probably will get better but of course PUBG will never look great on my PC.

review: 420 hours wasted. Ya know I accepted when this game came out my computer wouldnt be able to run it perfectly. And I stuck through it because I knew since Greene had direct influence to the game unlike H1Z1 that the games graphics would soon become optimised. And slowly they did I had perfect optimisation for 3 days after the last patch. Now its back to fps drops and server connectivity issues when the dev team is trying to roll in stacks with the paid crate system. Now ive wasted 420 hours of my life and have my in my hand because I thought this game would actually come to its true potential for the masses.

review: Having played this game for 30 hours now I think it is enough to make myself an oppinion on it.First of all did I have fun playing it ? Yes but only during short bursts. There is an adrenaline feeling during the matches that is unmatched yet the problem is they are very few and far between. Most of the time you will spend in this game will either consist of you running to the next zone because you were unlucky enough to find no vehicule and to drop far away from the circle or it will consist of you hiding in a house for 20 minutes because you got lucky and most of the circles were in your location.None of these 2 are any fun they are both pretty boring and the only way to really win a match (unless you are some kind of god like DrDisrespect). But that doesn't grant a bad review does it ? After all you still have fun when you hear soundsteps and yourself only to find out you have the advantage and then manage to kill the person and grab his loot. This is fun but only on one side the side of the winner. The looser will feel cheating and 95% of the time when he looks at the death cam he will either see someone camping or somone running and just stumbling on you by coincidence and getting a free kill.But still the game is still fun from time to time why do you not recommand it ? Well it turns out this game is supposedly not in early access anymore but it also turns out that this game still feels like an alpha test. The presentation is attrocious with clipping everywhere bugs in all directions money not being given at the end of a match for some reason terrible optimisation (GTX 1060 manually Overclocked with an I7 7700K and 16GB of RAM and I still get huge framerate dips and other problems like crashes midgame) and above all else terrible graphics.You might think this game looks okay and I agree it doesn't look terrible but it has absolutly no personality it's bland and the draw distance has some major issues. You see you are supposed to hide in the grass that's why they made it so that you can't remove it but they also made it so that it disappears after a fairly short distance. It means that when you are hiding in grass the player a hundred meters away will see you right in the open. This completly breaks the flow of the game and you suddenly rage after watching the death cam and leave the game frustrated.The shooting is also attrocious it feels like you are playing some bad shooter made in Unreal Engine in 2 days. Weapons have poor accuracy in third person but also in first person which is weird. There's a problem when I shoot 20 bullets with my revolver at an ennemy 50 meters away and only one of them hits him even tho he wasn't moving much (I was flanking his cover) and I have aiming right at him in first person. Its downright dumb and frustrating. It also doesn't feel good at all. Can't we just have a Battle Royale that doesn't play like crap but instead has some good mechanics and shooting ? This game would already feel a 100 times better if the shooting was more like Battlefield with higher recoil.And the worst part of all this is that it costs 30 . Don't spend money on that game just download Fortnite or simply don't play a Battle Royale game. At least Fortnite has some personality and good shooting PUBG is a broken mess.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I can kind of see the hacker part even though I have only seen 1 in my time of playing this game since July of 2017. Everyone who has read this comment and is thinking about getting the game get it. It's so much fun. Lots of people hate on this game because of things like Fortnite or in game purchases. If you have any interest at all get it because it is only on sale for a limited time. Just for referance I have a 1050ti and i can run all high settings at consistent FPS ratings of 60. There is a reason it was the most played game of 2017 with over 35 000 000 copies sold. And the in game purchases are not required. Just like in CS GO the most well known game in PC gaming history (even if you didn't play it) there will be in game purchases for a payed game. Wow... Such a big deal. I can"t BARE the pain!!!! AHHHH! (that was sarcasm btw). If you don't like the in game purchases which are only $2.50 for crate keys (just like csgo) then don't get the in game purchases. It doesn't mean you can't buy the game. It is purely for aesthetics. So go on ranting about the most minimal parts of this game but don't come crying back when you can't get a single win in Fortnite. This is easily the most fun I have had in a game.

review: When this game is working it's great. There are obviously bugs that still need to be worked out but they know that and are addressing them. The game experience is great. It can be very exciting frustrating anxiety inducing and many other adjectives you want to throw at it which is what makes it addicting. The only other game that I have ever played that gives you the same adrenal rush was "The Culling" but unlike this game The Culling devs completely fire bombed their own game with horrible updates. PUBG irons out flaws which also means the occasional side bug...it happens. It's still worth getting.For all the people freaking out about adding paid crates...calm the F$%&amp down. Yes they made a ton off of the initial sales but they are a company. You think upkeep of servers and staff is free? If they truly didn't care they would just take your money and leave the game as it is and walk away. No company sells a product and then gives you lifetime service for free just to watch their profits slowly dwindle away to nothing over time.

review: Quite possibly one of the most infuriatingly addicting games I've ever had the pleasure of playing.Put out into an 8x8km map with up to 99 other folks your objective is to be the last and only braindead ninny left alive. But let me back up infuriating? Yep. Nothing is more infuriating than when you walk out of the Military base weaving and dodging the other shmoes who dropped there with you. You've got a Karabiner 98k sniper an 8x scope and the dark clothing to match your soul. Set right? Nope. Some wankoff who grabbed a pistol and got a supremely lucky headshot when he came around a corner. You died. Infuriating.Now your only option is Ragequit? Or load up a new game and try again. 9.9/10 times you're going to pick the latter.Just like you'll pick up this game. And strive for the almighty Chicken Dinner. (Spoilers its Boston Market).

review: Player movement is awful. It's one of those things where they made it so realistic they killed the fun. Yes in real life there is some acceleration time to get up to speed when running but you don't notice it in practice. In this game player movement is more like driving a boat. A boat that gets hung up on things constantly.Player movement and controls literally feel more natural on the mobile version of the game. And at least on mobile there aren't small objects below your live of sight that you're constantly getting stuck on.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: A game that everyone plays for hundreds of hours made by people far less talented than AAA devs but still keeps most of them coming back for more.There is no equivalent experience to this game on the market right now. It is exhilarating and a lot of fun with friends.If you live in a non mainstream region you might have server issues. They aren't the greatest devs and are still working towards it.Game continually has interesting new modes content and weapons that keep you coming back for more.You'll get an itch for the game that nothing else will scratch.It's popular so Chinese people try and exploit it. They actively do everything they can to prevent it.Good game is good sorry it's not perfect can't wait for the new map &lt 3

review: I have never written a review before but here it goes Pros this game is very fun to play with your friends and makes you focus on your surroundings in order to keep on living... it is quite a unique feeling to be the final 10 alive in a tiny circle and you are just waiting for the right moment to shoot the last person so overall i would say its a really fun game cons this is a wide spread issue if im corret but there is a serious problem with textures right now i have a i5 6500 cpu which is pretty good and a gtx 1060 6gb and 8gb of ram. now i can max pretty much every single game i play and this includes pubg however no matter the setting i have this dumb bug where it takes like 30 seconds to a minute for the building textures to load in which often gets me killed. I've read lots of forums and looked through redit and they all say to upgrad to an ssd or boost my ram to 16gb. now that may make sense to some people but i personally will never beef up my system for one game due to an unoptimized engine. i can max every single other game textures loading fine so i see no reason why this one wont be able to in the future so until then ill just play with friends and die right off the start like usual.Final thoughts if you have an ssd and 16gb of ram then go ahead its a lot of fun. if you have a normal drive and the standard gaming ram of 8gb then maybe hold off until they fix this stupid issue

review: Yeah there are some hackers and I've been killed by a few but if you can grab some friends and just mess around in a world where everything/one is trying to kill you then get this game. It's not just about winning its about hearing little kids scream into their mic as you proceed to beat them in the head with a crowbar or frying pan while one of your friends plays the soviet anthem. It's about making 20 year olds yell at you for camping behind a door even though it's a perfectly legitimate strategy. Here's one thing though even if your computer meets the minimum requirements its still gonna run like crap you need GTX 1050ti or 1060 at the least for "GOOD" performance. All in all 9.3/10 Get some friends first.

review: Product received for free. I've had this game for almost a month now.The first time I played this I could not get 60fps constant at all. It would always drop into the 40's and I may not have the BIGGEST system (g4560 rx 470) but I figured even on lowest I'd be able to get the good FPS. Well few days ago PUBG released a Optimization update and fixed everything. I almost never drop FPS. Anyways...PROS Arma like feel dev made the Battle Royal mod for Arma 3 inspired by that game. Graphics can look really good or really bad. There's player customization for in game currency you get from playing and can also be purchased on steam Battle eye anticheat so there's almost never any cheaters excluding some teleports you can come across on youtube. Switch between first person or third person first person driving is almost as good as a simulator. You will catch yourself making car noises.CONS De sync issues since everything is mostly client sided can die behind corners or can die after you're down on your screen. Visibility issues can happen some people use "ReShade" to increase/decrease contrast or saturation to get better visibility Sound my computer is at 50% and the game volume is maxed the volume is still really quiet but this may be me.Conclusion Buy this game. Winning is the most satisfying thing after camping with the EXTREME gear. Very fun.

review: This is my OPINION which means even if I recommend the game or not the review only helps you to decide for yourself with some pros and cons I've come across playing the game.30 dollar price is not too bad at the moment cheap enough for people to get and expensive enough for hackers to not buy it after many bans please no sales.UPDATED 29.03.2018 Or just the 1.00 update.Pros ++ Fun as hell.+ Gun variety.+ Foliage bushes and trees are excellent for gameplay decisions.+ Ability to somewhat decide your spawn location.+ High skillcap. Even with the worst spawn you can make your way to the top by playing it smart.+ Fast paced matched (30minutes max) Might be con for some. They can still feel slow if you like camping playstyle.+ First person mode and third person mode for variety of gaming they feel completely different and fresh from each other.+ Static weathers variety rain fog and about three different sun levels. Now there are two maps!+ Dedicated DEV's with long lifespan planned for the game.+ Vaulting was something I never expected to like makes looting way more enjoyable.Cons Somewhat broken HITREG shoot someone find out in killcam you never shot really annoying. Game doing stuff like hitreg and smokes for example on clientside leads to conflicted firefights. Performance issues/Optimization issues large fixed out but still not best 70 105 fps GTX 1070 i7 3770 8gb RAM in 31.12.2017 SSD or high amount of fast RAM is almost a must have. Do not believe the minimum system requirements as of 30.10.2017 The developer has broken some word's about adding microtransactions during the EA period of the game. This might be a minor con for some people and major to others if you care about developers complete transparency and integrity. Constant fixes on games optimizations that get broken after few patches only to be repaired to same state and not improved upon. Rng "Algorithm" on this game seems broken mostly noticable when map gets selected you can easily get either map 5 times in row loot piles being same items. Unbalanced BP rewards from different party modes it makes no sense to gain 700 bp from top 10 solo and 170 from top 10 squad mode games take similar amounts different kind of effort to win but doesnt justify huge difference like this. Official 1.0 release was a complete joke just a way for the devs to get community off their back while piling usual "weekly updates" into one bigger patch. Bugs are rampant.Neutral 00 Clear concept of a game with clear path to launch and beyond 2018 we have a celar roadmap now!0 Not able to select the maps/map variety you want to play can be bothersome.0 New lobby system is way better than the old one can still get some work done.0 Gun skins some variety but not much good for people who care about these tho! What does that make of the game? Bumpy as hell early access period with somewhat okay launch good features added but the game didn't feel like release yet more like polished early access title.Will this great early access success last beyond the bumpy release? Probably but it does not feel like it is a real release yet.Recommended even after mostly negative opinions for past year of the games early access period. The game has a promising future with fun as hell gameplay as for now.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Well this is the game that started the whole "Battle Royale" craze. Heavily inspired by movies such as "Battle Royale" and "The Hunger Games" PUBG has up to 100 unarmed players parachuting onto a large island finding weapons and then fighting to the death in an ever shrinking circle until there's only one player remaining alive to be declared the winner. There are a number of islands to play on and each have different terrain vehicles to ride on and special weapons. To keep players off balance there are helicopter loot drops which can be picked up for powerful weapons camoflague and armour. Additionally there are "red zones" which are subject to random artillery bombardment making them temporarily dangerous to enter. Falling outside the shrinking circle also harms players so all remaining players are eventually forced into close quarters combat. Getting to the end results in many tactical and strategic decisions working out in your favour against the gameplay circle and other players.It's a more mature game with an attempt at realism and correct physics. Definitely no building or craziness as you may have seen in PUBG's most well known clone "Fortnite".The sense of fear and tension when you first play the game is amazing and winning against 100 players the first time is an experience that you are unlikely to ever forget IF you can do it! Since it's random every time you play no two games are ever alike. Will you go in guns blazing and kill as many people as possible? Or will you hide for as long as possible to snipe the last player remaining? Or perhaps you will die in the first few minutes as you race with another player who landed next to you to get to the only available gun nearby....Play with a squad of friends is also great. Coordinating your attacks over comms is a lot of fun.Negatives? Well the vaulting system isn't flawless (it's not that easy to climb over everything) and many of the players are from China and there's no region locking. This makes squad matchups less likely to have everyone speaking the same language. Being a multiplayer only game essentially it's communities that make or break games like this and while the devs are constantly trying to improve the game (it has come a long way since it's initial releases) there are still niggles in the gameplay. Cheaters were once rife but anti cheat has improved over time.The matches are usually over in about 15 minutes so the game can be enjoyed casually in short bursts without taking up too much of your time. Otherwise it's a modern E sports classic to keep on your computer and come back to for casual fun and endless replayability.... well for as long as it's popular and you can find others willing to play.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PlayerUnknown's Battleground is a fun experience to have. The game has a few different maps that you can explore and master by yourself or with a squad of friends. If you are interested in a semi realistic Battle Royale game then this is the game for you. Weapons have bullet drop and travel time. The weapons range from easy to handle to hard to master which raises the skill gap immensely. This game however has many downsides to it. Hackers are rampant the RNG is insanely annoying and the hit detection could absolutely be improved. In recent updates I have yet to run into many hackers but I still have encountered a few but the game is still playable and fun. 7/10

review: This game is amazing! I loved old H1Z1 amd Arma/DayZ combat but could never really find what I was looking for. H1Z1 got to Esport arcadic and Arma didn't really have the player pool like I wanted. This game combines everything I love about the two and combines it. Not only that there isn't gimiky skin purchases ( except that hooded coat y'all are crazy) or terrible gun play. The game overall runs okayish I mean it's early access sooo not optimized too well but good enough to play on some older hardware This game also has some very well done co op in it. With duos it's teams of two and in squad it's teams of 3 4 . The game also has pickup and play mechanics you don't have to go through tutorials or any of that non sense .Overall I recommend this game to anyone who likes a good battle royal game. Can't wait to see more how this game develops.

review: GTX 1070 Ryzen 5 SSD hdYou could salt the roads in Canada in the middle of December with all the tears from people losing their over the fact that their potatoes can't run pubbers at a decent FPS.Game runs buttery smooth on my rig 80+ fps everywhere with settings maxed 110+ with everything set just right. I've not once had the game crash during normal play only a couple times on the test servers which can happen. It's called a TEST server. Almost every issue people have is hardware related. Time to upgrade your Intel integrated graphics card into something real.

review: The concept of this game is fantastic and I really enjoy playing it Until recently that is.There's more issues with this game now than there was 6 months ago.The servers are complete garbage the lag and desync is abysmal and makes the current state of the game completely unplayable.The devs don't communicate with the community at all.This game runs like an alpha.Would I recommend this game? If they fixed the issues then yes. Otherwise no.Is this game fun? Well when there's no lag desync fps drops stuttering glitching directional sound problems cars crashing into nothing or exploding randomly rendering issues invisible people getting stuck under the map world broken physics cheating constant updates every single day server problems pointless crate "rewards" broken BP system ridiculous lag infested horror events no ping or region lock broken match making high ping players ALWAYS getting advantage lag desync fps drops stuttering gliching broken death cam....Then yes it's fun.

review: A really fun game as long as you live in Europe the USA or Asia. OC servers are an absolute joke unable to play any game type until at least 8pm with the only server being Australia where the ping is still quite high. Every other server is as laggy as you can get and completely unplayable. Along with constant crashing and updates that don't fix anything apart from new vehicles and asthetical changes to the game there is still allot of hackers have what sems like free reign of the game. The devs really don't want to fix the main issues like server lag desync and basic queue times along with other issues that make the game run smoother. 10/10 would play again.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: For those who want a quick review I'll say it now the game is one of the best games I played. This game is fun and challenging it forced you to think along the way. And before you buy this game I recommend playing other games like Rules Of Survival PC or H1Z1 if you like it buy this because games like H1Z1 are close to this game but I think this is better than those .Full Review.This game is great I recommend this game but you need to get at least minimum recommended specs before you can play or else you have to use it on low graphic settings like me if you do not have the proper video card but overall is better than the other games instead of buying this game you can download other games as good as this like Rules of Survival H1Z1 etc. But nothing truly beats this game. This game is challenging but fun you get to meet friendly players team or not you are forced to use your brain al lot you also need good communication with your team and think of strategic ways.The game rewards you through the in hame currency BP you can use it to reward your friends buy crates .Character Customisation is great with a lot of clothes to choose from from head to toe. Also weapon customisation is great camos are cool especially now. Guns are great and the game also allows you to play in 3rd person or 1st person. The scopes are great and the bullets don't fly straight forever they will slowly descend too.Overall Customisation 5Gameplay 4Players 5Requirements 4 (It a need to reach minimum required specs)Difficulty 3 4Communication 4Price 3Controls 5 (Easy to get familiar with for most Battle Royale games uses the same)Weapons 4Notes If you do not have the minimum specs you need to put your settings medium orbelow also one thing you need is perfect wifi i find it more challenging than ever if you have bit slow wifi wifi that lags sometimes.What You Need While Playing BrainMicGood WifiMinimum SpecsFriends for more fun gameplayA lot of free timeAnger Control just in caseStrategy
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Going back to Fortnite at least that game works!!Cheers

review: The gameplay itself is amazing. The developers are working hard to add new weapons improve bugs and just make the game better. HOWEVER. The biggest problem with the game isn't hackers or poor gameplay but the performance. Obviously the game is still in Early Access. This excuse is valid but only to a certain extent. It seems like a lot of players have different issues. A common one I see is where textures of buildings won't load in. This means the player can't enter them as they just float in the air. This is a major problem with the game as getting the loot early on is a must have especially in a populated area.It doens't seem to matter how good your computer is this issue pops up on most people. This will be fixed in time but I think it should be a priority of the developers. Awesome game please keep updating it and PLEASE fix this issue.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Gets very repetitive real quick. Even playing as a squad could be horrendous especially when other players dont have or refuses to use a mic. Scores take forever to accumulate. But the worst is the overly constant Network lags and random game crashes. WAAAAY TOO MANY SHOTGUNS and the center point of each map is way too predictable if you watch the pattern of the angle of plane when the match starts.IMPROVEMENTS NEEDED A better score system. It takes way too much time to get your score high enough to get more clothing.Better building design. Too many of the buildings are hard to find the stairs (takes too much time even if you do a quick 360) and many times its hard to get from upstairs back to the ground level (especially when you need to leave in a hurry).Better vehicles What I mean by this is (again when you are in a hurry) it is hard to get to right angle to pop up the option to enter a vehicle especially as a driver. Its next to impossible to do so while under fire.Better vehicle rules on a team When a team is shooting from within a vehicle friendly fire should be temporarily turned off.
