review: Product received for free. TLDR This game is trash buy DayZ instead.What is PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds?PlayerUnknown s Battlegrounds (or PUBG for short) is a battle royale shooter game developed by Bluehole Incorporated. Originally it was a mod for the popular Arma 2 and Arma 2 Operation Arrowhead mod DayZ. It was later re released for Arma 3 as a mod which would later lay the groundwork for H1Z1 King Of The Kill. PUBG finally became a standalone title when the closed beta testing started on 7th of September 2016. It was released on Steam on the 24th of March 2017.I first heard of PUBG was around the start of this year the Twitch streamer Xiceman (pronounced x ice man) was playing I was almost instantly intrigued by the game. I would later be able to play the game when I received it as a birthday gift.Since its release as an Arma 3 mod it has barely changed staying almost identical in gameplay. This may seem appealing to those who played the Arma 3 mod version. Every match is the exact same jump from the plane down to the map grab gear get some kills head to the next circle before the blue circle catches up with you grab more gear get more kills rinse and repeat. There is little to do in PUBG except play the normal mode and hopefully be able to play the zombies mode. However it does feel different but the same with every match giving a false sense of variety. There is no strategy to PUBG it s just hoping that you can find good enough gear enough meds and that everyone else has the accuracy of a stormtrooper.The mechanics in this game are at a minimum of very basic shooter mechanics. This means you can run walk lean throw grenades shoot aim jump drive and heal. As I said very basic. Ths may take away from the game to some people as they may expect more from a game that has gone through so many iterations.Even through all of its flaws this game currently holds the most concurrent players on Steam at over two million players.Why don t I like PUBG?Some people that may read this will think Oh you re just salty because you re bad at the game or something along those lines but that s not the case as I find that PUBG is far too one dimensional. All it is is just running around grabbing as much gear and killing as many people as you can find. There is no character there is no sense of progression. It s nothing but an endless cycle that never changes in the slightest. The community is another huge drawback for me a large part of it particularly toxic attacking anyone who criticises the game. Streamers are also a problem in the community as there are countless false reports of people being banned for stream sniping (stream sniping is when someone watches a stream to obtain the ingame location of the streamer). The reason these would be false is that Bluehole s anti cheat is particular towards the big streamers as they promote the game in the biggest way possible and they do it for free. I definitely can t forget the bugs and other related issues with this joke of a game. The game is riddled with bugs and glitches that can cost you a match. The servers are also an absolute joke. It doesn t matter what server you play on because you will lag. The performance is terrible the game is poorly optimised as it can barely run on a computer 10 times as powerful the recommended minimum. Christ DayZ runs better than this! Speaking of DayZ let s talk about how that is a better game. The optimisation is far better. You can at least run that on a Nvidia 940mx on low and get a good frame rate whereas PUBG can barely reach 20 frames on the lowest settings on a Nvidia Gtx1060. Oh and don t forget that DayZ isn t just a glorified kill fest. It actually has variety and depth in its content. Now I know someone will see this and say Oh DayZ that s such a bad game. It ll never leave early access. If that s the case then neither will this. Bluehole have set an unrealistic deadline for the full release of PUBG which is later this year. If they were to be realistic about it then they should have set the date for mid next year. Considering half of the features they want to put into this game there is not enough time for the dev team to implement the detailed mechanics the new map optimise the game in time and release a stable console version. The history of PUBG is extremely similar to the early history of DayZ. The devs have promised a lot but have delivered little. The best way to describe PUBG content wise is wide as an ocean but deep as a puddle. Because of this I recommend that you do not purchase PUBG.

review: After more than 500 hours of playtime I feel it's a good time to write a review. As of a few days ago this is the most played game in my beloved Steam library (with almost a thousand titles in it) but is it the best game I own (or ever played)? No no it's not. It goes without saying that the game is very addictive and fun but it has its fair share of problems. The game looks and runs pretty good (after who knows how many patches) but there are still bugs and connectivity issues (that I find understandable considering just how many players are in the game at one given time). The gameplay is the main star of the show the concept itself is great 100 players start a game and only player (or team) can win combine that with tight gunplay a loot system and tense situations that constantly keep you on your toes you get a one of a kind thrilling experience that will often leave you shaking from excitement (especially the first few times you get in a top 10 situation). When you actually win in a match it really makes you feel like you accomplished something amazing. This game would be close to a perfect experience if not for the problems mentioned before and the cheaters that (although not nearlly as much as before) still plague the matches and ruin the whole experience for everyone. Even with the problems this game has and the frustration those problems sometimes cause it would be foolish not to recommend this game to pretty much anyone who enjoys multiplayer shooters or just wants a thrilling experience like no other in a game. Oh and the developers are constantly working to make the game more stable and balanced root out the cheaters and also add new content constantly (although sometimes it seems they could do a better job fixing issues considering just how many funds they have). Oh yeah there are also in game items an purchases all of which is completely optional and cosmetic (no pay to win crap). All in all this is a great game and an even better experience but come armed with a lot of patience and strong nerves ) 8.9/10

review: PUBG is extremely fun and rewarding for some and excrutiatingly painful for others. From 600 hours of gameplay plus another 600 of watching people stream the game on Twitch I believe I can pinpoint the type of person who would enjoy it.PUBG is for gamers who enjoy the thrill of an extremely hard earned victory the challenge of playing against other humans in PVP the freedom to play as aggressively or passively as they prefer and still be rewarded the freedom to go anywhere you wish and try different strategiesAnd perhaps most importantly the chance to constantly improve and adapt after failure and defeatThere is a lot of failure and defeat in this game. There are some bugs too but I personally am not bothered too much by the bugs. I quit playing when the hacking was out of control but it improved quickly. The bugs are very annoying but you can learn to play around them. If you are someone who rages when things do not go your way do not play this game. You will get beat a lot mostly because of your own mistakes. There are enough bugs that it is very easy to blame the bugs instead of your mistakes and if you fall into that trap you will never get any better. So if you rage easily don't waste your time.A note on PUBG Corp and their failure to fix issues the game is most popular in China and in China Third Person Perspective (TPP) is the most popular mode. Players put a lot of stock in their appearance. PUBG is filling this need through pay to look good options. Players who enjoy the more competitive FPP rarely see themselves and care much less about clothes and more about game performance. PUBG has predictably focused more on the money than on optimization. Like the many negative reviews on Steam I agree that PUBG is making a mistake in this regard however unlike most of the reviews I still enjoy playing the game.

review: This game is unplayable unless you have a beast pc...If you have a 950 960 1050 1060s youll have 30 fps on very low graphics which is odd considering the min requimentsThere is no opitmization for this game at all....Yes all the streamers are broadcasting it on twitch with their 5 grand pcs but unfornately thats no the majority of people who can afford a beast pcIn the options youll get 120 fps then in the main lobby where everyone is waiting youll get 20 fps then in the airplane you get 25 fps then while nose diving parachuting youll get 15 then while landing 30 fps then while someone shooting at you it will go up and down really annoyingSome players have found ways to increase fps by chaning files and lauch options the issue is you shouldnt have to do that the game should be optimize already and changing all this things may not even work for youI would recommend waiting and see if the devs actually fix the optimization cause right now there is nothingI can play bf1 on ultra with no problems 60 80 fps averageThis game is very fun and excitng however if you do not have a "beast pc" you will not enjoy itI

review: I used to love this game. Yeah it had its faults sure. All games do. But with this new update they have ruined it. Really. Grapichs are looking glossy and the brightness is weird now. I prefer the matte look of the earlier versions. And stability? Not improved not impressed. New map man I don't like it. It's just too much. Keep it simple like Erangel. Erangel is nice. If they just would've ironed out bugs fixed performance and stability issues and kept adding variety man. Man oh man I would be playing this rigth now. But with the current state of the game I find that the game offers 45% frustration 45% anger and 5% "maybe I'm afraid of change".

review: PUBG has ruined my gaming experience...EDIT I've gamed my entire life from kindergarten to living in the real world with a job. Played everything from Civ/age of empire/TF2 to CS 1.6 to Starcraft when the game would lose connection from a phone call to Overwatch being top500 last 3 seasons. I played a bit of dayz when I had a computer and it wasn't very fun because of how bad it would run for me. Fast forward to this past month I picked up a new computer with one of my paychecks and bought PUBG because of a suggestion from a friend.From my first game I've been hooked the thing I love about games is the adrenaline rush of an intense game. With this game its almost like every second has that adrenaline and is 10 fold more when it gets to the last circles. Nothing I love more than that feeling of hands sweating and heart pumping out of my chest. So far I've won about 8 games and even when you lose that 1v1 there's only a quick second of " me" but you can always tell where you went wrong and what you did wrong in those situations which I love.PUBG has ruined games for me I don't get excited for them anymore which I've figured out in between weekends of the beta where I realized how boring Overwatch was even in top500 winning games as widow. Just doesn't do it for me anymore.... Thanks I guess....

review: EDITED BELOW " ""The game itself is fun without a doubt and it has bugs too without a doubt but the main issue for most people ist You can't even get into a match. After sitting in the connection screen for quite some time it just returns you to the main screen with an error message that the connection to the host was lost. Happened to me 11 out of 13 times by now. The forums contain plenty of threads regarding thing but neither the dev nor a mod have yet made any announcement regarding this. I'm fine with Early Acces games being buggy or poorly optimized but if the Early Access game is a multiplayer only with obviously non funtionion netcode I'm not fine with it. PU should get back to mod existing games instead of programming a new one at least with stolen netcode it works."I got it done and it now works for me regarding the matchmaking so this point is cleared BUT The game still crashes on returning to lobby and the optimization is quite a big deal. Right now at it's current state I will keep my negative score as I don't think that the game is worth it's money right now. But as for Early Access performance and the lobby crashing might/will change with future updates. I will keep this review updated with every change (be it for good or worse)EDIT After quite a while with the game now I still say it is fun ... when it works. The connection issues are still present just like the server lags. The performance even worsened over several patches instead of getting better. Beside this issue the game still is lacking some major features which were promised on EA release FPP is extremely unstable and glitchy no offline shooting range still messed up vehicle physicsAnd besides those issues the developer devided to not take care of those bugs and performance issues or even implement new features instead Brendan Greene (real name of PU) decided to put microtransactions into his game and host tournaments. While as a game it is fun if you can play it stable Greene turned out to be one extremely shady and disrespectful person even going so far to ban someone for being accused of streamsniping of which Greene (he admitted it himself) had no real proof but the streamer said he was streamsniped (he was playing without any delay ... come on ...). Also several threads pointing out especially this shady behavior and especially pointing out that PUBG shows more and more signs of being a scam&amp run in the long shot (2 to 3 years) are deleted without any notice of the deletion. Playerunknown's Battlegrounds is one perfect example of a shady dev milking the good faith of customers with misusing early access and this should not be supported. Anti consumer at it's finestEDIT ****************************BREAKING NEWS******************************************I'm a bit late as I nearly missed it and just learned about the latest Bluehole shenanigans The amount of chinese players led to a lot of downtimes queueing issues and server crashes on the chinese side as BH's provider could not handle the traffic. Instead of getting in touch with a capable provider and getting some more potent servers running they decided to contact a fee based chinese proxy provider. Now chinese players have to PAY on a MONTHLY base a THIRD PARTY COMPANY to be even able to play the game. This by itself is ridiculous enough but in the bigger picture are not only the chinese forced to pay third party to play they are also raising the traffic in all other regions as they have to play via VPN on the servers. Oh and in a side note Steam forums are no longer moderated as bluhole stated "We're not able to keep it up too much work"

review: I really enjoy parts of this game. The atmosphere it creates is one I like playing in. It's tense and you always have a feeling of being watched so there's an urgency there to try to quickly get guns get better and more gear. Then you can either find someone to kill or to try to hide. Either option are readily available and both are viable. I really like that part.However The hit detection is bad and the directional sound is horrible. So much so that it creates a lot of frustration and feels very cheap. Those glaring flaws take a TON of fun away from a game that has a lot of potential. I want to love this game but I only like it.

review: Don't buy this game. Don't be a retard like me. Everything that could be wrong with a game is wrong with this one. I am amazed at how this game has sold so much. Its laggy badly optimised the first 10 minutes of the game is based entirely on luck it looks ugly as s**t and is incredibely buggy. if you jump out of a vehichle going 5mph u won't even get knocked out you just die instantly. If you get stuck in a wall the vehicle blows up with no warning. All though they have added a new map buuuuuut you can't choose which one to play and the hitboxes on the land are broken so if someones crouching behind a hill you can't hit them some buildings don't even have stairs. Seriously don't even buy this game when it's on sale you can spend your money on much better games. The fact that it's now classed as a fully released game makes me laugh because to me i feel like it's just reached it's beta stage.

review: This game is very poorly optimized and barely playable in its current state. Player movement seems to be synchronized over the network so it feels very laggy at all times. It's not the Unreal engine or my hardware that makes it laggy but the game's network architecture. The results of in game shoot outs are very random and it's impossible to run and gun due to movement lag so everyone just sits in corners and waits for other players to move. This and considering that this is an indie game and not something developed by a triple A studio should make you question the $30 price tag.

review: 1 Million concurrent players 500k growth in 1 month...Devs rolling in money from both the purchase and micro transactions...A game with little to no "game" in it...When did pre alpha start to mean full release...Why?This game speaks loud and proud to the current state of the gaming community. We would much rather play a game just because it's popular instead of playing a game because it is genuinely a good game. To all of you out there who think that this is your big opportunity to make something of yourself please stop. These devs couldn't care less about you (I mean look at the amount of content they've put into the game since "release". The developers have made millions if not close to a billion off of you. Yet they haven't put any of that money into development. This is the real reason that you should give this game a poor review not because you got banned by some child on the internet.P.S. I can understand the draw of this game and have had fun in the time that I've put in. It's a nice night of fun with friends but that's all it is. After the first night you'll be texting your bros saying "Hey man do you wanna go repeat last night?" This can only go on for so long.DEVS Please put some of your "hard earned" money into your game or give it a full release and let it die.

review: Great game for anyone who actually likes shooters. This isn't your standrard bs Call of Duty game it's raw and realistic (to a point). Your heart rate will eventually go down after the first time you're hiding and someone finds you before you find them. The only real way to win this game is to be tactful and stragetic with your movements. The map (there is only one right now) takes a while to learn I would suggest looking up some youtube videos to get ahead of the game. Everyone has their different stragetics. I would suggest joining the discord channel that's linked on the /r/puBATTLEGROUNDS subreddit. Easy to hop into a match and find team mates along with advise if you want to seek it out. There is an automatching service in the game but there's a 50/50 chance your team mate will just track you down and kill you since the reporting system is a shell in it's current state.Perfect 5/7 in it's current state. It's still an EAG so expect server issues and bugs. The Dev's really haven't gotten a good process on bringing the system back up quickly after emergency maintenance but I would bet every time they have issues they're figuring out what went wrong so that if it does happen again impact will be less.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 제가 컴터가 노트북이라서 렉이 좀 많이 걸리는데 그래도 외장이라 조금은 플레이가 가능합니다. 어떤분들은 좇적화다 이렇게 말씀하시는데 제가 h1z1을 이 노트북으로 실행시켰을 떄 그래픽 품질이 배틀 그라운드보다 확연히 떨어지고 애니매이션 같은 그래픽인데 프레임이 최저사양으로 20밖에 안나오더군요. 하지만 배틀그라운드가 정식 출시이후 최적화를 많이 한 후로부터 저는 40 50프레임을 최저사양으로 뽑아내는 것에 대해서 정말 놀랐습니다.심지어 그래픽도 더 현실성있고 깔끔한데다가 파쿠르까지 여러가지 실용적인 기능들이 많고 배틀 그라운드처럼 또 물리엔진이 이렇게 현실적이게 적용된 게임은 처음봅니다.아직 고쳐야할 오류들이 많긴하지만 (최저사양으로 하면 레드 도트를 줌했을 때 레이저가 심자로 나와 굉장히 방해가 됩니다)블루홀이 지금까지 업뎃 했던것들을 보면 앞으로 많은 부분이 개선될것이라 장담합니다. 또 핵쟁이에 관해서는 게임이 정식 출시가 된지 1달도 안됬는데 핵을 어떻게 막느냐 라는 소리를 해주고 싶습니다. 무슨 바이러스가 유포된지 한달만에 백신개발하는 소리랑 똑같습니다. 블루홀도 핵 프로그램을 분석해야 그 핵을 막고 그 분석과정과 그것을 막는 과정이 게임 개발자로서 정말 힘듭니다 그래도 몇주만에 핵을 몇만명을 잡아내고 핵 탐지에 대해서 인력을 확충하고있는 블루홀의 모습을보면 앞으로도 핵부분도 많이 개선될거라 봅니다. 한마디로 배그는 갓겜

review: CHEATERS CHEATERS CHEATERS CONSTANT CHEATERS NO REGION LOCKS NO PING LOCKS THE SAME THING OVER AND OVER. Sorry for the caps. You can view the in game leaderboards and you can see the top ten players are cheaters THATS HOW BAD THIS GAME IS. And blue hole doesn't give a damn. One guy who has a name like 2928959292 has 47 kills in 1 game with only 21 hours of play. Obviously thats impossible theres 100 people in a game.Theres no winning here. I don't mind the optimization issues the desync the lack of customization. This game is off the unreal 4 engine. okay fine its really still a work in progress. BUT THE CHEATING IS THE KILLER here. Theres a market place which I don't care or use this is what attracts the cheaters. And theres no region locks or ping locks. Even h1z1 has a ping lock. You can't connect to a server if you are over 200 ping. It won't work for you.This on the other hand they allow everyone to connect from anywhere. The battle eye anti cheat must be a half day working anti cheat. It only recognizes the cheat signatures. It doesn't prevent the cheats. So someone can play hours uppon hours and still cheat if it doesn't see the cheat signature.You can't get a good team game alot of times because the asians connect to north american servers and some of them cheat you can't communicate with them obviously. But bluehole insists on this stupid social expierment. They think it brings players together. The maker off pubg things we are racists because we want to play with only people from north america. BUT THATS WHAT EVERY SINGLE GAME MAKER DOES. On xbox theres region locks. But with this game on PC there isn't. And the cheaters mostly from asia even the creator said it himself mostly from asia "for some reason" Denial.The entire pubg community in north america wants region locks these guys aren't listening. They improved the market place and stupid skins and nothing more.JUST GIVE ME MY MONEY please ill buy something else you didn't fufill your obligations as a game maker or developer.

review: Product received for free. PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is an amazing battle royale game where you can find many things! For example some good old lags. Who doesn't love lags right? Have you ever felt like teleporting back a forth trying to pick up a gun from the ground and not succeeding even with your 9th attemp? Well PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is the game for you! On top of that the game is a full product without any issues! Spraying a full magazine into a person from point blank range will always kill them! Also the vehicles all work as inteded and never just go off flying into the sunset or just explode whenever you hit a fence that just doesn't happen. Graphical glitches are nowhere to be found in this game either because it is really well polished.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Playing this game has had its ups and downs I will say that. But the game is for people who want to have a strategy and more realistic game play than Fortnite or Call Of Duty Black Ops 4. Now I am not saying these other games are bad they are all equally good it just depends on what you want. You want cool skins and to build then there is Fortninte if you want faced paced future is tic then there is Call Of Duty Black Ops 4 and if you want a longer more strategy and realism game then there is PlayerUknown's Battlegrounds. The point is there are 3 great battle royal games that offer different tastes. ( I am using these three battle royal games but there are more). So for me personally i like a PUBG better than the other ones but i respect the other battle royal games and play them and enjoy them as well. I hope all of these three games keep being great games.

review: So I've beem playing this game for a long while now ( a little after it became avalible for purchase ) And when I first got it It was understandable the bugs the random freezing the atrocious hit scan and net code but hey its an EA game ( at the time a pretty new one ) so I expected it to improve as time went on but here I am 3am having some pancakes writing a review for what I hoped was going to be a vast improvement over my initial one quite the opposite sadely. The hit detection has gotten a bit better but it seems as though even with a power house of a PC on low graphics and with above average internet connection the game freezes for almost a half a second every twenty to twenty five seconds.In a game where reaction time is 75% or more of combat this is unacceptable. Next we have weapon inconsistencies. Shotguns fall into the generic shooter catagory by either blowing a hole the size of a bowling ball through someone or firing confetti. SMGs and PDWs are marginally useful but the only one of real use is the vector the UMP9 is nice (easy to find ammo good ROF accurate well rounded) but the 9x19mm just doesnt hold up the the ROF and .45acp of the K 10. ARs are your best bet and snipers are well sort of a gimick. SRs are there to satisfy the AWP users from CS and sniper mains from TF2. You can do the same thing and more with a AR. "Oh but it does more damage and rewards people for accuracy (headshots)" The ARs do the same thing but bring more to the table different firing modes for longer or shorter range shorter i.e. better to peek corners and clear buildings can fit everything from mags grips stocks barrel attachments red dots and holo's to ACOGs and rifle scopes (8x). That in conjunction with what was said in the previous paragraph and the one to come make precision shots difficult at longer ranges especially with a slower firing harder kicking rifle. This coupled with character models being slightly ahead of their hit boxes and other player's connections coming from a taco bell in northern india make the combat laughable at best. Countless times I've been in situations that would have ended in a piping hot chicken dinner but because of the issues listed above other players were simply able to use the half a second of time to dome me. I hope to see this game improves it has so much potential so much character a passionate and energetic player / fan base to go along with equally active and passonate devs etc. They are driving down the right road but instead of slowing down to see what the strange noise is coming from under the hood they keep pushing on instead of addressing the issue and trying to fix it before continuing on and even though they might get to where they are going they will be left with a smoldering pile of garbage that no one but a select few will want to stick around to play. It's now almost 4 o'clock I'm tired and a bit aggitated so I'm going to bed goodnight. Warhawk
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. I have only accumulated 9hrs thus far. And it will probably stay around that. The reason is simple Gameplay and movement mechanics.To me this is the most important aspect of a game. It is why I have collected over 3k hrs in counter strike in total. It is why I loved the Jedi Knight series back in the day. It is what makes Titanfall so enjoyable and it is the same reason why I took the time to learn the ins and outs of Fortnite. Movement is fun when done right. In PUBG the movement feels similarly as it does in Donkey Kong or in the old Mario Kart 64. It is imprecise it feels wishy washy and everything but crisp. These two however and unlike PUBG have some charm to them. Whether through their art style or the characters themselves or the sheer nostalgia. PUBG on the other hand has neither the looks nor the charm. A friend gifted PUBG to me. I didn't buy it and neither should you if you're a gamplay / game mechanic junkie like I am

review: Im really disappointed that I paid $30 for a game that doesn't work at all. I understand its early access but that means I should expect an unfinished game with some glitches and bugs not something that I literally cannot play. I have a very decent computer and a good internet connection yet the lag in the game makes it entirely impossible to play. I have all the graphic settings turned down as low as possible yet I get maybe 1 frame per 30 seconds. Things like buildings don't even load. I've seen a lot of videos and reviews showing how fun this game is which makes this even more disappointing for me. I keep trying the game after ever update and still it's the same thing. I'm hoping I can get a refund.

review: First off i'm a total noob at playing the game but i have watched a few hundred hours of twitch streams before finally taking the plunge.Anyways....If you are not a y stream sniper sulking over a ban (3/4 of the downvotes) or actually have a reasonable spec machine (the other 25%) it's a great game. )It is early access so there are some wrinkles yet to be addressed and i daresay many more yet to be unearthed. While it is true to say that the philosophy of not wanting to lock the game down completely while monetising cosmetic upgrades has at the moment attracted a rash of script kiddies which is unfortunate. but the presence of cheaters is hardly the developers fault (weeeeeeel mostly not their fault). Hopefully this will be addressed soon. For sure it sucks when you get headshot from about 3 miles away 1/2 second after you break cover but what you gonna do? considering 99% of the times you get killed is a result of you doing something dumb ) at least there's not some big narrative with cut scenes to sit through. You get dead dust yourself off and start murdering all over again.The thing the cheaters don't get is the inexorable rise of the heartbeat as that number in the top right gets smaller and smaller and from the streams i have watched that feeling never goes away.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: EDIT AS OF 8/7 Still smooth as silk and no more waiting screen. Back to recommending this game.EDIT AS OF 8/4 Game is smoother than its ever been. New issue though "Connected. Waiting for response..." This screen will just hang and never go forward. You have to click cancel wait then click reconnect and hope it actually does what it says this time. For me on average I have to do this 4 5 times to get to an actual Play Game screen. This process doesnt take very long but still.. wtf..EDIT AS OF 8/3 PATCH Game is now unplayable and I get 20 25 fps average with my settings turned down to medium low. What the happened to all the "optimizations" that were supposed to FIX the fps issues?! your keys and crates you've mad a killing on this game. Now make it PLAYABLE!!Awesome game with immense potential. I DO NOT recommend it right now because of the devs' lies and greed. First they PROMISED no microtransactions during early access lie. Second they want to host a tourney and have YOU pay for it. This is all after the roughly $100 000 000 they have already made from the game. your greed Bluehole. Lastly this game CONSISTANLY crashes to desktop. Fix that before implementing ways for you to make more money. ARK did the same thing and look where that awesome piece ended up.

review: This game is fun don't get me wrong...but it's simply not worth 30 bucks. There are literally thousands of other games that offer way more content and just as good of an entertainment value. Here are the problems 1) Game has ONLY one map. It's not that great just houses on a grassy plain. 2) Game is buggy...clipping looking through walls etc. Lots of exploit opportunities.3) Game is slow to load and is massively unoptimized. Sure all this could change before launch day. I sure hope it does for all the things this game does right. But now I'd say pass and go spend your 30 bucks on something you'll play longer than a few hours. This game should be free in this state.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Imagine yourself in my position.You find a pump shotgun when you land and you know someone is about to run around the corner you are waiting for an enemy to come around. The enemy comes around the corner and your reticle is pointed straight as his face point blank and you're thinking "This is a goner." You pull the trigger to blast them away and the only thing you hear is not a shotgun blast to blow them away it's 'chk chk' the sound of your shotgun pumping before they blast you away.

review: I like how people are ing about the crates as if tis a big deal YU'RE GIVIN THE DAMN OPTION TO BUY THEM! it by no means forces you to buy them they only needed to test the crate system wich Early Access is all about TESTS! Look i love this game it DOES have it's issues but non the less i love it way more then H1Z1In h1z1 i hated how players can jump out on high speed vehicles and kill you with a shot gun this game doesnt let that happen! yeah!In h1z1 getting a sniper rifle requires you to actuallyy grab it from a drop while in this they're are rifles such as Kar16 and SKS that of wich are very good and to be honest? pretty balancedIn h1z1 there is literally like 6 guns....i think lol i know its not even close to the choices this game gives youIn H1Z1 you cant run people over Stupid game PUSHES THE VICTIM to the god damn side!! WTF?! While in this not only would you get tthe kill but its pretty funny to watch the dead ragdollin this (At the time of the review its not out but looks Sexy as from what they showed off so far) there's Vaulting climbing jumping through windows basically a form of free movement parkour in a wayFor those 1st person only people (I myself prefer 3rd im a yeah i know) not only do they have 1st person only servers but they 1st person views looks amazingthis will have THREE maps soon They add new weapons every months! ing hell yeah! (Downside is that they seem to love focusing on making them only drop in care packages!)Ok ima be honest here at first this game ran pretty i run it on a 1050 ti 4gb but from the last few monthly updates and weekly updates hot damn playing this game on ultra everything is amazing! especially when it runs in 55 75 fps across all the mapBoats...they're always fun to have chases inGet this....People ing about the gamescom crate needing money while H1Z1 needed money for almost all their crates! sure every 5 levels in h1 gives you a free crate but once you get higher you out of luck in this almost all the crates (With few exceptions) can be bought with In Game points! best part? if your like me and have good and bad games you'll get points fairly easyattachments DO MAKE A GREAT DIFFERENCE!swimming is fun...map is big but very rich in details in where it mattersif you want to play a round or two not taking the game seriously at first land at military base i always have a blast even when i dieleaning! i can lean! yes! believe me when i say i lean ALOTAlot of people DONT know this but They have a "Rainbow Six Siege" stealth mechanic in the game when you hold "Alt" and move you're Much more quiter and take of your shoes and crouch and hold "Alt" you literaly become a ninja!Driving is AMAZING in my opinion i love the way the vehicles feel and drive also "phyx" is alway fun to play with managed to catch a supply crate with my Hood of my docia (Regular car but ironically the fastest vehcile in the game aside from the Motorcycle) here are some of MY consnew weapons are being more "one sided" as in you need to actually get them in the crate in the gamemotorcycles are fun...but very easy to die from if you have no skill like mei play with graphics on ultra everything but those who play on very low everything can see crystal clear in shadows while i cant! this woulnt be so bad if it wasnt for the fact that on low everything the players can be more"Prominant" (as in easier to see)It would seem as though the "Ban hammer" is getting "heavier"

review: This game would be good with better circles. You have idiots who are number hungry kill wise and will go for every kill possible disregarding the circles and not aiming to win the game which is the objective of the game. The situations with the circles always force this rushed scenario where those who try to win get shot in the back and those who aren't trying to win or are simply stupid die in the blue after shooting at someone else. Network issues cause players to clip through walls etc so that during a gun fight you are shooting at where you think the player is and then they come back around the wall they were at 3 seconds ago to shoot you.Summary circles need to be HEAVILY revised to prevent these ridiculous situations that will kill most decent players with the hands of idiotic players or the circle itself and people lagging need to not gain an advantage from this against other players otherwise this will get abused.EDIT Game still sucks.

review: First off these "early access" games need to stop just because can be "played" does not mean it should be sold. Maybe i am just old school but games should at maybe 60 65% then doing an alpha test for the devs and family. Then take it down finish most of the game up 90 95% then if you want do a closed beta or an open beta test the game out. Then take the beta down finish up the game polish it up and then sell it. To me it is like selling a car to someone here is your car.........oh sorry there is no oil in the car.....or brake pads....or brake lights....or transmission fluid....or gas........or side view mirrors........but you can at least get in the car and push the pedals and play with the steering wheel. Sure probably not the best thing to compare it to but you get the idea i was going for. But the big things are the loading screen you sit and wait and the loading screen. You can hear everything else going on the plane flying people talking but the loading screen is still up. /even farting around with all the settings turning this down and this up that down and this up. Uninstalling the game and reinstalling it trying the F11 trick so the screen goes to window mode and back.What i did see from the one game i got into it did look really nice and sounds were amazing. 3 / 10. I'll have to revise that when the game is 100% finished.

review: Ok so this is probably my 2nd or 3rd review on a game so take this review very lightly as I'm new to this. Thanks.PRO Action packed Fast Paced Sounds are spot on servers host just under 100 people you die? you find a game within 10 seconds devs seem very keen on finishing this project it has a duo/4 man team system which is great for me with mates. there are more but I can't think of them as of now.CON No Ocienic Servers Mic spam is insanely loud crouch walking is louder than running I find this weird. it may be only my headset doing this. massive lag at the start of a match and through out the match sometimes hit detection feels off you can light a guy up with 4 5 confirmed hits with blood spirting out and the guy shrugs it off and one taps you with his mini uzi. Vehicals seem broken but work much better than arma 3 vehicals. the force fields visibility is really hard to see through so don't expect to see someone behind you if they are behind the electric wall. hackers I've seen many youtube clips of people hacking. its sad anyone that hacks needs to have their entire steam account Vacced. we need more variation of weapons I know there's a fair bit out now but I find almost the same things in these buildings akm m16 m4 sp12 pistols. its fine but yeah would like it to be harder to get a gun and less ammo avaliable. no skins for guns I know its early access but perhaps get the community onto it now and when you're ready have a quick geez at them. probably more but will edit if I remember.overall I give this game a 7/10its fun its addictive fast paced consistant fluid and most of all a real tactical shooter. Thanks guys.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Playing this game for the first time was a huge "Ohhhh so THAT'S what all the fuzz is about!" moment. It was really surprising to me how enjoyable the game is behind such a simple premise parachute into an island and kill each other last person standing is the winner. No story being told. No plot twists. Just... madness and gratuitous violence* until 1 out of 100 players wins the match! I started playing and in less than 2 weeks at least 5 of my friends joined me. We now play as squads whenever possible and that's an even better experience you wouldn't believe a war game could end up being so hilarious with friends!Another interesting thing the game seems to very quickly pay for itself if you sell your cosmetic items on the Steam Market. In 63 hours of play I've managed to sell about 80% of the game's price in items you get as rewards for simply playing the game. I'm guessing this game will pay for it's own cost in no more than a couple of weeks more. That's pretty neat.*(don't worry though there's no gore at all just "red mists" when you hit an enemy)EDIT After a couple of months and almost 250 hours of play time this game paid for itself more than twice over for me. I have actually made money for my steam wallet by playing it. This seems crazy to me.

review: I'm gonna give this game a streight thumb down until they don't remove the third person. However don't get deceived by the trailer there are no situations like these in the game since the players will just camper in a corner of a house in the safe zone waiting for you to pass through and then killing you instantly. You can't react in the first place it is very hard to spot the players in the environment and even tho you see him the lag and the fps drops will make anything you do useless long story short the first one who shoots wins. The combat system is very unpleasant everything feels too small fast and inconsistent and all these things make the aiming inaccurate just as the movements. Not a bad game tho it's the best battle royal for sure but it needs a lot of work.It's still an aplha probably will remain an alpha forever just like the other games in early access but i hope in some decent improvements from the developers. And above all please let's get rid of the third person camera.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Apart from the fact that the game gets boring after a few hours because there's only one mode it runs like poop on my high end gaming laptop. I can run any other game on the market on the highest settings but this game....start up is slow loading is slow freezing is commonplace. Nothing worse than having to stand around 3 5 minutes for buildings to load so you can go inside and loot them. You're either going to die before the buildings load or you're going to be significantly behind everyone else. Now I realize not everyone experiences these problems. For some the game runs perfectly. However with the massive amounts of money the devs are making off this game they should have the resources to fix these issues which a decent chunk of their playerbase appears to be dealing with. When new modes are introduced and issues like the ones above are fixed I'll change my review. So till the game is optimized I do not recommend PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS.

review: Positives Addictive/Replayability The game is somewhat addictive as much as I loath this game I keep finding myself playing more.The idea behind this game is great which I believe is why a lot of people initially jumped on board with this one.Some of the ideas implemented into this game such as the closing circle forcing people to face combat with each other is a great idea.Negatives Poor graphics For a game which initially pushed me into buying a GTX1080ti OC running this game on ultra is not quite as satisfying as I would have thought the game environment looks very unpolished and even games which were made 5 6 years ago have better looking terrain and textures than this.Poor Physics In this day and age you would expect a level of Person to terrain relationship that adds a feeling of exploration and sense of success when you find some hard to reach hiding spot that makes you feel like you have found your own cool little corner that nobody knows about unfortunately with this game you do not get that experience as the physics engine is very basic and often quite buggy.BUGS So many bugs collision in this game is on a prehistoric level but with bugs at least prehistoric physics engines worked.. For the most part. I think some of the bugs which people are complaining about is a little bit blown out of proportion by all means the game is definitely playable and some of the collision issues such as dying on a crashed motorbike because you hit a tiny mound are things you get used to and can get around although tediousHACKERS Despite the devs claiming to have a hard stance on cheating in the game you will notice it quite often that's not to say that every single game will be won by a hacker in fact most games I have played I have not noticed any hackers but I have come across a couple and in a game where you can spend quite a bit of time roaming around finding good loot and even getting within the 10 player count.. To be killed by someone who does an instant 180 zoom to your head is ragequitting material..Player Base Unless you live in China you will probably only find a game during peak times I am on holiday at the moment and do not bother matchmaking during the day as nobody is on.. Seems this game is dying on top of all the other issues it faces.All in all it is a good game but in its current state I cannot recommend anybody buy it especially considering the following.1. The devs (with all their money) do bugger all about fixing core issues and adding content (that you don't have to pay for)2. There are surely other great games of this style by now which are probably a lot more active.3. The game is slowly dying the devs and their foolishness are aggravating people into going somewhere else.

review: First off I have to applaud Brendan Greene for fighting though the hardships of making his game concept a reality through the years of hard work. It wasn't easy and took many years but he did it and now is reaping his well earned rewards.Secondly if you have never heard of this new game style is called Battle Royal. The concept is amazing. You drop in a city of your choice loot kill and fight to find cover in the new play area which is constantly being restricted until one player is left alive.However there are some major issues with the game which are Bad Servers performance Hit detection Audio is only left ear/right ear also front gun shots sound the same when being shot from the back NOT (7.1 or even 5.1) Cheaters of course (you can make money from in game items) and the desert map is too big when only 50 people who are left after 15 min..walk/loot/drive simulator. Honestly I think the idea of the game is something that will resonate throughout the gaming industry for a very long time. I can understand why Bluehole created the game in a unexpensive way. I feel they did this because they had no idea it was going to be so popular.Currently the way the handled their player base complaints in the media was very poor. Additonally the lack of fixing the major issues with servers sound and cheating personally leads me to believe that Bluehole is finding it very hard to fix these problems because of the way it was developed or they do not want to put too much more money into the game than is needed. They made much more than they expected.The reason for not wanting to put exorbitants amount of money into this game is I and many of the player base feels something is off in the PUBG air. Eventually an established gaming company will release their version of a realistic Battle Royal and PUBG will be a memory of the past which will be referenced in a comical fashion towards other games.Unless Bluehole finds a way to build their newly founded gaming business and fix these major issues Server performance Hit detection Audio location Cheating and creating a map that is more suited to the way the rounds playout I feel this game will not last the player base will continue to drop as it has been for some time now.It is a lot on the table for this newly formed gaming company and I really hope they are able to fix these issues sooner rather than later. Finally I would recommend this game purely on the basis of being able to relate towards others after its' day has passed but I would not get over worked with these issues just yet as it is still is in Alpha and was made on the "cheap". This game has major potential "fingers crossed"

I think it would be even playing field if everyone at least spawned with a pistol for some type of self defense. Next point getting punched in the face with a stupid targeting system instanly kills you. WASTED 30$. Don't fall into the hype train for this game definitely not worth it. Save your money for a better game.

review: Really unhappy with the direction this game is going. From their official FAQ Are there going to be microtransactions?Yes but only for purely cosmetic items and only after Early Access." PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds FAQPlayerUnknown said there wouldn't be any tournaments until it came out of EA. Yet here they are using the crate money to fund a tournament.He said there would be no micro transactions until it came out of EA but here he is adding one that is limited time only. Which means if you don't pay for it during the few weeks it's available you won't be able to get it.They've pushed the launch back and moved the micro transactions forward. This is exactly the opposite of what PU claimed he was going to do and everyone seems to be cheering it on.No free crates in the future https //i.redd.it/z7sjytczirbz.pngThey believe the CSGO model is the best for them https //puu.sh/wTsPw/13b3a89981.pngI can't support this game any more if this will be their model and it just goes to show they care less about putting the game out and meeting their promises and more about lining their pockets. It's completely anti consumer. It's not an issue of "being affected" by it. It's an issue of "I want this and the way they're trying to sell it to me is t". I know some of you play games like CSGO or whatever and think a system like this is reasonable because you're used to it but it's not.

review: I think a review should be based on the game itself and not on the developers or their actions but on the quality of the game itself not that I have a problem with purely cosmetic microtransactions in a 30 dollar game.If you're looking for a game that is essentially one massive battle royale then get Battlegrounds.The gun and vehicle mechanics feel good and the graphics are great if you have the rig to handle turning them up to high or ultra though medium settings like I run with are still pretty good for a game like this.I dont have a very high end PC but on medium settings I average about 30 40 FPS which for me is satisfactory especially considering I've never had a PC before reacently that can run games like this.Even though I haven't played it much just due to my friends and I not being able to set up a time to really sit down and play for a while yet to me it's a fun game with a lot of potential that like I said if you want to play a game that is a massive 100 player battle royale I recommend.

review: After playing The Culling and H1Z1 I can confidently say this tops both by a wide margin. Great graphics better netcode guns feel like they have more of an impact and overall the game feels a lot less buggy. Weather effects make it a lot more atmospheric and little things like a gridded minimap and hold click third person aim tap click first person aim make a big difference.The only thing I feel it needs to improve on is the optimisation. The game can go from 90fps to 30fps depending on how built up the area is but I hear the next update will have optimisation fixes.The dev also want to add mod support which is always welcome.

review: So i have worked for a company for over a year. Getting paid $9.00/ hour. But I quit last week and got my final pay check today. They docked my pay on this final check back to minimum wage ($7.25). So tomorrow im going to ask them about it in person. In the meantime I play pubg because it makes me (middle aged white man) forget about how terrible my life has become since letting my cat outside. I leave food out every day but I haven't seen it for like 8 months now I know it's still around because I can smell its spray on my uniform when I leave it on the line. I think its gone back to my exs because thats not too far away. If that what's it costs to keep an eye on her and her new bf "Chad" (thinks he's a big man telling me to leave when Im out the front its public domain CHAD I can stand where I want). Anywho tonight the night Im getting that chick dinner so dont come to primsork. great game only thing stopping me from ending it it Carols bedroom while they are not home now that the cats gone. 10 out of 10

review: Fantastic game so far!Needs some optimizing but thats obvious the movement system needs updating the ability to vault or climb small fences or objects would be a top notch addidtion to the game along side some smoothness in transitions that make the movement feel very clunky and juttered at times. Visualy its stunning which i imagine will only improve over time. I am fortunate enough however with my setup to be able to run most settings on high and some on ultra without any drop in frames bad enough to make the game feel unplayable or laggy. The combat is pretty comprehensive love the wide span of weapons available and and the customization which helps the overall scavanger feeling as the first most hours you play the game it feels as if youve never seen the thigns your finding over and over again. Eventually you do get to know the weapons and items in the game but you still never know what your set up will be in the game as each play through changes your play style. 9/10 Will be 10/10 when movement issues are resolved.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Playerunknown's Battlegrounds is a great tactical battle royale. It is esay to learn but hard to master and the mechanics feel smooth and relibale. First off the shooting in the game feels conistent and rewarding and also takes alot of skill to get perfect so good player can outplay their enemies and new players can get a chance to kill someone.Next off the movement everything from running to jumping feels smooth and consistent and with the addition of vaulting you can get to unperdictable locations to surprise your enemies which further widens the skill game so talented players can thrive. Next off the maps. They are very different to one another and give a new playstyle in each. They both look beautiful and are fun to play on however sometimes you can go a full game without seeing someone due to the large map but this is not going to be a problem when the new map releases which is much smaller in size to the 2 we have now.Attachments. They are very fun to use as you can pick and choose your playstyle to what you want in each and every scenario. You could have a holographic sight for close up encounters and a 6x for the long range battles. Also if you are having trouble with the recoil of certain weapons you can put a grip on the majority of weapons to calm down the spray.Finally the vehicles for the majority of the time they work like a charm and work perfectly but a few bugs can occur while using them for example the 3 wheeler motorbike will sometimes flip randomly often resulting in death. But the rest of the vehicles are fun and easy to use and they work how they are intended to.Now for the cons I feel like the pros outweigh the cons but before buying PUBG you might want to consider some of these things. First the game dosen't have the greatest optimisation and older graphics cards may have a problem running the game at high framerates. Second in my opinion parachuting feels quiete clunky and you will sometimes get stuck on a building or just be left to hover and not be able to cut away the parachute. Overall I think Playerunknow's Battlegrounds is a fantastic battle royale game and definatley worth a buy because there is nothing better than some juicy chicken dinner!

review: So my review will seem to tell you not to get the game but I think you should here is why. The game itself is wonderful the mechanics are becoming more fluid each and everyday. However with each huge wave of bans more and more hackers pop up into the fray. The games however where you aren't instantly headshot and survive it out win or lose are wonderful. The anticipation as you trudge through the map trying to beat the blue circle of death. But the feeling of winning is so strong that I would still recommend this game even with getting frustrated from versing hackers after hackers. Keep banning them eventually we will overcome!

review: wait what? games going out of early access in october?major turn offs guns shoot from your hips or chest level even tho you use ADS and you end up shooting the railings way below your gun barrel which makes no sense from that perspectivewhat is so hard to grasp in the concept that if you hold a gun in front of your ing face to look through iron sights the shots should be coming out of your head basically like in any other good shooterthis is not a realism aspect this is just inexperienced devs doing bad work!!!like even using "hipfire" while holding RMB the character is clearly holding the gun higher than usual (shoulder level) to look through iron sights so how come shots come out of my hips can realism enthusiasts please clarify how this is considered realistic again?i am just gonna leave these here https //media.giphy.com/media/ElF6bdaK0UeGs/giphy.gif perspective done righthttps //media.giphy.com/media/qSLMPAU1PeTXW/giphy.gif perspective done wronghttps //gfycat.com/gifs/detail/flusteredshockedherring look at how he is aiming at the X of the table and how the different aim modes change where his crosshair aimsthis game makes no sense.how to fix this so instead of changing the camera the game should just zoom in and move the character to the left when holding RMB to fix the discrepancy between aim modes.other aspects servers are laggy or down textures not loading sometimes players teleporting around and desynced knockdowns RNG zones that kill 80% of players because its so ridiculously far away that makes zero sense heavy fps drops on high end rig from 90+ to 45 or less the world is clunky and just terrible terrain to drive on most of the time u drive into weird ramps on a flat field or collide into invisible walls that send your car flying into the air render distance on low disables all foliage from close range onwards and makes it impossible to hide on long range distance this game needs to be reworked from the ground the way it is right now is an insult to gaming even tho its main concept is brilliant

review: I'm writing this review of the game as it is now so before some says "BUT ITS AN EARLY ACCESS GAME!!!"They should realize that I don't care about the state of the game 5 months from now I can onlyreview its current state. The good Sound designOptimizationCool mapMostly bug freeThe bad The game has too much travelling not enough action. The constantly closing border means you never get a decent opportunity to take your time and explore the map you are always feeling rushed. A game mode without the border would be a great ad on. Using Coherent was a waste of money I see because the UI is not very special. The game has server issues oftenYou should also get licences from the companies whose products you use in your game next time...(EOTech Colt FN etc etc)

review: After about 4 hours worth of play time I can draw a few conclusions keeping in mind the development team is considerably small and that the game is in early access.First of all I'll say that this game is responsible for the coming wave of battle royale games and that PUBG's developers should not have the ability to claim rights to this genre. And yes I'll say it I actually prefer Fortnite Battle Royale over this game Visually the game looks fine but I turned down the visuals in preference of performance. I did experience frame rate drops on many occasions even with the visuals lowered especially when the map was foggy similar to the problems experienced in Fallout 4's Far Harbor expansion. Since I am particular with how my games sound I will say that this game does silence perfectly. Since the premise of the game involves mostly hiding for long periods of time every noise adds tension and suspense to a life. Map construction is done well aside from the fact that there's only one map. Loot is evenly and realistically dispersed across a sizeable map that feels alive and dangerous. However even after a few hours I got bored of seeing the same environment and the same map again and again and chances are I won't return to the game until additional maps are added as I know the developers are planning to do. The only other thing I can complain about is the controls and there isn't even much to say. They weren't easy to catch on to with no tutorial but after a few rounds of experimentation I was able to figure them out. To sum it up there are some shortfalls but nothing that shouldn't be expected in the game's current state and I look forward to added content. As it comes out I'll edit this review.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Lately I think they are doing a great job improving the game performance over time as well as taking action against cheaters. My system specs are not great and I have noticed very positive changes i7 4th gen + GTX970. After getting more experience on the game it is now easier to know why you got killed and identifying the difference between performance issues skill and luck. My advise for players is to stop blame shifting it is easier to rant and displace blame to performance issues when they die than to try to learn. Just relax and enjoy and focus to be better. Fortunately Sanhok came to refresh the game experience and Im really looking forward to the new snow map at EOY. To make the other maps more playeable and avoid boredom I would like to see a loot rate increase. This avoids a monotonous game.Finally there is a ton of things that the game can improve but we got the negative comments to focus on them. I would like to see more accountability from the devs.

review: After just over 100 hours on this game I have finally decided to do a review. I have decided to do it in just a pros and cons list as I cannot be bothered to go into great detail about why this game is so great!PROSSimple Premise but still endlessly hard to masterGreat continuous updates from developers Great support from developersGreat listening to community feedback from develepors Great gameplayScope mechanics are goodNot so many bugs for an early access gameGreat to play with friendsGreat to play soloFirst person mode is great to cater towards the people who don't like third person or are tired of campersOverall great game!CONSNot so great for people with lower end PC'sYou can look around too much in third person (I feel making the viewmodel more like H1Z1 would helpCaters highly to noobs with its "Its about winning not getting kils" saying by PlayerUnkown. I feel it would you should be rewarded for kills and wins around 50/50 as it is not hard to get a good placement though if you don't really have any kills you aren't good or haven't played a good game.No rank systemNo XP systemKind of expensive for an early access game which put me off at first and was the reason I didn't buy it the day it launched.That is all I have to say its overall a great game and I am sure I will keep playing it long into the future! I might update my review when the game goes out of early access but for now this is what I have got!

review: This game gets way more hate then it deserves so don't let that mostly negative rating throw you off. The game doesn't have beautiful graphics but better graphics don't mean more fun. This game is fantastic for the most part with new content coming up all the time. All those people saying there's servers full of cheaters are honestly just full of or are getting outplayed/outskilled. In my 200 hours on this game I have only encountered a couple on rare occasions. Yes while it does suck to die in some t way I can assure you that 99% of the time it is absolutely legitimate. Sometimes the devs can be stupid but that doesn't take away from the game itself. Most of those negative reviews are either salty players or fortnite trolls. This game is an experience you don't want to miss.

This new Sanhok map and Event Pass are a great addon! You people that complain about a $10 event pass for a $30 or less game need to get over it. That puts me $40 into a game ive stated before spent 750+ hours on. That is pretty worth it. Again 100% recommend especiially if you got friends to play with. Just try it! Not going to lie it is a hell of a challenge!

review: This game has a massive potential and can be quite addicting annoying make you want to rage quit and question the integrity of the human race. Its not as bad as Rust everyone starts out with nothing but it can be close.I have a slower internet connection than most (yay rural america) with a decent computer I havent determined which of the two is responsible for the slow load times but I suspect the internet connection might have a lot to do with it.Many times I parachute onto a roof or near a building and it wont load for close to 30 seconds i cannot enter a building for safety or pickup a weapon if im on the roof (does this weird hopping thing).The third person perspective could take what SCUM is doing and make it so only you see what your character sees this would drastically reduce camping and ambushes. Although for the time being they have a test function of the First Person Perspective or FPP game mode in the launcher.The prospect of new maps incoming (currently one large map) is a good thing and should hopefully eliminate the repetitive feel the game gets from time to time.Personally I feel the matches and 'zones' could stand to last a few more minutes but for those that have been playing the game for what seems forever their knowledge of best loot spots means you almost always find the same people in the top 10 at the end of each match.Don't let your immediate view fool you foliage is invisible after a set distance on low settings so I end up playing the game on almost all low settings with only textures and view distance set to max The rest end up being a handicap. So try to actually use hard cover instead of concealment.Overall I rather enjoy the game with certain modes being better or worse than others. I for one find Squad play the most enjoyable with DUO having what seems the highest play count you encounter players that know the exploits of the game it seems that many of the gun sights are not true to aim and end up either higher or lower (more often way higher) than their actual point of aim. That being said I read somewhere that the game actually makes the 'bullet' come from the eyes of your avatar when in third person this means you encounter MANY players that you will never see because only their eyes are visible with the gun behind cover. But It could just be desync due to my not so great internet.TL DR. Game is in alpha much will improve currently its hate/love and it seems it will improve.

review: This game would be fun if it wasn't riddled with hackers.Every game there will be upwards of 20 cheaters aim botting and walling you with no recoil enabled.I once got sniped with a tommy gun (submachine gun with only iron sights) from over 300 metres away on single fire while i was behind cover meaning the cheater didn't have vision of me. I have recorded proof of this encounter. Every game since has been a similar experience. Expect them to have a chinese name or some auto generated one with two random english words and a number.I am not making this up. Since the update the chinese have shown no remorse for being just the worst in everyway by cheating in a video game.This game can be described two different ways When there is a hacker Excruciating cancer china sim.When there isn't a hacker Pleasant meme generatorThey need to region lock or stop selling items on the market.The cheaters will kill this game and it is exclusively chinas fault. Telling the truth isn't racist or xenophobic.Unplayable.

review: The current king of fps battle royale and for good reason.It's a great game for solo competitive fun and even better with a squad.The current map is big enough to accomodate the 100 player matches but small enough to traverse easily and familiarize yourself with.There are some optimization issues which hinder gameplay at times and some wonky vehicle physics but overall nothing too game breaking.I've had a lot of fun with it personally and I'm excited to see how the devs continue to expand and grow this game and community.9/10

review: Este juego es increíble para el nuevo jugador porque nunca se sabe lo que encontrará cada vez que aterrice en uno de los 2 mapas bellamente diseñados. Este juego es uno de los juegos con mayor producción de adrenalina en Internet. Hay alguien a la vuelta de la esquina? Alguien va al lanzamiento? De dónde me disparan? Tienen un arma mejor que yo? Solo muchas razones para tener palmas sudorosas. Personalmente me encanta este juego y lo juego constantemente.Translation This game is amazing for the new gamer because you never know what you will find whenever you land on one of the 2 beautifully designed maps. This game is one of the most heart pumping adrenaline producing games on the whole internet. Is there someone around the corner? Is anyone going to the airdrop? Where am I getting shot from? Do they have a better gun than me? Just many reasons to have sweaty palms. Personally I love this game and play it constantly.EDIT Now there is a third map and it is beautiful.

The game has alot of playability because usually every match you play is different most of the time you'll never have the same loadout or you'll have a different better position with the circle all these variables is what make people want to keep playing the game so buy it if you'd like to try it out you can always refund it if you have less than 2 hours so go for it enjoy the game as I have.

review: Since the full release of the game it just doesn't work anymore. I get stuck in a loading screen EVERY TIME i join a game.... I have a super decent PC and i know its not hardware issues... why did this game work better pre release??? fix it and i will change review....EDIT They released a 6gb patch the other day and i dont know what it did but so far im 4 for 4 on joining matches wtih no hangup RUNNING IN WINDOWED FULLSCREEN! Can't say that my review caused the patch but it is odd that it has been fixed just days after the review now the game is a blast. I can upvote this easily... still need to fix the asian POP on NA servers though.EDIT 2/20/2018So many hacks and hackers in this game.... 1 million accounts have been banned in just January. If you plan to buy wait until they actually take care of hackers before you purchase or you will waste time getting to top 10 to get wallhacked or teleported on or a grenade will spawn at your feet... in a bunker.. while guarding the ONLY entrance. Ohh yeah i have to play one match and not load in to be able to play now as well... ehhEDIT... AGAIN! 2/22/2018After a "minor update" the game is so sluggish and laggy it's not really playable but hey at least the aim bot users cant hit us with the mega glitchy running in circle fights XDEDIT....... Again! Again! 7/11/2018Been playing for about 6 hours this install and have not only seen a few people completely invincible but also recorded a guy who was just walking around with aimbot on dinkin 1 shots from 200+ meters with a glock full auto XD. So full of hackers it't not even funny anymore and all they do is release crates then try to pull the CS GO season pass thing... yeah we want to pay to play with hackers in nearly every match. We had maybe 2 good matches with fair skilled players got to top 5 and then got 1 shotted through lvl 3 helmet and armor from a UMP? Its literally not possible in this game trust me me and my brother tried lol. Don't waste your money at this point just wait for a halfway decent new Royale game RIP.

review: I love this game its amazing and so addicting . I can never get enough chicken dinner. My only problem is that the game has multiple incompletions it needs to be finished already. Its come to a point where my game is crashing atleast once a day for untold amounts of time. When you charge full price I expect im able to play the game when I want. Talks of new maps and game modes sounds awesome but when the base game isnt even finished it makes me fear they are gonna pull another H1Z1. Now that they raked in all this money they are being lazy and slow with the patches. yeh they do updates often but there are some things that just need to be fixed months ago. The parachuting is "cutting away"... more like im stuck lets cut away and lose 40 to 50 percent heath right away. Feels slow like the response time is a second off. With all that said i still play everyday . Id recomend it to people who can afford it but be warned this game is incomplete and will you off alot with questionable deaths bugs and glitches.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Before I give my review I wanna WARN everyone that you need a God Like computer to run this game smoothly. My 4.0Ghz 8Gb RAM R7770 DDR5 began it with nothing more than 10fps. You need a R7850 to run it on VERY LOW.So first of all the game is entertaining don't get me wrong but supposedly it is on Early Access I say supposedly because it's half a year which it has been "released" the developers had plenty of time to fix the dozens of glitches and/or give the game a decent optimization setting they even created a new map meanwhile. Given the price and its current status it is not worth your investment. Watch your favorite streamers play it wait until it's fully released for a real review and decent gameplay but I repeat it is NOT worth it.

review: Alright so PUBG is the best Royale shooter up to today. It is a MMO you can solo duo or squad. I personally like PUBg because it is an amazing game I have mostly had no problems with. Some problems that irritated me is "server lag" and the buildings take forever to load their mesh if you up the graphics to high or ultra. ) Overall though if the Devs do their job and fix the bugs and performance server wise. Then this would be an amazing game. I do reccomend this game like I said worst thing I have com across is server lag and building take a while to load. But then again my PC only has a GTX 1060 8GB of Ram Dual Core 1TB of Storage. So who am I to say it is the games fault?....

review: Even though the concept of the game is not unique anymore (H1Z1 Fortnite and mods for various other games) it is still good and attracting for many players. Yes this game got major of its playerbase thanks to twitch streamers and yes it is very flawed. Although many bugs aside there is this one single flaw that ruins everything sometimes. The rendering of far away objects. This type of game needs to be run on an engine that can render stuff from far away better.For example when you aim down the sights the trees bushes rocks etc load in the process confusing the sh*t out of you. There are those nasty bushes that you think are players until you zoom in.Besides that a really great early access game that needs a bit more polishing and hopefully transfer to a better engine. I mean PLAYERUNKNOWN got plenty of money from it so far that he can easily finance that.

review: I'll ignore the crap show that was early access and focus on what's been released since.1.0 released a new map with some insane rubber banding in the early game lots of initial patches to fix things and a huge amount of long time bugs from early access that still weren't fixed. Recent patches fixed the rubber banding but broke hit registration and made desync even worse. On one hand the game play was much smoother visually on the other the core mechanics were still put to shame by plenty of games from the late 90s.If you want a shooter with a lot of tension and occasional wanky physics that you can have fun with your buds with give it a shot when it goes on sale.If you want a shooter with solid mechanics like hit registration latency correction and net code that doesn't make dial up look like future technology then give this game a very very wide berth. The new company seems to have inherited all the bad habits of the Bluehole devs in making something look visually acceptable while hiding all the rotten code underneath.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is great its fun and different everytime you play it because of the RNG involved. I don't think this can be on a top tier level when it comes to a compeitive game because of the same RNG involved and its not so much based on pure skill but that to me is not a negative at all. I believe there is still plenty of room for big tournaments that would be both very entertaining as well as very fun to play because of the randomness of the gameplay. As for the all complaints of late regarding the banning of stream snipers. I for one think that is good for the community if you are caught leaving games repeatly only to stop when you are in the same game as a streamer to harass them you should be banned. I say good job on the devs on that part of it and I do not see that as cartering to streamers either. The other recent complaint that is coming up is about the micro transactions. They are cosmetic only and have no impact of gameplay at all. And I say that being aware that some people actually believe the purchased clothing give better camo that too is false. There is no advantage given with the in game purchases.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I liked watching this game more than playing it. There are aim botters everywhere. There is no bullet range limit or drop off range to the weapons so anyone with an aimbot (Which is very abundant in this game) they can shoot you from 20 miles away while you're driving an armored jeep in zig zag patterns with a level 3 bulletproof helemt on get sniped in the head with 1 shot. The lag is intense so when you actually try to line up a shot for a kill you fire your gun and notice the enemy has "hopped" away from it and is suddenly gone.When you die you don't get to see what happened to you. there needs to be a kill cam replay of when you died. This way you can scoff and rage about how it's t someone killed you with a revolver pistol from the otherside of the map.The open mic is incredibly annoying while sitting in the plane and should be muted for the duration while you fly before jumping out.Good game to watch streamers play and laugh at their misery but not a fun game to play unless you want to rage a lot.
