review: Seriously I dont know why people hate this game so much.PubG is the game people has been asking for ever since DayZ bent us over and f***ed us up. This is a alternative to a zombie survival game where death awaits behind every corner. This game is hard it's competative and you're always have to be on your watch. When playing for the leaderboard you have to think smart. It's not only run here shoot there. You have to mentally prepare yourself for where the enemy might show up where is the most common places people peak from which areas has the most players atm judgding from different aspects. Like the game as a whole gives so freaking much considering its a early access 30$ game. To play this with a friend or three is great fun. You work togheter use different tactics to win the game. Play safe play aggresive. It's all great fun.Alot of people have been complaining it's a bad optimized game. It's not bad but it's not good either. It's somewhere in the middle. And when people talk about bugs overwhelming the game I've played 180 hours ish I've encountered 2 notable bugs during my gameplay. Once the buildings didnt load in and another time I fell under the ground. Thats it TWO INSTANCES IN 180 HOURS. People need to know how to relax.As for cheaters. Yes they infest servers more in other regions I assume. I play in Europe mostly in First Person. I've NEVER encountered (what I know of) a cheater while playing here. But in NA it happend twice and probably because I played third person not first. I think somehow the first person mode deactivates the cheaters capability of cheating (Proof needed).And to all the players whining about the devs banning streamsnipers and such. Trust me people 9/10 times the bans are LEGIT. PUBG would be another unfamous game without any funds to improve it if it weren't for these guys. People have to understand their position. I've seen tons of streamers trying to play the game but people mass around them like rats honking and playing stupid irritating music and killing them. The ball is really at PUBG's field now. They got more than enough funds to improve this game. The risk that they say f**k chill in the Bahamas with drinks is big. But even if they do this game gave hours and hours of entertainment for only 30$. So people need to chill with the negatives reviews. All in all its a good game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Playerunknown's Battlegrounds is one of the few Early Access games that made through the beta phase quickly enough to be released as a full fledged game. Prior to the PUBG 1.0 version I would have NOT recommended this game at all due to its critical game breaking bugs optimization issues lags and horrible netcode. After 1.0 this game feels much smoother even on my potato desktop PC. On medium settings I can easily reach 50 to 60 fps along with better hit registration. Finally the most important update comes with the introduction of Killcam. This allows players to witness the moments before his attacker killed him and determine if it was legit or cheating. TL DR PUBG 1.0 finally feels like a game made by professional developers and not as a mod made by ameteurs.My Specs Intel Core i5 7500Gigabyte B250M HD3AMD Radeon R7 265Corsair Vengence DD4 8GB 2400Hz
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Save your money for the deluge of "Battle Royal" spin offs to come (Imagine a MGS V BR mode). You've no doubtly heard of the developers introducing paid crates after explicitly saying they wouldn't. This is just the small tip of the iceberg of a company run by a 20 year old youth this and other examples such as multiple broken promises on "definate release dates" and weird development tangents such as a co op zombie mode all point to a couple of kids who have no idea what they are doing. There actions show that they are now priotizing monitization on a game that's not even halfway developed over production of the game itself and trust to its customers. By the time this game is finsihed (if its finished) we'll have quality adaptaions by AAA companies companies who don't lie to their customers. Let BlueHole know that failing to keep your promises to your customers if one of the first ways to fail as a buissness. There is almost no chance that these kids will use the money gained in EA in an efficent productive and honest way if BlueHole doesn't go bankrupt from poor finincial and developmental decisions within a couple years I'll be in disbelief.

review: V současné chvíli tato hra stojí za vyliž prdel a rozhodně ne označení verze 1.0. Lagy začátky absolutně nehratelné neustálé vracení apod. FPS dropy nezávislé na počítači a jeho komponentách. Pády hry (jojo v EA jsem to odpustil ale ve verzi 1 ne). Nefunkční fyzika vozidel WTF?! (ruční brzda je téměř garancí průseru a jakýkoliv hrbolek taktéž)Nerozpoznání hitů (jako všechny ostatní hry tohoto typu). Nová mapa absolutně nepřehledná. Odebraly sice velké množství keříků oproti první mapě ale terén je teď tak nepřehledný jak jsou všude různé kopečky že běžet pěšky smrt z neznámého místa ve většině případech kde alespoň je výhoda posmrtné kamery. Hra je stále extrémně pomalá nezáživná. Kladem oproti ostatním hrám je velký výběr zbraní a cena itemů.

review: PUBG certainly has a lot of issues. PLAYERUNKOWN hasn't done a good job of handling the public image for the game and has questionable ideas about what a player can be banned for (i.e. stream sniping). The game is also rather poorly optimized there are lots of bugs servers go down often crashes happen every once in a while there's somewhat of a low variety of weapons etc. However I would be lying if I said this game wasn't extremely fun. The game is just so fun that despite the issues I find myself playing it and enjoying it every time.

review: Awesome game to play with friends but shame on the developers for catering to the popular streamers. While I don't personally agree with "stream sniping" (actually it disgusts me) it is something that is going to happen when you put yourself out there like that. Celebrities don't like the paperazzi but you have to expect it. Getting people banned because they annoyed you or "harrassed" you is just being a whiney . You want to play a round where that doesn't happen? Then don't stream. That's just the world we live in. My other complaint is in line with everyone else. Paying money for anything other than the game itself is a turn off. Being able to buy camo isn't just cosmetic it's a clear advantage. I still recommend this game but devs please don't ruin this with greed.

review: I played enough to know this game is terrible. I wanted to love this game because I wanted to play a first person BR with realistic graphics but every game i resisted the urge to uninstall right then and there. I decided to uninstall when I was top 5 and pushing to the circle when i saw a head pop up above a window sill in front of me. I stopped for 2 seconds to aim and shoot and i got sniped in the back of the head from someone who was camping in a building behind me. I dont know if it was always like this or if the meta for wins is just to camp but regardless it just wasnt fun for me. Also the gameplay is so slow and feels unresponsive it feels like it takes 3 seconds for a door to open after i hit F. I LOVE the weapons system and attachments in this game which is what made me keep jumping into another match. But the Cons out way the Pros for me.

review: First off I m going to start this by saying that I absolutely love this game. It s fun and different in a world drowning in first person shooters. But my god is it frustrating. It s poorly optimized to the point that I have seen even monster machines fail to run it optimaly. I ve had more crashed on this game than I have any other game I have ever played. But the fun I had playing this game far outweighs any of this. I can t say this about any other game I have ever played. The developer releases regular updates to the game. Brendan Greene seems very commited to making a fun game and I hope he continues work on optimizing this game. So this is a genre of video game Greene is credited of making popular single handedly. The battle royale style gameplay pits you off against 100 other people playing online at the same time. Honestly this game depends more on knowing the map and spawn locations and a lot of luck. Sometimes you die at the very beginning of the match and there isn t a thing you can do. But when you win a match or even get into the lower tiers nothing gets your adrenaline pumping faster in the world of video gaming. While winning a match is rare nothing beats the feeling of accomplishment you feel in yourself having that win on your stats listing and then having it taken away as soon as they update the game. Now as I have said before this game is poorly optimized. Sometimes when you play the game you will find that all of the houses are anthropomorphic blobs that you cannot get inside. This can be especially frustrating as it makes it impossible to get a gun and defend yourself because all of the guns are inside houses. Besides shacks which arent garunteed to drop any weapons. Also while playing solo I ve noticed a prevalence for people knowing where you are regardless of them not having a way of knowing you are there. I ve done some research and apparently they allow you to alter shaders in the game. Some which can even get rid of grass. So playing fairly can give you an unfair advantage playing this game. But in summary I won t be giving this game a positive review but if they continue to work on performance I will be changing my review. I mainly came to this decision based on the fact that if you don t have a godlike pc you have no hope to run this that way it should be based on its requirments. Being that most people won t have a monster of a pc and can t recommend this game.The recent E3 expo has me hopeful on the future of this game. And I hope it continues to get better because I love this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is in shambles. It is incredibly buggy filled with hackers who don't even try to hide their hacking and runs like on pretty much any system. It is full of pay to open reward crates which sucks. Overall this game is basically still in alpha despite being "fully released" already. But all those things aside this game is an incredibly fun experience full of when not being by hackers exciting intense and dramatic firefights. The neverending urge to obtain more loot the blue circle loot spawns and of course other players will be your main enemy as you attempt to be the last man duo or squad standing in either Erangel a temperate island map or Miramar a desert by the sea. Gameplay is fun and suspenseful enough for me to have sunk 375 hours into this game in the last 4 months which far exceeds the amount of time I put into any other game over the same period. You will be addicted to this game and if you ignore most of the toxic community there will be nothing from stopping the neverending hunger for chicken from consuming your soul.

review: Awesome game. If you don't have a good PC do not buy it yet if you don't want to suffer.Pros +Hit boxes seems to be pretty good.+Awesome graphics.+Jugability+Groups+Server stability+A lot of people+Your teammates will not kill you while you match with randoms in groups.+Good variety of cars every one with their own benefit they even have boats.+I have not met any cheater yet.+Lot of weapons.+Skins to customize the character.Negatives Optimization (but it is improving with every patch) Watter is not good. It gets really difficult to shoot someone under watter or swimming. They should improve a lot of things regarding watter. Some bugs. Some skins have extra capacity and it could be an advantage for those who own Coats. For example Coats gives you extra space but your caracter does not get a coat by default you have to get a skins to wear one.I think those things are the most important.See you in game!PD those guys giving thumbs down in their review for the decisions which PUBG devs' are taking in banning people i think you are doing a bad review. The review consist in reviewing the game not other kind of stuff.

review: Boy does this game get more hate than it deserves.In all my games on EU servers I have encountered around 5 'cheats' (it does look like American servers have more issues) so in my experience that is more of an annoyance than a problem. People seem to want to judge this game for what it could be rather than what it is the bottom line is that this is an enjoyable single player experience however as with a lot of games the true fun comes when playing with friends never once have I not enjoyed a match with mates....and some games can be so tense towards the end that you genuinely feel the pressure. Is this game totally polished...nopeShould this game be better with the time/money it's had....YeahIs this game still really fun to play....Definitely...people should focus on what it has to offer rather than what it doesn't

review: I just can't recommend the game in its current state.To me PUBG is "just okay " which in my opinion just isn't good enough. With frequent server latency and hit registration problems it's a common occurrence to have well aimed shots utterly miss their mark. Combined with high player movement speeds poor recoil handling and scopes that seem a bit off you have a recipe for frustrating gunplay. Since that's all the content there is in this game there isn't much else worth noting.While the prospect of winning a 100 man battle royale seems appealing the novelty of bragging rights and point rewards for gambling wears off quickly when you've opened your 3rd reward box (out of 5) containing fingerless gloves or been the victim of yet another crash. After which the crash reporter crashes.If you take away the fun to be had simply by playing a competitive multiplayer game with friends you're left with a generic repetitive game with little incentive to continue playing after a few dozen hours. Perhaps the game will get better but by then my friends will have long since abandoned it moving on to bigger and better games. And I for one will be too.

review: I like a lot about the game. There is one very big issue that keeps bothering me. I like multiplayer games for many reasons one being customization of your playeable character. You see that trend in most games now (COD Overwatch etc). The issue i have is that it takes a loooooong time to earn BP (point system used here) to earn enough to buy a "crate" to unlock a customizeable item (like a shirt or mask). I've put in a few hours in this game and have done fairly well (between top 5 and 20 still alive in most matches) and i've only had enough for 2 crates. One crate i got a white tank top (yes....plain white) and the second was a black tank top /If that wasnt bad enough each time you buy a crate the next crate doubles in price. I just purchased a crate for 700 points and now the next one is 1400. So let's recap....it takes a long time to get points the content of the crate is mediocre (spelling is probably not right) and it gets more expensive every time. WT Eff??It would be great if the items you find during the game could come back with you (at least one item) or if the points system was revamped. Honestly it's nothing more than the developers being stingy. I can't imagine that the developers havent realized that it is standard in every game for there to be a high level of customization (it helps with replay value).Anyways thanks for making it this far into my review.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Drop from planeHit the ground and realise that you got a few enemies near by Try to fist fight a enemyDieDrop from planePick a far out of the way areaStill land with a enemy Try finding a gunGet shot in the backDieDrop from planeLand and bolt to the nearest house to hide Try opening doorTry again Door won't open Walk though door OK THENTry to pick up shotgun Try againGOT ITGet ammo Try againGOT ITHide in room hoping to ambush someoneGet shot across road because somehow someone saw you prone in a room atleast 150m away. DieDrop from plane Land with enemyFist fight ensuesManages to actually kill him this time Not hit once.Runs to buildingDoors actually opens this timeRubberbands back outsideRuns back inside Gets gunKills another guy that enters the buildingRuns outside to get on motorbikeF (Trying to get in vehicle)F (Still trying)F (Finally gets on bike)Starts to move forward Jumps back offWTF?Tries to get back onGets shot and killed Now I have played quite a few rounds at this point I got 19 hours at the time of writing this and on the games that work its great The above are a few of my experiences. I live in Australia My net connection isn't terrible (100Mbps down 40Mbps Up) but nearly every game seems to rubberband at the start If you can survive a minute or two after the drop it smooths out alittle but sometimes the doors won't open ( They do open just visually they stay closed ) and getting in a vehicle is more often then not a good way to get shot. Whether you will manage to get the drivers seat is entirely luck based and if your mad bashing of the F button lags you could get in only to get back out seconds after getting in.Next is another issue that seems to be on the rise CHEATERS. I could be in a great hiding spot (Second story building in a bathroom) Next second a gunshot takes out a window Then a grenade blows the door apart Then another grenade lands in front of me from outside the house. There is no way he could know I was there I wasn't moving and I have been camping this house a good 4 minutes before this so its unlikely he saw me enter. I don't recommend this game in its current state Better cheat detection and sorting out the lag would fix my current gripes.PROS Good fast paced battlesLarge full mapsFantastic sound when it comes to sound queues like reloading and footstepsWhether you win or lose you will always get a adrenaline rush if you get into a somewhat fair fight.CONS LAGCHEATERSScopes are kinda bad (Only good sights and scopes are red dot and 4x and maybe 8x if you have a sniper) Holo 2x and 12x take up far to much screen space.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. Good game Idea bad executuion.Would of liked to see more realism. Takes too many bullets to kill people in the currrent build. The game takes WAY too much luck to win and that's why I don't like it. It's not fair. Not a very competitive game at all. It's fun at first but long term the game is very stale. I really only enjoy games when I win and since there is literally only a 1% chance of winning each game you don't win a lot. So for those reasons I don't think the game is fun. Not everyone has an equal chance of winning each game. Some times you get lucky loot and sometimes you don't. It's just how it is. The game is very unforgiving.Don't get me wrong it's a decent game but not worth $30 in my opinion. Even though I did get the game for free from a friend. Probbaly the reason why I played it so much. It is very fun with friends for a short time. If you play more than a few hours I think the game annoys your entire group. I can honestly say that this game has made me rage more than any other game in the last few years. It's frustrating to lose when you spent so much time in a single match just to come in 2nd place. There is no rewards for 2nd place. Wins are only awarded to 1st place. I wish they would keep track of your "almost wins" in duo and sqaud. It does keep track of your top 10s in solo though but overall I wish it would count my top 10s for duo and squad and top 25s for solo. Plus the leaderboards should have an "Average Placment" for each game mode to allow you to see where you rank up to others. Comparing 1st place wins with other players is almost pointless because I firmly believe 1st place wins are awarded with luck over skill. The game does take skill to get kills but It has WAY to much luck involved. I won't be playing this game again until they come out with a realism mode or a hardcore mode. I can't count the times where I shot a guy 5+ times and didnt get a kill. It's rediculous.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 玩了700小时左右了 现在全是外挂加速透视自瞄挂 真希望自己是刚买的游戏还可以退货 快700 小时了 现在一点游戏体验都没有全是外挂 基本上没把都能遇到外挂 很多卖外挂的游戏名字就是WG...FZ...KG...都是什么外挂 辅助 科技 等等的名字我布知道你们是不会做游戏还是不会做反外挂程序 还是说你们游戏做的不完善能让别人有可乘之机 我知道FPS 不可能避免外挂 你们却一点都无动于衷 是 很多开挂的中国人 但是你也不能否认没有中国玩家你们不会火 我排到外挂队友我都会杀掉他 然后退游戏重新开始 我不懂你们是真的发现不了外挂还是某些原因你们不封 反正这个游戏一天天外挂多起来玩家一定会变少 而且这种游戏不可能火很久 还不能解决挂的问题那一定更走不远 为什么不能想办法呢 比如说 一局游戏里被多人 具体多少人 你们自己有定义 你们更专业 举报作弊的玩的玩家系统进行特殊检测 比如监测他的爆头率 倒地几率 击杀平率 和每把游戏的单场击杀数来判定么 我相信这个并不难 现在就是把把遇到外挂举报还没JB 用不懂你们怎么搞的说真的 还布如让TX 代理呢至少TX 坑钱 是坑钱外怪问题会得到极大改善 反正对PUBG 映像越来越差了 或许这个游戏会成为下一个被外挂毁掉的游戏

review: It's actually sad to me how such a gem of a game had so much potential but was ruined by it's developpers. The principe was very good some of the mechanics are on point and yet it can be fun to play. Yes it CAN be. Unfortunately this game gives very bad performances with pretty much any rig. By poor I mean important fps drops studdering etc... This is without talking about hackers server lag very annoying bugs wether it is with the "ADS" mechanic driving or even hit registration at some times. As you would have guessed the game is very poorly optimised and it is a pain for me (who has a decent rig) to be constantly anoyed by frame drops even playing at low settings. So to get around 80 fps (which looks horrible on my monitor...) I have to put the graphics down to a point where I simply can't see anything because of how bad the environnement and player models look. Also some people like the "survival" aspect of this game which is based on RNG and makes you not find half decent loot 1/4 of the time. This also annoys me because people that want to play squads always choose people based on their stats (ADR K/D) and such. And with that said "survival aspect" most of the time I die without finding a weapon which affects your stats then people don't want to play with you because they think you suck. Some will say "Then do safe drops" (dropping away from the populated areas) and to that I will answer I'm sorry but looting alone for 20 minutes or getting cucked by the circle right away so you have to leave without having anything is no fun to me. Other than the game not running fluidly you must wait from 2 to 5 minutes before joining a new game (where my frustration of dying without having found a gun and or had a chance to defend myself is from.) Other than that since a little while the communication with the devs has died almost completely... The devs also don't necessarely listen to their players. With that being said we almost never get informations on patches updates and stuff like that. So at the end unless you have a very good PC and patience... Go ahead and by this "game".
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Ridiculous amateur level bugs that break the combat system completely. 1v1 is no problem but the second you have 2+ people in the game the whole thing becomes an unplayable mess and basically whichever player has priority on the network stack for the server gets a stable connection while the others get to lag out and get shot half the time before the character sprite even shows up.Asking for 30$ for this even in alpha is a joke spend your money elsewhere.**EDIT**The game has now been released and it is actually BUGGIER then when it was in development. A completely incomplete build from the test server was puked over into the production version purely because they got some OK feedback on the new map. Not a single problem from the alpha has been fixed they have infact just continued to add more and more while they break their arms jerking themselves off in their "patch" notes.For the first 1 5minutes of landing you will experience the worst rubberbanding I have ever seen in a video game.Half of the players you meet are playing from a different region so they desync and don't have shots register on them.Game breaking bugs are literally EVERYWHERE and choose the worst times to manifest themselves.The IP was aburptly sold to Chinese interest groups who want all the focus to be Asia. The original creator of this is gone in a sea of strippers and cocaine parties. It will not get better.

review: Is it a good BR game? yes! however this doesn't say a lot since the standards of BR games are super low with H1Z1 and the cash grab trash that have been released in the past couple of years.matchmaking is excellent and fast net code is good you actually kill people when you shoot them ! Hackers ? well ppl say they met some but personally I never seen one. Performace? they are improving it not perfect but playable mind you i have gtx 1070 i get 80 60 fps drops below 60 to the 40s when its raining but still playable. with bugs here and there nothing major There is solo duo and team (4 players) Q so you won't run into people ganking up when you are playing solo which is a big plus for a BR game. Almost forgot you can find attachments as loot that you can use on your weapons too which is cool.However (this is for players that are new for the Battle Royle genre ) you get 1 relativly big map 1 game mode and very limited number of viable weapons that you will use 90% of the time (SCAR L AK M16) also loot gets a bit boring after a while.Is it worth 30$ atm depends if this is your first BR i would wait till they improve performance and add more stuffIf you're a vetran BR player well you've probably already bought this game in this case idk why you read reviews for a game you already own!so here is my verdict (tl'dr)You short on money ? you have an old pc? wait for sale or till they improve performance this game won't go anywhere anytime soon. additionally there is the risk with EA games devs tend to cash out and sell their IP to another dev team that would fk it up You have money laying around ?you like BR games? have a decent pc? buy it.I will give it a thumb down for the time being BECUASE most ppl are from the former group.

review: first there was mod in arma2. but it wasnt as popular as arma3 battle royale mod (probably because everyone was hyped about then new dayz mod for arma2). inspired by infamous movie of the same name and probably with elements from hunger games this one was a huge hit. then there was h1z1 kotk based on the playerunknown's mod. and finally he himself decided to release a full game playerunknown's battlegrounds based and build speciffically for battle royale type of gameplay.and is it a success... it just took over 2nd place on steam stats from csgo. i never thought some game will come out (and in early access) and took player count from csgo. in my opinion marketable crates helped this too. people are suckers for those )now about the gameplay itself. if you ever played any of the mentioned above games like arma br or h1z1 br you know what its all about. 100 players jump from plane to an island and fight for survival. last one standing is the winner as simple as that (or last 2 or last 4 depending if you play solo duo or squad matches). process is you parachute down without anything. you loot buildings for equipment (clothes armor vest helmet backpack) rifles (and its attachments scopes etc) ammo and boosts. starting game is over whole island then every few minutes electric field in form of circle is shrinking around the island. so playing zone is getting smaller and smaller with each circle and since every player is going slowly towards the same spot on the island more killings and fewer players are left with every circle and as said before last one standing is the winner. if you stay behind in the electric field (or gas as someone still call it) you recieve damage with every next circle that starts shrinking is dealing more and more damage. if you are too distanced from circles there are random spawned vehicles available too for transporting faster towards the goal. you also get occasional airplane drops in form of crates which can consist of weapons not available for loot in game otherwise.and thats all there is about gameplay its pretty simple yet very fun and very appealing way of deathmatch. the game is still under heavy development process in the time of writing this review its in beta and the game is getting better and better and getting more and more players with time. comparing the game to closed alpha phase it has improved a LOT. and this is why i believe we will have very playable optimized nice looking game closing the full release. developers proved that they can optimize the game and make it very enjoyable. this type of game was never about eyecandy effect but despite that this game looks very beautiful with all settings turned to max (although its not playable yet that way on most pcs even high end ones due to only 1 or 2 big optimization updates have been released).gameplay mechanics are just right for battle royale game. its not too arcady and unrealistic as h1z1 is and its also not too harsh on realism movement as arma is. its just in the right spot leaning a bit more towards realism. more mechanics are yet to be implemented so i guess it will only become better. 1st person only aka hc servers are also introduced. on full release game will also be open for modding so there will not only be battle royale game mode but probably many other survival and deathmatch modes.the game is obviously huge success and people are interested in this type of gameplay. so for any fan of not only this type of gameplay but any multiplayer pvp type of game i must recommend this game as 10/10 (with promissed few fixes about performance and server lag in mind).p.s. modding will boost this game even more.

review: Product received for free. I went into this game expecting an intense battle experience where survival was based on wits reaction speed and composure under pressure. I expected it to be super serious and I expected to not at all enjoy it because those sorts of experiences are often a little too much for me to really enjoy easily.I was surprised however that the game wound up being one of the most boring experiences I had ever had. It was as if someone had taken all of the joke gameplay loop concepts from Battlefield (Run for 10 minutes doing nothing then get sniped as soon as you get somewhere for those who haven't played) and made a full game out of it. What I mean by this is that the game forces players to move into a further smaller play area and gives them a huge open block to run around in. It makes sense of course how else do you force the rounds to be short and push players into combat? Now see I would have just suggested small maps but I guess they wanted the whole grand scale setup. The map designs suffer from similar issues as heroes and generals where it is way too open for the amount of space you'll need to traverse. The design of the ever closing battlefield exagurates this fault and makes it a case where you have to be continuously wandering if you didn't drop into the right place.RNG basically determines your successes of all of my matches thus far i have not gotten a single kill. I would blame the gunplay but I honestly haven't even had any opportunities to shoot back at people. I always wind up with short range weapons and get sniped by someone miles away that I cannot see. Hence the second part of the battlefield loop.I imagine if you drop into a hot zone the gameplay might get a bit more intense but the clunky movement system combined with the clunky looting system makes it particularly hard to enjoy that either. And even if you somehow come out on top after you clear a huge battle area of enemies you still then have to deal with the gameplay loop I mentioned earlier so that doesn't really solve the problem.I went into this game with pretty low expectations and I managed to somehow find an even poorer experience than that. Maybe I'm just bad or maybe I just don't get this game very much. But I don't really understand how to play DOTA 2 either but can still have fun playing that with friends. This game was just... Dull. Not frusterating or annoying I didn't expect to be good right out the bat or anything it was just boring.Maybe things will get better once it leaves early access but I wouldn't hold my breath.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have played this game for about 8 hours now and i can say it feels a lot like day z. The gunplay is terrible your guy has the recoil control of a toddler. the projectiles seem inconsistent and hard to judge if you are going to hit anything or not even at closer ranges. There is no explanation to the game you just get thrown in and have to know what the UI is trying to tell you my first game i made it to the top 20 but died to the electrical wall as it was closing in. (no i didnt know how to play becuase i dont watch streamers) there is no real way to familiarize yourself with the guns in the game without getting into a live match and its not a good idea to do so there unless you want to get focused down immediatly because shooting gives away your position very very easily... the game is a crap shoot did you get to a place first? if so camp and kill anyone that you can easily hear coming... did you not get someplace first? in that case walk into a building to be immediatly shot by a person who can hear you coming a mile away. or get hit by a shot in an open field with about 25 bushes that are roughly player size and at a distance player shaped and try to find who is shooting you... good luck with that.

review: This game has the potential to be fun but too frequently the play area is enormous while the players remaining is few. If the play area responded to the amount of players remaining to keep the flow of the game play then the game would be much better. As it is now you will often have periods of time during a match where you don't see another player for 10 minutes at a time only to suddenly be killed by another player from an unknown location. Another major issue with the game is shooting around objects. Sometimes you will be on a staircase and a very thin railing will block 100% of your bullets while you still receive 100% of incoming bullets. At times it can be impossible to shoot out of windows or down from higher ledges with all of your bullets hitting whatever is near by. Meanwhile you are easily taken out by your target. I've had an experience where I was shooting over a barrel and 100% of my cross hair is over the barrel yet 100% of the shots went into the barrel. I know this to be true because I record my game play and review the footage to improve but in these situations the only improvement is to try and stay away from the game world. There is an in game indicator that sometimes appears to tell you that your shot will be blocked by an object but this is inconsistent and infrequent. These poor shooting mechanics are part of the madness that prevents this game from being great.When the formula works it is a lot of fun but you spend most of your time just chasing the dragon and opening doors.

review: Despite the immature and whiny community PUBG is a really great game in so many ways which is why so many people are playing it. Paradoxically it is also the reason that so many people are whining about it and giving it bad reviews. People DO enjoy the game that's why they play it soo much so many hours each day. And because they play it so much they forget about what has already been fixed and improved. The game ofc has had it's fair share of bugs but to be fair many of them has been fixed and we've recieved not just one new map but two for free (!). Fortnite which ofc is PUBG's only real current contester has been out for just about as long as PUBG but still only has one single map. One map. In PUBG you have three and you have fourth map coming this winter! ... Sure the netcode isn't the greatest but they also recently improved that as well bumping the tickrate to 60hz. PUBG is a game very much in ongoing development but it also is a fantastic game. I haven't played a game this much ever in my life besides ofc. Counter Strike. (And yes I also rage in game when I get stuck and other bugs happen but the pleasurable and fun moments far outweigh the bad ones) I would absolutely recommend PUBG !

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is the first standalone game of the creator of the battle royale genre PLAYERUNKNOWN.Battle royale is a extreme survival gamemode that drops players into a wide open area together with around 100 other players. It is all about to kill or to be killed with only one chance to win. The area shrinks over time and players are forced to fight each other if they dont want to die by the environment. At the end there can be only one last man standing.The concept of the game is inspired by the book/movie "Battle Royale". Playerunknown first created a mod for Arma 2 later followed by a mod for Arma 3. Also he helped to implement the battle royale mode into H1Z1.In BATTLEGROUNDS you fight on an island to be the last man standing. At the beginning of the match you jump out of a airplane and it is up to you where you are going to land with your parachute.Besides of the solo mode you have also the ability to play in duo or squad mode.You can switch between third person and first person view. Third person lets you peek around corners over walls etc. I personally like the ability to have both views others do not like the third person view at all. Therefore you can choose to play either first person only or standard.PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS has a great amount of different weapons and attachements. You can play currently on 3 different maps.BATTLEGROUNDS is using the steam inventory system for skins which you can unlock by opening crates some crates are free to open and for others you have to buy a key.The skins were some good addition for some people especially people who purchased the deluxe edition. Those skins (coat bandana boots pants and a shirt) had a few months ago a value of 1500+ Dollars all together.Unfortunately you can not trade skins anymore you can only sell or buy them on the Steam Market.The only negative aspect from my point of view in terms of the gameplay is that the servers even now so many months later are still laggy pretty often and the game still has performance issues even for those with good hardware.So if you have some hardware good enough for PUBG and would love to learn the thrill of fighting to be the last out of 100 you should definitely buy this game.Sounds 10/10Graphics 10/10Gameplay 9/10Atmosphere 10/10If you liked my review please feel free to follow me and/or my curator group http //steamcommunity.com/id/Ov3RT4K3R/myworkshopfiles/?section guideshttp //steamcommunity.com/groups/orcollective#curationAlso feel free to check out my YouTube Channel https //www.youtube.com/channel/UC83DYCmrWfl9ttrhX54jmWA
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It's an interesting concept but it's in very early access. I've played games in early access and although the idea is sound and seems like it will be fun. UNLESS YOU CAN GET IT WHILE ON SALE or if you're just that willing to play it. I'd recommend waiting until it comes out. It feels like the excitement I got from trying out ARK just to discover it was also very early access. Best early access game I've played is The Forest and compared to PUBG it's a lot more complete.I'd love to see how this game turns out but as it is I don't recommend it.Pros Great game idea graphics look decent gameplay is alright.Cons Cheaters sometimes the controls get buggy sometimes the graphics get screwed up not very "noob friendly" usually I can pick up a game and get right into it without a tutorial (learned how to play EU4 and CK2 just by playing them) but I found trying to learn this game tidious especially my first 2 games when I didn't know what was going on.Get it on sale otherwise just wait.

review: Please do not believe the HYPE this game isnt as good as others have made it out to be. Also read the whole review and then comment or upvote or downvote dont white knight for these people they dont care. Also this is an opinion and I am going to put down facts about gameplay as it stands. &gt Pros&lt Fun for a few hours with friends at best gunplay seems alright but there are a lot of cons that make it infuriating. Its not DAYS Its not H1Z1&lt Cons&gt (Long List) Unoptimized. I know that a lot of people will say "oh but its in early access" and "oh its new" yeah I get all that but come on now this game is being sold for 30 dollars? Thats a little alarming dont you think? For how poorly this game runs on decent systems for what you get is ALARMING or should be to the average consumer. Also the game was in beta before the early access release they knew about the optimization issues before release dont kid yourself if you believe otherwise.My Specs i7 4790K at 4.3GHZ Gigabyte 970 16 GB Of Corsair Vengeance Ram 240 GB Samsung SSD 117mbps Download Speed 12Mbps Upload SpeedWith all this I have issues and most games dont give me issues except this game and ARK..... Lag.You will be lagging a lot lag in the lobby lag when you are parachuting from the sky lag when you are opening doors picking up guns and ammo and last but cetainly not least LAG WHEN YOU SHOOT or MELEE... Melee.Total wreck ive tried killing someone via melee ..... its usually ends with you dying which brings me to my next point. Hitboxes.Seriously is the hitbox actually on the persons body or is it somewhere that i cant seem to aim..... idk ive tried melee seems like i can never hit the other person. Shooting can be wonky as well clearly aiming at them shoot miss shoot miss ok aim not at them ........ success! Yeah thats not what i want when i shoot a gun at the other person shooting at me. Cars.Why are they always drifting why is it if im almost stopped i run myself or teamate over while jumping out? You can jump away from the car did anyone think of that? Controlling cars feels like driving a rally car through mud except sometimes im driving on the road in game and i should have perfect control but oh well. Parachuting.The intial part is fine free falling fast the last 300 feet is miserable fix this its horrible let me fall to my death so i can at least parachute to the ground quicky and die instead of being shot by the guy whos parachute deployed after mine even though we were both at the limit for it. All in all the game is FARRRRRR from done and this will probably be like another H1Z1 title or DAYZ except all you do is parachute in and die instead of survive and die. Or if you do make it without getting shot by aimbot cheaters or killed by exiting your own vehicle it turns into a camp fest whoever gets the center sets up shop near a hill and proceeds to pick the others who are outside of the cirlce off. 5/10 Not worth 30 Dollars to me at all. Wish i could refundWill change if they ever optimze or make some big gameplay changes but until then oh well
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Congratulations on the 278 000th "Early Access" game this year. Whether they like to admit it or not the game is clearly ridden with bugs and errors that were not fully buffed out before release. In all honesty the game is good in and of itself the idea is cool and fun I actually enjoy it on the very rare occasion that there isnt some sort of graphical error ruining my view bug keeping me from moving/looking/aiming or just general lag that happens LITERALLY anytime Im in combat. That last one really gets to me considering a shooter like this relies on your ability to react quickly and aim well. I could say this about so many other games but if more time was taken to more thoroughly buff out all the silly little glitches and errors rather than doing what literally every other game company in the world has done lately and just say "Meh well we worked on it long enough lets just release it." Ill likely keep playing it in the hopes that one day the game will be clean and finished but I can pretty much 100% guarantee thats not gonna happen and this will be yet another "Early Access" game where the devs will just take the money and run. But hey maybe this will be "the one" theres always hope I guess. I really hope it is its not inherently a bad game they shoulda just spent more time on it. I would 100% reccomend it should they ever fix it not a bad game. Just a broken one.

review: Update 5/18/2018 Cool new deathmatch mode but it makes you see bigger issues of the game. It appears there are many hackers reported even my own teammates for doing it. Still you can't find where you're being shot from. When shooting at players that are down it seems like you're unable to hit their head. It's just a poorly made game overall. All previous problems still exist.Problems with the game. It takes a while to actually start playing the game. Queues are fast but the game startup isn t. You get thrown in a lobby where you have to wait for the match to begin. Afterwards you go on an airplane and wait until you can jump down near the location you want to get to. Then you have to wait as you re falling to the ground while moving to the location you want to get to. You then have to use your parachute and once again wait until you reach the ground. Before you reach the ground the animation of you being in the parachute slows before you land which is even more time consuming awkward and annoying. With this you ve just wasted about 5 15 minutes and the game didn t even start yet.Don t forget you still have to search for weapons and items and before you could even do that chances are someone already got a gun near you and has killed you making you restart all over again in this annoying process. It all feels like just a waste of time. I hesitate playing the game a lot because of this wasted time knowing it has to be done in order to get into the action. I personally rather just be spawned randomly around the map so I can get right into the action. While the culling is a crappy game it at least did startup correctly. For having mediocre graphics this game takes a massive toll on your computer. There are many shooters that have far better graphics and run much smoother than this game. Terrible optimization hasn t improved much since release. Melee weapons are meaningless. That is usually the big problem with battle royales. Guns are supposed to be difficult to find melee weapons are supposed to be abundant. Otherwise melee weapons will continue to be useless aside from sneaking up to someone and knocking them out which currently doesn t work very well at all. Camping is highly in favor in this game. Making it pretty boring and not a very action orientated. Most of the time you re found hiding and waiting for someone to show up. There is very poor weapon balance throughout. Many weapons are overall better than other weapons. So you just throw out what you don t want and keep the best that you find. For example melee weapons and pistols are only good in the beginning of the game and after a few minutes become completely useless. In fact they can even be useless in the beginning of the game as well as soon as any other weapon is found.Makes you wonder what the purpose of all these weapons and attachments are for. Also because they re implemented in the game it just stresses your computer for absolutely no reason. A battle royale is about working with what you have but chances are very high that you will find an assault rifle soon enough. You start to realize that scavenging is only about finding attachments for your assault rifle or sniper rifle. You will have trouble knowing where you re being shot at from. It s mostly from not being able to determine the difference between what s in front of you and what s behind you. I m just speculating but I believe it s because shots behind you are not muffled as they re supposed to be from the way an ear is designed. In a game where you die very easily and camping is highly favored this is a huge issue. Maybe people with surround sound speakers and headsets don t have this issue but those who don t have surround sound will have problems which will wrack up unnecessary deaths. At the very least until it s fixed we should have some indicators of where we re being shot from. Game revolves around sound an awful lot. This makes the game unplayable for me due to having a noisy house. I also don t enjoy using a headset. Hiding in the blue is just an overall stupid concept. What should be a thing that pushes people to fight is being used to push people to go out in the open and be shot by others who are healing and sniping in the blue. Smart but unfair and terrible for gameplay. Game has also been proven to have hackers. Game developers have openly accepted modifications to shaders. Another words if you re going to play this competitive game get a mod that modifies your shaders or good luck finding people and being at a disadvantage. This is extremely unusual for a competitive game. If they said this prior to my purchase I would have quickly refunded. For a game that encourages camping players don t give off a breathing sound unless you re running. If we at least had a way of hearing someone inside of a house without actually seeing them first this could improve gameplay a whole lot. Unfortunately it s still whoever camps wins. The controls are complete trash. Right click and right click hold give two different aims. So basically you have three different types of aiming regular aim right click and then right click hold. It's completely unnecessary and unrealistic. You either use a scope or you don't. Not sure what s the purpose of the in between one that s got me killed numerous of times. It also can't be changed. You'd at the very least think that right click hold would be the zoomed in aim nope. Terrible controls for a shooting game and goes completely against the normal controls of a regular shooter. Weapon functionality appears completely unrealistically broken. You shoot like your character has parkinson's. Several of times when near a person using your assault rifle goes completely whacked out. Your cursor gets enlarged and your shots go out of control. I mean if the person is right front of me cursor is on the player and the gun shoots all the way to the bottom right of him. I mean seriously?This game is just another battle royale game that you want to love but still lacks plenty of potential and it is unclear what will come out of the game. Right now it just feels like a very lacking shooter that wastes your time unlike all the others. It s also not very realistic nor is it very action orientated. Tons of hype very little to offer.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Now...Is this game good? Yes yes it is.I played Arma3 and DayZ. I'm not a stranger to battle royale games so when a friend bought me this I went into it expecting much of the same. I even waited a week before I even bothered installing it.Boy do I wish I'd given it a shot earlier.The game is all around fun. It's quick intense gameplay that keeps you on your toes 24/7. You never know when a guy with a shotgun is gonna come bashing through your front door while you wait for the limit line to reach you so you can move on.GAMEPLAYGameplay is pretty straight forward. You jump out of an airplane to choose your own spawn point. This is the make or break moment as it's far more likely to die early on if you drop in a frequently dropped in zone where like 30 people are on a 1 sq mile block with 3 houses of loot in it. Things get hairy and 29/30 are most likely going to die in that place. In this game getting kills is not the Priority name of the game. Survival is. Staying alive until you're the last man standing is the ultimate goal so it's important to differentiate between fights worth picking and to just stay low and let the convoy of friends pass you by rather than hope you can pick them off one by one without them seeing you. You'll find progressively better gear as the battleground shrinks in on itself and sometimes if you're lucky you'll drop in a place that's smack dab where the game is gonna end leaving you with a playground full of epic loot that'll leave you stacked and ready before anyone else.There are 3 versions of the game(Not counting custom) which are solo duo and squad(4). GRAPHICSGraphics are not exactly something to cheer about. They're 'adequate' but definitely could be a lot better. Due to it being an early access game sadly this also means that there are bugs and texture glitches relatively often but unless you literally get PTSD attacks or something from seeing slightly faulty graphics and serrated edges on building corners from time to time it won't bother you at all.PROS A mediocre community(Why is this a pro you might ask? Because voice chat is entirely optional and there is no such thing as text chatlog) Intense fast paced combat that'll have you sweating bullets for hours. Fair hit boxes and no wall clipping(Can't shoot through walls in certain situations etc.) Outrageously fun with friends. Goes up at least 5 stars extra if played with friends! Smooth clear voice chat built into the game(And of course there's perimeter conversation as well) No game breaking bugs that I've seen thus far. Highly customizable weapons and clothing for a personal 'build'. MASSIVE map with up to 100 players in it. Low price ($30) for a really damned good game! Fast and simple entrance to games. The longest I've ever waited from queue to joining was 3 seconds. Over 5 million copies sold and an extremely active game with an average of 280 000 people playing on the regular and over 450 000 at peak hours(Source Steam Charts)CONS Poor sub standard graphics Infrequent but catastrophic server connection losses Very rude and obnoxious community(Well at least it seems that way. I guess the trolls and idiots spamming slurping noises are more vocal and active than the more serious and mature gamer) Developer promised no microtransactions till the game is done which was honestly a pure 24 karat s*** nugget of lies. Loot is RNG based. (You might land at a building with no weapons in it at all while the guy next door comes over to say hello neighbor with an AK47 a pump action shotgun and a level 2 police vest.)FINAL WORDLike I said above is the game good? Yes yes it is but it has some definite issues which is not really the game itself that's the problem but the slightly unscrupulous developers. Go down the negative(and even some of the positive) reviews and you'll see the lies coming from the devs mentioned over and over and over again specifically the whole lie about microtransactions not happening till after the game was finished and released. The devs also claim that they want to use the money from the microtransactions to fund an Esports event for the game except the game revenue that they earned on it is so high they could easily fund a massive esports event to rival Riot Games' League of Legends championships with the utmost ease(An estimated $100mi was earned on the game so far).I recommend the GAME itself definitely but if the devs do not clean up their act and stop spewing lies to try and convince people to buy their game with empty promises? I'm going to rapidly change this review to a negative.It's so unfortunate too. The game is simply astonishingly fantastic.And one last thing before I go
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It has great promise with its interesting premise charming community and amazing graphics but the sound is lackluster and confusing the movement mechanics are "swimmy" and the aiming mechanic is nausiating. Despite all of its promise and EA I give it a firm thumbs down. I explain a lot more in detail belowGRAPHICS It is in EA so the FPS drops are to be expected and dont bother me too much. With the quality settings set low it runs pretty smooth. The graphics are pretty nice the island is huuuge! If you don't have a top of the line Graphics Card I'm afraid you'll be disappointed with the game should you expect anything great out of the FPS. I didn't myself and I find the graphics and FPS drops satisfactory. Overall with EA status I give the graphics a 8/10!SOUND The sound is pretty disappointing for me. I wear headphones with Virtual Surround and it is very hard for me to tell where other players are despite hearing their footsteps. Their footsteps are also very quiet compared to other games. Playing games like rainbow 6 and battlefield i may be spoiled though.When you're in the "lobby" which is like some parking lot with a broken plane and other buildings and what not with 100 players before the game starts I instantly am welcomed with a horrible sound from several guns being fired. The sound is akin to someone pressing mute/unmute rapidly and I find myself running away from people that are shooting so I cant be bothered from the noise.Given the EA status I give the sound a 3/10GAMEPLAY When we start the game in a big plane most of the time I hear stuff like "CHINA NUMBA ONE" and "SHUT UP F##GOT" etc and sometimes that makes me chuckle and I don't mind the silly juvenile jokes as they are the norm in multiplayer games anyway. I am disappointed that there is no way to type though as that would be great for asking other players questions instead of having to fight to talk over other people who are playing out silly antics.Once we finally jump out the game atmosphere changes drastically. Now its time to land somewhere near a building and grab some guns and ammo armor etc. This part is somewhat fun. The rush of not knowing what you'll find is real and the fear of running into another more armed player is exhillerating. The constant push to move as the gameplay map shrinks also is an awesome mechanic that I welcome very much.In this context I give the gameplay a solid 8/10 Unfortunately the rest of the game mechanics which I delve into more detail below are so bad so terrible in fact that I can't recommend this game!!MELEE COMBAT This is where the game really starts to fall apart on itself It's aweful. I mean god aweful. You have no reach at all and you have to aim higher than the player to hit them in the face. The whole thing takes a lot of practice and the way your player moves is almost dizzying. More on that later. But the whole fact that I have to be touching my oponent before any of my punches will connect is very annoying. Often times I'm fighting someone who has figured out how to handle this glitchy behaviour and kills me. Other times I get lucky and down the other guy. Overall the melee combat experience is a 1/10 I mean its god aweful. Player doesnt punch where you aim and you have to be practicly touching them to even connect a punch yet you can be much further away and pick up items fine. This really needs fixed.. huge thumbs down here.Melee combat in this game gets the well desrved score of 1/10MOVEMENT Aside from vehicle movement which is quite good the player movement is so bad that I have to give this entire game a huge thumbs down. Any redeeming quality such as the charming community and interesting game designs all pail in comparison to what is one of the most disasterous gameplay mechanics ever designed to date. It is so bad that I cannot fathom why this game is popular.The "loose" movement in this game is terrible. If I move forward and then release the move key my player spends 300ms or so still moving. The inertia is very disorienting and not like any other games I've played. It feels as though I'm controlling a humanoid robot that takes half a second or so to receive commands. It feels almost "Swimmy" like I'm controlling a drunk character that doesn't have very good balance. And it is this "loose" bumbling movement that has given me the resolve to post this review in the first place and not recommend it. I strongly recommend you do not touch it. If you want to spent your time trying to figure out how to time your movements as your clunky legs still move when you let go of the controls then this game is for you.Overall movement score? 1/10AIMING Just as bad as movement the aiming in this game is incredibally frustrating. I find myself fighting my character's breathing and position a whole hell of a lot. Again this mechanic is very unintuitive and not seen in any other game I've played. If you are moving with your gun out your aim just goes around almost in circles as you move around. You can't aim and move at the same time without a lot of practice and sure enough once you master the frustrating swimmy movements and nausiating aim mechanics you'll suffer for it playing any other game as you have to relearn how to play a game with proper controls.I cannot recommend this game as it is. It has a lot of promise but until the movement and aim is fixed I'm never playing again. I still cant believe it is this popular. I guess that is only thanks to streamers...Overall aiming score? 1/10OVERALLOverall I give this game a 4/10 just 2 points shy of giving it a thumbs up and recommending it. Once the game heads out of EA I'll be sure to give it another review.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Can't recommed this game. Hacking is a big thing. The system requirments are a bold faced lie. i have an I5 4460 quad. i have a Nivida 1070 gtx 8 gigs of ram and still have a hard time running this game on the very low settings. Every 3 games i have to restart the game becuase of bad Memory leaks half the time i drop into a zone the houses are playdoe houses .Desync is super bad cant tell you how many times i was killed behind a wall or got insta killed. 3 shots i am dead this even happens when i have tier 3 helm and armor.As stated above hacking its a big thing in july alone 250k ppls banned for hacking. Sad thing is the ban system does not work anyways. Dr. Disrespect got a three day ban he was playing the next day on a new account. Laughable. Dont waist your time or money on this game.It has regular updates this is true but i am not seeing a decrease in hacking Desync or an increase in FPS. So i am not sure what there doing beside adding Crates and Guns.(The guns are a good thing i will admit.)Also it seems that there also gearing up for E sports instead of fixing the game and from what i remember that goes againt there frame work. i remember someone saying there not going E Sports till the game is fully ready. Yet here we see invitationals Tournys and so forth in EA.

review: so...Positives Playerunkowns Battlegrounds is one of the best games I have every played. It is so entertaining and addicting. I would strongly recommend this game. It has plenty of content and thousands of hours of replayability. The cosmetic items are a great awesome and fun way to customize your character. This game also has very good gunplay and movement. You can use the vaulting mechanics or you can use the faster method of crouch jumping (my prefered method). The guns have realistic bullet physics including drop off and travel time. PUBG also includes vehicles like trucks motorcycles dune buggys and sedans. The driving is great and yes you can do backflips on the bikes. PUBG also has a decent community of mostly mature people (you wont always be instatly finished when you are downed). Negative You may run into hackers with things like aimbot or wallhacks. Some hackers may have totally rediculous hacks such as invisibility or flying. Out of the almost 500 hours I have played (including early alpha and after) I have ran into about two hackers so the hacking issue isnt that rediculous as you may have heard. Hit registration is always questionable if you peak for .1 second on your screen you might peak for almost .5 seconds on the enemys screen. also you may unload an entire magazine into a guy then when you watch the kill cam you are just standing there leaning like an idiot and not even shooting. This brings me to the spectator mode/kill cam oh my god is it horrible it basiclly makes everyone look like they have aimbot because it doesnt show fluid motions so don't report everyone. it may look like they aren't even aiming at you when you are shooting but they probably were on their screen. I do highly recomend this game especially if you have friends that already play it. It is so much fun to play with friends and on your own. I hope you enjoy PUBG and purchase the game the Devs are relativly active they like to add content and they want to fix the bugs in the game they have a small dev team. wish you lots of chicken dinners.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So I would say I have experience in other MOBAs and compared to these (DotA2 LoL) PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds is a very good game. The mechanics are so different to all the others some may consider the graphics very nice although I personally do not I can see the appeal some people won't and some people will. That's how the cookie crumbles with this style. I like the character roster but from a f2p standpoint I sense this game will be a bit dry to play The 5 avalible characters at least for this week of writing this review are kind of boring. 2 I enjoy playing but then there is 'punch guy' 'obligatory turret man'and 'minotaur' who I find to be extremely boring characters. This will however change when the cycle of weekly (i assume weekly) characters change. Although I do believe the starter pack is extremely reasonable as you unlock 8 heroes (or whatever). In conclusion from a f2p standpoint I think this game may get stale over time as it is hard to get coins quick but otherwise I love the mechanics and overall feel of the combat system of the game and believe it has great potential. Only other criticism is that I think the launcher is very frustrating as you have to have steam open to play it as it is installed on steam and it confuses me a bit (although I am stupid).
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I was yanking my t shirt by the collar whilst eagerly waiting for this game to be released.. due to.. obvious reasons (Ubisoft has made terrible ports for PC before).As soon as I played WD2 it felt so god dang smooth and they really did add a lot of detail into the settings of this game.If you wanna buy it I say you should. It's a new game it's something you're probably interested in and it's not half bad! I'm enjoying myself so much. ') The characters are fun the invasion modes are fun co op is fun (I don't think story co op is a thing but you can basically explore the map and do mini missions or just hang out there's quite a bit to do though it is indeed seamless).Pros Great Audio Great Dialogue Great gameplay mechanics Great animations (those freakin' parkour animations man!) Great story (so far) Very fun (subjective but heck I'm sure the 99% of WD2 consumers would agree!) Fast travelling.. MMMMM YES MY BEAUTIFUL FAST TRAVEL FRIEND! &lt 3 A male black character that DOESN'T get seen as a crook when he walks around but rather a stud (in the eyes of civillians since they're very friendly 'n stuff!)CONS There's just "master volume" settings for audio? You can't turn down either SFX Voice or music specifically.. not that I've seen anyway. But heck I could be blind. Prooooooooobably not though. So yeah no specific audio volume settings &gt c Although the world itself is very live (there's a lot going on and it's LIT AF) along with there being a ton of stuff to do personally I think there's not enough dialogue with the main crew unless you're interacting with an OP or they let you know about a new OP like no random chats here n there.. but that's just me I guess to each &amp their own. Some people would like more dialogue among the crew outside of ops others might not. This is more of a PERSONAL CON. )All in all a solid 10/10 it's ok
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So far i am disapointed but i am hoping the things that are wrong get fixed. Of my top 5 annoyances getting randomly head shot in a vehicle is one of them. Doen't matter if you a zigging and zagging with no apparent pattern and i have done it to people myself but shooting someone in the head while they are in a car is super easy and completely unintentional. Number two of my grievences when you parachute in people will follow you in to your location just to beat you to death with their fists or to beat you to the first weapon and kill you. This is realistic to me but kinda puts you on tilt after you wait for que up and die the first 2 min of the game. My third grievence is the opening phase where you wait a whole minute for people to join the game WASTE OF TIME this phase should be on the initial plane fly over this way people are not wasting loading time and get into the game faster. 4th grievence game rewards non existant. The game rewards you with a randomly generate item from a chest. The chest scale up in price but the loot does not. My first chest has a shirt pants leg holster and cap in it for 500 points. My second chest had a dirty brown sleeveless shirt and thats it for 900 points. For 2100 points i got a pair of white pants and for 3400 points i got a pair of white cammo pants. Now when does the loot start getting good? My final grievance against the game is the perimiter that shrinks ever so slowly at first then insainly quick. Granted i know this propells the game forward but at the final 5 min of the game each second the perimiter takes 1/3 of your health where as the first time the perimiter shrinks it takes 1/100 of your health per tick so something needs to be done clearly. Their are several smaller thing that annoy me but i can cope with those as opposed to the aformentioned ones. In it's current state i would not reccomend the game for people who get frustrated over things that cost you the game and make the game seem to punish you for playing but if these things get fixxed then i would whole heartidly reccomend the game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is just a bad game. Should not have been allowed to release as version 1.0.First off the collapsing boundary. I get it you need a mechanism to force the action. But to start collapsing it just 5 minutes into the game AND make it move so fast you can't keep up with it running at top speed IN ADDITION TO not making the player aware of where its going to be COLLAPSING TO when he/she is in the freakin airplane and can still avoid starting out 50 miles outside of the collapsing boundary? WTF. This is just bad design.Issue #2 not nearly enough Asian servers. The result is that 80% of the players on the North American servers don't even speak English which defeats the purpose of the Duo/Squad modes of the game.Issue #3 sloppy loot distribution scheme. Half the time there will be 4 backpacks in the same location but then no combat vest. Or there will be 3 combat vests but no backpack and no weapon better than a machete. If you're only going to give the player 5 minutes to lott before he/she has to "MOVE" then you have to do better than this guys.Issue #4 too many scopes lying around. 4 out of 5 times I get killed by someone I can't even see while running just to keep up with the collapsing boundary.Issue #5 lackluster controller support. Come on guys this is 2018 not 1998. Why do I have to hold down the X button to reload my gun and why can't I peek around corners. There's 10 buttons on today's controllers plenty to assign all of the essential character actions. There's also more than a few minor bugs in the game that make it frustrating to play like glitching vehicles. If it was just these bugs that plagued the game I wouldn't have a problem recommending it but combined with all of the other flaws this game is just a recipe for you punching a hole in the wall. Yet another example of a Steam game that has a good idea behind it but because the developers are in over their heads and evidently never play their own game to test out the gameplay mechanics it just turns into a mess.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've played this game for awhile and it's so dumb. For starters you jump like a flacid It's like you don't want to jump. And your jump is like your jumping from the shore to a large rock in the river so you can avoid getting wet. You also have no clue where you're getting shot from. The sound on this game is crap and it's the only way you can tell where you're getting shot from. I mean if you're getting shot you should at least be able to known THE GENERAL DIRECTION OF THE BULLET. Idk I guess they expect when you take a bullet to your back you don't know where it came from.

review: I really enjoy this game BUT that is only because I was able to play it on a friends computer that could actually run it. I have a fairly old gaming PC that can run most games and was not able to get over 20 FPS while playing this game making it completely unplayable. This game NEEDS to be optimized ASAP. That being said make sure you have a very good gaming PC if you're going to buy this or I would recommend waiting until the game is developed further. Great concept and I can see this becoming a great game. Early access but needs a LOT of work. Thumbs down until I can actually run this game on very low settings... Hopefully can change it to thumbs up soon.

review: Product received for free. PUBG ეს არის წვიმა კაცებისგან.PUBG ეს არის ტყვიაგაუმტარი წყალი.PUBG ეს არის ტაფა რომელიც უფრო კარგად გიცავს ვიდრე დამცავი ჟილეტი.PUBG ეს არის სკინები რომლებიც თამაშზე 5 10ჯერ უფრო ძვირი ღირს.PUBG ეს არის როდესაც ზონა შემცირდა 5 მეტრზე მაგრამ არავინ ჩანს რადგან ყველა სუპერ ნინჯა არის.PUBG ეს არის გონკები მანქანებით რომელიც უფრო მაგარია ვიდრე ფორსაჟში.PUBG ეს არის სკოლა რომელშიც ყველაზე კარგი ლუთია.PUBG ეს არის გრაფიტი კორეულ თამაშში რომლის წარწერებია "СЛАВЕ УКРАЙНЕ" და ბევრი სხვა სისულელე.PUBG ეს არის პლასტელინური ქვეყანა თამაშის დასაწყისში.PUBG ეს არის ალაჰ აკბარის კივილი როდესაც თვითმფრინავში 100 კაცია.PUBG ეს არის მარტო თამაში სქუადების წინაამღდეგ.PUBG ეს არის როდესაც კლავ სტრიმერს და იღებ ბანს.PUBG ეს არის როდესაც კლავ შენიანს იმისათვის რომ სხვებს ეშინოდეთ შენი.PUBG ეს არის ტოპ 1'ში გასვლა 0 კილლით.PUBG ეს არის სახლში მარტო ჯდომა კიდე 3 კაცთან რომლებზეც არ იცი არიან თუ არა მანდ.

That server. Is PUBG hire Ubisoft's server or sth?)anyway for honestly you spawn at a plane crush site(aka lobby) and after few seconds you jumper into a map which I think is ctrl+c from GOOGLE map(maybe). and you have to choose a place to start your game. If you choose some popular place you will see many parachues like not kidding)and later you go down you have to find a ing gun. And if you unluckily encountered an enemy and you don't have weapon. Use your JOJO power to punch your enemy to death.

review: Super fun game. The graphics are not great unless you have an absolutely beast system but the game plays just fine on low settings on my budget build and my 2 year old gaming laptop.Solo is a great time but squad games are where this really shines. I pretty much instantly lost interest in all other games after my first night of squad games in PUBG.Updates are regular and bugs tend to get corrected quickly. There is still a lot of optimization that needs to be done but I feel like the devs are making steady progress.Pick it up with a friend ASAP!

review: Playerunknown's Battlergrounds is a really fun game and is really really challenging as well. The game can get really buggy and glitchy at times but keep in mind this game is titled as an "Early Access" game so just wait and see the developers fix bugs and optimize the game for the better bright future for that game indeed!! EDIT After patch 1.0(PUBG is officialy out of the beta) I must say I enjoy the game a hundred times more than I did before. They improved performance the game runs very smooth now and you don't need a beast to run it anymore. I got 50% more fps than I had before the patch lots of bug fixes as was expected. Overall very nice and fun would recommend it to anyone!

review: To be fair you have to have a very high IQ to understand PUBG. The gameplay is extremely subtle and without a solid grasp of theoretical physics most of the circles will go over a typical player's head. There's also PU's capitalistic outlook which is deftly woven into his microtransactions his personal philosophy draws heavily from Electronic Arts literature for instance. The fans understand this stuff they have the intellectual capacity to truly appreciate the depths of these games to realise that they re not just epic they say something deep about LIFE. As a consequence people who dislike PUBG truly ARE idiots of course they wouldn t appreciate for instance the humour in PU's existential catchphrase The Ultimate Life and Death Fight which itself is a cryptic reference to Turgenev s Russian epic Fathers and Sons. I m smirking right now just imagining one of those addlepated simpletons scratching their heads in confusion as Brendan Green's genius wit unfolds itself on their PC screens. What fools.. how I pity them. And yes by the way i DO have a Chicken Dinner tattoo. And no you cannot see it. It s for the ladies eyes only and even then they have to demonstrate that they re within 5 IQ points of my own (preferably lower) beforehand. Nothin personnel kid

review: Player Unknown Battlegrounds is really fun if you have friends to play with. If you don't its enjoy able either way. Pros Monthy updates with tons of bug fixes and new features. Lots of weapons and more being added Playing with friends is really enjoyable. Action threw out the entire game Hours of gameplay with endless rounds.Cons Game breaking glitches where your car goes flying. People leave the game prior of it starting to you don't get into more fights People afk so the game becomes less enjoyable. If you get anything other then first you get no recognition for what you did basically wasting your time with no reward. Game devs ban inoccent people for acusations of stream sniping. (Some people intentionally streamsnipe and im fine with ban)PubG is full of action and is a really fun game solo or with friends. The only bad things about the game is when people afk or leave prior to the game starting. It sucks the action and fun out of the game when less people are in the game.
