review: Walked with some buddies. Found a car. Got shot through the back of it 3 times. 10/10 Would do again.____10 hours in____Cons/Pet peeves *Movement and shooting mechanics ADS is toggle and unchangable. Movement speed is crippled. Hold to zoom is useless for spraying even at close range. Jumping is inconsistent. inclines and ledges can block jumps. Movement is clunky and unresponsive. You cannot run while reloading. (but you can spin your head beyond 360 degrees). You cannot run over small ledges. The camera jostles all over the place when proning towards a small ledge (i.e. balcony railing). The character cannot tuck his legs while jumping. Performance leaves quite a lot to be desired. (Frame drops are experienced with even only 10 players in my vicinity frame times are generally not the most consistent). Settings/options are lacking. (Typing in config sensitivity would help) The third person camera side cannot be switched directly. Bullet tracers are either not visible or too hard to see. (I don't know where my bullets landed or what the spread is like) (Tracers impact dust/smoke or any visual indicator would be nice). No practice mode to get a feel for the weapons. Numerous physics glitches (I expect these things to be more polished by full release) Parachuting feels awkward in the final moments before landing (not sure if intended). Sound is inconsistent. (Cars are practically silent beyond 40 50 metres directionality not as good as it can be. Certain elements are easily locatable while others sound like they are just panned to a certain ear). The red dot sight has a prominent glow that impairs the central vision. (my eyesight isn't that great). No first person only servers (AU) Server performance also drops (once every few games). Hit feedback is inconsistent. (Blood sometimes does not show even when people get clobbered by a crowbar).Pros New gamemode concept that is a refresher from the stale CoD series and Battlefield. Promotes teamwork and smart play. Players can either play aggressive or passive letting other squads engage each other etc. Diverse range of weapons including shotguns marksman rifles sniper rifles and assault rifles.*Desired features Hold to ads First person servers Practice mode Improved sound (More use of reverb could help with judging gunshot distance etc.)Overall an unpolished game that has a lot of potential.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Awful ing game the circle is the least well thought out mechanic in the history of games.Update 4/13/2017 &gt This game if I could would get another thumbs down along with a middle finger if possible. The server performance has severly gotten worse in the past month of development than when it first came out. Please if you're reading this _DON'T_ buy this game at the current time. This has been a broadcast from PlayerUnknown to go yourself.Update 4/28/2017 &gt They fixed a lot of the problems previously posted about with server issues but took away the options to have a FOV over 75. While you may be playing on a 1920x1080 resolution on a 40 inch monitor the game makes it look like you're playing it on a 12 inch cathode ray tube tv. If they can balance the circle better by making it either slower less damaging or by making it completely opaque and give me a fov slider this game will get the green thumb. Until then if it fits it sits.Update 12/21/2017 &gt Still in beta even though it's "released".

review: This game is simply amazing. It's the most fun I have had in a long time playing any kind of shooting game. It has already climbed to my 7th most played game on Steam in a short 3 months. It's intense and even after 240 hours every single kill feels rewarding and every firefight is adrenaline pumping action whether you are playing solo duo or squad. I can only imagine how much more fun this game will get and how many more hours I will continue to get out of it when other games modes come in such as 8 man squads 50v50 zombies and more as well as the First Person Only servers new maps new character customization and public modding. Runs well for Early Access. I don't have any problems at least. I get anywhere from 70 to 100 fps with everything on high. 970 GTX16gb rami7 3930I do play with a buddy that constantly crashes. He has more hours than me in the game though so despite his issues with crashing while playing some matches he obviously still has a lot of fun doing it all. All my other friends don't have issues with crashing. Just the normal server lag everyone gets from time to time but that has also been improving.

review: It's really nice game to play now because gameplay itself is really nice today because they have fixed almost all the bugs and update this game very often so there isnt many rubberbanding or glitches anymore that could ruin your gaming experience but i still recommend to be aware for bugs. They aren't disappeared all the way but still the gameplay feels very smooth today and you dont need like NASA computer to play this game on my specs 1060 6gb i7 4770 it runs like 60 80 FPS Solid. I still would recommend you to buy this game from sale. Pros And Cons + Its fun to play+ Gameplay is smooth+ Many guns+ Realistic bullet drop guns shooting etc.+ SoundTrack+ Many stuff to do+ Better than Fortnite + Voice Chat is fun D+ Updates like new map+ Not pay2win Bugs Cars are Earrape people on airplane Logics are sometimes Boring alone Toxic CommunityOverall i would give this game a neutral review if i could but u should first watch a couple gameplay videos if you're are interested. I personally hate Battle Royale games but this one is really good even it is BR.And dont forget that you can get your money back from the game if you have played it under 2 hours!!! So atleast try it if youre not sure.

review: All in all not recommendable if your hardware is not far above the requirements.Yeah it is a Early Access game. But for a F ING 30 BUCKS early access! That is not accepteble for me! They are out of the beta! Not runable with hardware far above the requirements(my friends PC is far above not mine)? DAFUQ?! They could improve the performance. instead they come along with new content. so it is not that there is no progress made in dev.*Edit It will be released on Xbox one this year and my rig beat the out of a xbox one despite its old AF. If there are improvements in PC performance i will set up a new positive review and delet this kind of salt magnet thingy.I bought the game after i saw and played it at a friends PC about 4 times solo. I got hyped. The Game itself seems good balanced. BUT FUKN 30 BUCKS and it wont run ?? DEFUQ. To remind the requirements I can run BF1 mid BF3 mid hig GTA 5 mid all at1080p and stable fpsIntel Core i3 4340 (5232 Points)/ AMD FX 6300 (6355 Points)&lt Points Based on PassMark bench cpubenchmark(dot)net 6 GB RAM nVidia GeForce GTX 660 2GB / AMD Radeon HD 7850 2GBSo mine Intel Xeon x3370 4 GHz OC (6700 Points)8GB RAMEVGA GTX 670 SCSamsung 850 PRO SSDI tryed a few resolutions settings on AA view distances shadows texture size etc.I started with the Auto detected Settings at 1080P and mid to high settingsI ended up at Res 1366 x 768shadow quality lowview distance midAA lowtexture size loweffects lowAnd even with the settings that low. only stuttering. NO it was DEFINITELY NOT the ping.But hey at least i got a refund and _(ツ)_/ maybe i will buy it again if i got my upgrade next year and the game cost less than 7 bucks what it is realy Worth! Worthless piece of code.In sum It is out the beta and I criticize for an incomplete game that deamand so much money. if it is not finished nor optimized. Or i citicize an absolutly lack of setting up realistic reccomendation specs.

review: this game is just not fun by yourself. it is an alright game with two or three people to play with. Ive even had a decent experience playing duos a couple times. but playing by yourself is just not satisfying and sometimes just straight up boring. Ive read reviews about the chinese all over the servers and the countless hackers in the game and i have ran into quite a bit of that but i noticed that the game defaults to asian servers. I changed it to the north american option and it fixed most of those problems. Now i am not saying there are hackers in these servers but i have seen some very suspicious kill cams and inventories. overall this game is just meh. it is just a mediocre game that was very overhyped and still has severe problems after the 1.0 release.

review: Tons of desync Blocky movement Hideous weapon recoil Rewards camping Tries to be too realistic ARMA 3 cloneThe fact of the matter is that this game gets dull and it gets dull fast. It was thrilling at first just as any new/shiny thing usually is. But that quickly wears off once you experience the core mechanics of the game. If you're a hardcore ARMA player or miltiary simulation fanboy than this game might be for you. The game is very slow paced and unrewarding. 90% of the time you won't even know from which direction you're being shot from partly due to how poor the sound system is. Most players spend their time in buildings or on hills camping with scoped assault rifles or snipers. The game rewards camping. This is definitely not a skill based shooter. This is not going to be an copmpetitive title or an esport. I give it a month or two before the hype dies down and this game is forgotten.It's sad to see because so many of us wanted so much more from this game and it failed to deliver. Big time.I'm sure there will be many fanboys who try to discredit my review or outlook on the game by challenging my skill or rank. As of writing this review here are my rankings. I'm actually quite good at the game. It's just not a very good game.Solo Rating https //ibb.co/h33NivSolo Kill Rating https //ibb.co/mHvrbFSolo Win Rating https //ibb.co/fM8cGF

review: This game clearly has potential but it's not ready to be put on the marketplace. After playing one game and experiencing the clunky game mechanics I promptly requested a refund. While I do not blame the developers for capitalizing on the thousands of people interested from the closed beta had it not been for the twitch.tv viewership success I do not believe they had planned this short of a turnaround time from closed beta to open release. Precedent has shown from indie game studios that they tend to stop updating / improving games once the cash show is over and the player base begins to stabilize. Could this be the superior battle royale game? Maybe... but it needs serious work done.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Do you want a game that is 100% luck with no skill involved?!Look no further than this dumpster fire of a "game!" Shooting controls are amazingly bad. So amazingly bad that your reticule can be planted on the guy and your bullets will still find a way to curve the airways to miss him. Damage consistency is non existent. Guy has the same gun same gear as you? Oh it won't matter you'll be downed in two shots neither of which being head shots since you're clearly not showing your head behind the cover.And he will absorb bullets to become stronger than the incredible hulk. You know what this game does well? It does a FANTASTIC job at pulling people in with their trailers and actually you will NEVER EVER get in situations like they show. It's not a no man's sky thing. But it's definitely lying about what happens. 1 walk around aimlessly only to be shot from God knows where and die. 2 drop in with forty other people in the same area and die because you walked into a building that had a frying pan and a grenade while everyone else found BFGs. It's so hard to get a good grasp on this game in 2 hours for a refund because you can literally spend 3 games seeing nothing untill you get shot from a ghost. Only regret of the year was purchasing this abortion of video game entertainment.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Movement and aiming systems are way too clunky for me. Most are toggle (toggle crouch ADS and so on). And considering there are both 1st and 3rd person viewing you end up with so many ways to aim and move. There's holding right mouse button (focused hipfire?) and there's a full click (toggle full ADS). I'm not going to judge what is better compared to say battlefield style but I just don't want to learn a new system. I feel FPS games should stick to the norm and I feel 3rd person viewing doesn't belong in them...

review: RIP OFF H1Z1 King of the Hill. Save the extra dollars and buy H1Z1. REASONS TO AVOID PURCHASING PLAYERUNKOWNS BATTLEGROUNDS Glitches. Environment Lag. Weapon RNG is not efficient. Invisible Object boundaries interfere with weapon line of fire.. Can't communicate with players (Must have microphone and team talk ON only). Vehicle/Boat operation may kill you randomly. Graphics are subpar for todays generation. Large environment map with random open space between major cities. MUST CAMP IN ORDER TO WIN. Lags terribly at menu loading screen. Takes a toll on GPU/CPU game floads long pathways/algorithms pushing your GPU/CPU max performance all the time. FPS drops inconsistantly. You can be playing for 30 minutes and not fire one shot but to be sniped with one shot out of the blue. Outgunned/Accessorized majority of the time.I could go on and on. I rarely go out and spend money on games and I truely feel as if I was CHIPPED $30 to this game. This game is not finished and I did not do the research ahead of time before purchasing.Don't be stupid like me! DONT BUY THIS GAME!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: BEWARE! This game is unoptimised or optimised badly!Nvidia GTX 760 In my first hour I thought I'd play with the default settings as it usually plays games easily on medium/high settings. Getting into the game I understood my mistake as it lagged and stuttered without pause. I then toned it down to low on all the graphics settings. Game still lagged. I put EVERYTHING on "very low" and scale to minimum and the game still didn't play fluently. Needs an optimisation as quickly as it can!TL DR HAVE DECENT GPU? title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I cannot recommend whatever this game is supposed to be (recieved as a gift). When starting a new game you are placed in this crashed air plane zone while a count down timer runs out. After this you inexplicably dissapear and then have your view focussed rather disorientatingly on a flying air plane for absolutely no reason. After some indeterminate time your guy parachutes out of the plane and you can then have some control over whats happening but again nothing in the game explains what you are supposed to do.I landed in a quiet area near an airfield and found weapons no problem but no one was there. A message breifly appeared saying to go to a location in a minute or so which is marked on your corner map but no location is marked on the map so you cant figure out where you are supposed to go.A timer ticks down a 5 minute period after which a fast moving blue barrier sweeps past you much faster than your character can run and you start taking small but regular damage. Again this is for no explained reason in the game. I can only assume this is a terribly early build as either the run speed of characters needs to be increased or the blue forcefield barrier needs to be slowed down. Whilst it is observable that the barrier seems circular it moves so fast and is so massive that it's impossible to know where the centre (where presumably you dont have the life drained out of you) is.In my second play through after 30 seconds of being landed and without having found a weapon a character appeared around a corner and shot me dead in one bullet. This game makes no sense and is not fair if you can be killed without having found a weapon.This game is unplayable as there are no instructions as to what to do or why things happen you can be killed even if you havent had a chance to arm yourself and the blue barrier is clearly broken as it's too fast to out run. I do not recommend at present.ADDITIONAL There is only voice chat in the game which defaults to ON every game. You cannot type messages to players. So there is no way to ask people in game what you are supposed to do if you don't have a microphone and dont want to listen to lots of experience ruining voice chat which in every single game it has been implemented ruins the atmosphere if left on.

review: I have played over 14 hours of it and I already played what the game has offered. In summary you parachute into a russian nuclear wasteland and have to fight to be the last group/person alive. This concept sounds fun but the Island is so big and poorly optimized that you have to put ever setting on low unless you have a 1000$ pc. Also since the island is so big you have to spend 20 minutes trying to find people and end up getting shot buy someone you didn't even see. If want this hunger games style game just buy a COD game and play search and destroy. I guarantee you will have more fun than what you get from this game. 95% of the time you just do nothing I recomend just waiting a couple months for this game to become cheaper more optimized and gameplay wise more fun. But in it's current state I wouldn't reccomend buying it.

BECAUSE I ING CAN'T. ING DEVELOPERS OF ALL THOSE HALF SURVIVAL GAMES GET ING TOGETHER AND CREATE A GAME THAT IS WORTH IT'S ING MONEY.and btw why is there "Check this box if you received this product for free" checkbox under here ? Do you really think that if i got this for free i don't have a right to complain? because i do this whale genitalia of a game ain't worth my and anyone elses ing time.I'd rather pay 10 homeless men 30 euros to suck their that buy this again too bad that ing time machines don't exist.But don't take my word for it. Buy it try it then go to your local ing gun shop and kill yourself. ing disgrace this game is...

review: Product received for free. A friend (if you can call him that) gifted me this game. My experience was as follows. Created my character with the very limited customization options that were offered. No big deal here par for the course on these types of games. Load into first game. Kill my friend for the fun (the only fun that was had) of it. My other friend (actual friend who doesn't gift me bad games) then kills me. We all laugh. Hahahahahaha. Good friend then wins the whole game. We all laugh again. Hahahahaha part two. Load into a second game this time I take it serious. They all jump out of the plane I don't want to but the game makes me. I want to impact the ground and kill myself but the game wont let me. I loot a house find a shirt. Then a gun. Then another gun. Then another gun and a Red Bull. Then we find a motorcycle (it has a side cart this is the second best part of the game). I do a sick 360 flip on the bike but it kicks us out of the vehicle. Then a car runs me over. Bad friend picks me up. We drive away to another spot and find more guns. Then we drive away again. Bullets hit me on a bridge presumably fired from God or something. I die in one shot. Then bad friend dies. Then good friend dies. Then I refund the gift. 6/10

review: Very first match I parachuted way inland.. as far away from anyone as I could.. or so I thought. I made a mad dash for a small group of houses looking for a weapon. First house pants and backpack. Second house various sidearm attachments and leather gloves. Third house JACKPOT. M16 2 mags and a holosight. Get it equipped and loaded. Crouch down and creep out the front door... shot in the back of the head by a guy with just a pistol. 15/10 would take 2 to the dome again. Really hope that this makes its way to console I haven't gamed on pc in years and I've gotten used the aim assist and analog.

review: *REVIEW OF GAME AS OF 2 HOURS OF GAMEPLAY AROUND LAUNCH*If you are a fan of H1Z1 KOTK you'll love this EXCEPT (as of right now) the latency of this game is utterly bonkers due to launch hype. I read so much about how much better this will be with latency compared to H1Z1 and so far I'm not convinced (LIKE AT ALL!). I have internet speeds of about 150/MBPS down and 50 up. Since having this connection I have yet to play games where connection has been an issue on my end. THIS GAME NEEDS SOME OPTIMIZATIONS PATCHES AND MAJOR SERVER MAINTENCE! Now before you find yourself saying "oh that must mean it sucks" I would like to take time to clarify that NO it does NOT!In fact this is exactly as if Dayz + Arma made a baby and then that baby later had a baby with H1Z1 KOTK....this would be the end product. Its still a little clunky in controls compared to H1Z1 (which reminds me of arma/DayZ) GAMEPLAY Once again this is another thing that needs to be attended to....the rounds are epic in gameplay but framedrop is hideous as of right now. if you're into the idea of having a wide variety of guns and attatchments to give you the ultimate experince...well just go ahead and cough up the $30 rn. This will def make you wet with the level of customizations.

review: What can I say fantasticly fun game is it perfect no of course not but it runs pretty well for the most part.BUTIts all about that game play guns handle nicely systems are deep enough to get you involved (and quite often shot while your modding your guns) but simple enough to pick up quickly. I like the sounds though some people dont the FPS on the main is ok with a few tweaks yes it dips in large towns but its mainly playable if not 144hz super pc master race smooth.Im playing at 4k with a 1080 overclocked to 2100hz so i have the GPU grunt and being 4k 60fps is my limit lowest it drops is 40 45 in the towns not great but playable. (AA is off by the way i dont think you need it at 4k and it frees up the frames)some people dont like the price but ive had my fun for 27.99 in the first week alone and its only going to get better.First week is seeing some good patches (server &amp Client) and good communication from the Devs which has to be a good thing.Very much worth the money.

review: Great great great. Three words that describe this game. Is it finished? Of course not but they do not claim that the game is finished so why would it be. It's not in it's full version yet there are still many updates to be released and bugs to be fixed of course. But so far so good the idea and the gameplay I thouroughly enjoy. I would definetely recommend this game! If your worried about not being able to run it there are adjustable settings in game and also other ways to change settings that will help you run your game better depending on your system of course. I use an ASUS gaming laptop (Republic of Gamers) and can easily play most games on high quality. I can handle games like Arma III without lag offline and online I can play with no lag with the graphics turned down a bit. As for this game what isn't a bug and is caused by actual lag I fixed by turning the graphics settings down a tad. Other than that I would say it was worth the $30 to me and if it seems like something you'd be interested in give it a shot and help them out as the more people who play offers more updates and helps the developers get closer to the release of the full version. Great game guys keep up the good work!!!!!

review: This game has so much potential. Right now it is a good game but definitely has some issues that need to be worked out. So from what I understand the creator of this game was the one who originally developed the Day Z mod for arma and then licensed out the concept to the creators of H1Z1. PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds is best compared to these two games and currently is looking ready to take them out behind the barn and put them out of their misery.The guns in PUBG are much more varied than those of H1Z1 and when you fire they just feel better as well. The hit detection is much better and very rarely do you lose a fight where you had the jump on an enemy and it really feels like you win the fights you should and lose those you don't rather than playing a rng game where first person to get a random headshot wins.The customization of the guns is a really cool aspect and really lets you customize your loadout to deal with a great different number of situations you could end up in.The fact that you die if you jump out of a vehicle while at full speed is probably the most satisfying aspect of this game coming from the broken vehicle mechanics of H1Z1.There are issues with picking items up off the ground usually when you first parachute in where you are sitting there hitting the button to pick up the items and the animation is happening but the item doesn't appear in your inventory until the 4th or 5th time you bend down to pick it up.I personally have not had this issue but my friend who I duo with has had an issue multiple times where he will parachute in and as soon as he hits the ground his game locks up and ends up having to force quit.The devs in this game make me hopeful that unlike other Battle Royale games that have released into early access(looking at you H1Z1 King of the Kill) this game will continue to get better and better as time goes on. They are very upfront about what they're working on to better the game and show that they have an understanding of what needs to be improved and how the community is responding to the game.Right now there is an issue where not all CPU cores are being used. This can be fixed using the launch commands on steam. Use USEALLAVAILABLECORES sm4 d3d10 malloc systemCurrently this game gets a 7/10 from me but with optimization and a couple of minor fixes this could easily get a 9/10

review: This game recently brought back constant crashing about every other game. Frame rate went back to like it was in early access hackers haven't gone anywhere sound bugs and desync are worse than ever their INTENDED changes to the game (i.e. the solid blue wall) have only made the gameplay worse. But hey guys you can buy streamer skins!With Blackout coming out in a week a game that's proven itself to be incredibly optimized I think it's safe to say PUBG is going to be just a meme by next year. I have nearly 1000 hours in PUBG ranked top 200 in multiple seasons.... downloaded it the 2nd day of early access. I'm not even a huge fan of the features in Blackout but I'm planning on leaving PUBG behind for it just because I know it's a game that will play well will have an active community and the developers will live up to the expectations of their players. I keep giving this game chances and I'm constantly disappointed.Too little too late. RIP

review: thought i was alright to begin with ..a little buggy some freezing frames etc i believed that was down to the large scale player base 90+ players per match and the servers struggling to keep up with all the simultaneous shots fired ..i played for a while and got bored ..fortnight came out but didnt really bother with that either ... roll forwards a month or two i started playing again ..lots of different outfits and customisations and a couple of extra maps ..But... what about the game play ...Having been an ESL fps gamer i found the game frustraiting ..the bullet registry is way of and the server is way behind ..in laymans terms i need to lead the shot nearly 4 times the player while moving in a sideways motion ..that side when the player is running directly at you (even when your prone) a good portion of shots dont register ..the last 2 games i played i came across a guy on the outside of a building (hiding and keeping very still) my position is directly to the side and i have enought time to aim and breath and take the shot ..the damge i did when firing into the head... 0 ..nothing not a scratch or a dent ..i die deliberately to spectate just to see how much damage was caused and am amazed to find that even at close range against a static player theres no bullet reg ..while the games customisable and a bit of fun for a run around the game play is still in the 1980s ...games not going to last if they dont sort it out .play it if you want a bit of fun but dont play it if your one of the many that bullet reg doesnt favour ..youll just end up frustrated .

review: This game has given me one of my most two sided opinions to any game I have ever played. It is such a mass of possibilites that keeps failing to show. Again I get some of this will be personal opinion but I cant help but feel bad even after a relatively good game.1. The Lag I have had SO many games become unplayable or go through a once every 3 minute lag that has gotten me killed or caused some vital shots to miss.I don't get this lag in most of my other online games. My internet has been good quality and I have even checks internet checks during lag spikes so it now feels to be poor server distribution. This becomes even more aggrevating due to issue 2.2. The Shooting I love the fact bullets actually kill people in this game. I have always disliked when games like COD or fortnite had people who could become bullet sponges. A pistol shot can still easily be fatal if the shooter takes his time. But this beneficial mechanic has a problem lag and luck can suddenly run and ruin the fun and skill. If you miss a single shot it means the other person can now easily win but many times it is down to a lag spike. Other bizarre issues of power balance have affected me that I can't understand. I have had a game stealthily getting behind someone and putting three shots of an SG12 into a lvl1 armour wearers back and had them panic turn and spray to one shot me with a ump45 despite a lvl 2 helmet. These events occur occasionally and make you feel like nothing you do will even let you win I have put half clips of 7.62 into people who seems to dance through despite blood splatters showing the hits. I often feel it is lag on both my and their parts making the shot appear successful on my end but missing on theirs and it is infuriating.3. The Map Design The many maps are nice and have good altering austetics but have a major issue. Put simply if you love to hid away and snipe (I amn't too keen) then this game is your answer. I have always liked snipers that are balanced in Battle Royale games but here they are just given so many advantages. Every map is wide open even areas of housing foliage forest and mountain are often very exposed and have long areas of line of sight. Anyone who get the snipers early on often cleans house. Most of the times when I end up in the last 15 my death is attributed to someone firing almost a full 20 clip SDS at me from a mile away and eventually getting enough hits to kill me. Nothing is more annoying then putting time into getting equipment fending off and killing other players in what amount to skilled duels only to die from someone a valley away wittling you away. Even if you get into cover they can just sit back and wait to kill you because the map is so open you will likely need to cover over an acre to get out of the line of sight. All battle royale have some luck to add fun and excitement but they should still rely mainly on skill. However the luck of finding a sniper + the power of the bullets + the openness of the map means no amount of skill of the other players part is likely to let them win against someone with a sniper. I have sometimes got a sniper with scope but stopped because I felt terrible as I put bullet after bullet into someone so far away they couldn't even see me and had as good as no cover. The game feels less Battle Royale and more "The Most Dangerous Game" and I don't play games just to be some lucky sniper's target. 4. The Attitude This isn't the games fault just a notable part of the community. The whole fun of Battle Royale is to try be the last man standing not COD around for kills no matter what. There are the lucky and annoying auto snipers mentioned before. There are a lot of people who follow you in on parachute just for the hope you dont get a gun first so they can get a skill less easy kill. There are many people who hid in buildings for half the game with an auto shotgun in pre set areas other players can see even if wary so anyone who walks in is almost always eviscerated regardless of effort. There are people who during the final game moments will remain camped in the blue and fire on you wildly with very little chance of killing me plus they areleft so deep into the blue they will inevitably die their only wish being to screw someone else over by giving away their position instead of trying to get out of the blue. These people are in most games but combined with the open maps and heavy hitting weapons of PUBG they add a layer of randomness that makes PUBG feel like the most skill free battle royale to play.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Okay first off the bloke in the red tshirt in the beginning of the trailer raises his hand above his eyes to block out the sun. This is false advertising to such an extreme. So bad that I actually thought it was a real emote the first time I saw it. It made me pause the video lean my face into the screen and squint at the guy walking with no guns and blocking the sun while what appears to be his team rush past him and desert him. I've clocked 440+ hours on this game so you'd think that I would've done a "sun blocking" emote before.Righto the review. Okay I got this...FIX THE TWATTY SERVERS.I'm standing behind a wall I peak out see a guy with a kar98k okay he's there. So I tilt my head back behind the wall then my head gets shot off by him. At this point I have 2 options. I either watch my deathcam and throw my headset against my window or go to make a cuppa come back and start a new game. I do the second one since I feel unusually calm and want to spare a window. THE SERVERS Since I live in Oceana the servers have always been a problem for me. I could wait 6 minutes for a game with decent ping and 80 players or instant join a full NA game with twatty ping. However recently It's like a bomb has been dropped in Oceana and I have been using noise cancelling headphones not noticing that everyone has actually been killed. I hate to say it I really do because I love this game always have but DO NOT buy this game if you live in oceana. Our ping is the equivelant of a snail traveling on soul sand.GRAPHICS Not much to be said really. If you can handle max/good graphics then lucky you your in the top 13% of people that buy high end PCs. But for the rest of us living in the filth with 1050ti's and such we get around 60fps. Make that 40 since windows wants to update.GAMEPLAY PUBG's gameplay has always intrigued me. I came from a background of CSGO so am found of military shooters that rely on smart decsions. I love the way you can suprise people and use different guns to a tactical advantage. However there is always something that manages to creep under my skin. Like people that shut doors after they leave a building. Except this is much more personal more rage enducing more headset slammable. The camper. The person that comes out on top because they went to get dinner and left their game on with a Micro Uzi in hand and a zone that grants their favor. They would've picked up a Scar due to owning the "Year 1" skin but they decided they liked the Micro Uzi better. They also picked up a ton of ACP ammo. (Just in case).Put short the gameplay is slow. If you are commited enough to play a 40minute match maybe land see noone then eventually get shot in the face then go for it. Its a great game with strategic possibilites. And I do love it. CONCLUSION However it is 40dollars I recommend watching some gameplay before you buy it. And not buying it at all if you live in oceana and have survived the fallout.

review: I like the idea of this game its like the Arma 2 modz.What makes it a bit less fun is the way the area restriction works. You just die because your not in the zone and when you atleast survive up to the last minute of the restriction you just have to duel players within a small area.. that leaves players outside instant death.. I would suggest though atleast make it more dynamic for people who are a bit dodgy.. the bombing is nice but the whole moving shield like is just less fun.. why not make it like a mob or zombie horde that will storm that place after the zone.. that way players will have to battle all their remaining life fighting for something instead of die running. I like the idea of looting houses and remains.. this exactly what we enjoy over the time.. but the soonest you'll realize there is not much of a reward after the deathmatch. atleast a medal or trophy could be added into the players status may it something from your notable kill. "Head of &lt player name&gt " as a trophy as a result of headshots.. "Ears of &lt player name&gt " as a result of melee.. that would be more fun. I wouldnt mind the micro transactions as its a decision on the players side and it'll help the game development also. Overall I like this game. Just add more elements and sure it will dominate the genre. But to be honest this game will die eventually due to abundant cheaters out there.

review: EDIT 9/29/2018 I decided to re review this game as I feel as if I was unfair in how I reviewed it. And since I want to pursue a career as a video game reviewer I felt this was the right thing to do.So let's start from the beginning yes?TL DR.This game is good if you like semi realism and don't want the cartoony Fortnite style of games but rather the gritty military feel of a fairly decent shooter. However with how there are many bugs still in the game and a rather bad netcode the game doesn't hold a candle to the upcoming Call of Duty Black Ops 4's Blackout mode. Or even Fortnite for that matter.6.5/10.Now on to the full review.Gameplay.The game feels like a mix of old DayZ running simulator with the shooting of Arma and Battlefield combined. There are currently three maps in the game currently and I'll cover them soon but I'll just say that they're fairly huge. Looting feels much better than in the past as the bugginess is gone and replaced with fluidity. However all that looting will be gone in seconds if you don't mind your surroundings or get a gun quickly enough. There is some RnG in this game which makes things unpredictable and that's fine. However the problems start appearing as sounds will frequently not be detected and how the netcode is still a fairly big issue. You'll frequently be killed by a player you didn't hear behind you because too many soundfiles were executed and the game itself couldn't catch up. And with the netcode as bad as it is the playermodel hitbox has trouble keeping up with the actual model. Meaning that you will be shot and killed even if you thought you were secure behind some cover.The Maps.There are currently three maps in the game. One is hated by the majority of the community one is loved and the other is in between. Since its release into the main game Sanhok has been the community favorite as it's not a sleeper fest as Erangel and not as bland as Miramar. Since Sanhok is a 4x4km map compared to its counterparts who are 8x8km. Erangel is the more civilized map so to speak. More towns it's green and has pretty neato landmarks. But it got old to me. Miramar is in a desert large hills mountains and little cover. It feels as if it was made primarily to showoff the vaulting mechanics that came out with the map last year. Sanhok is a jungle based map. Being the smallest things are a little more cluttered and it gives more cover and vantage points. Which is a good thing it makes firefights fair when you exclude the netcode's glaring issue.The netcode Microtransactions and other things.The netcode is garbage I'll say that upfront. It also feels like the developers are more trying to keep the major streamers of the game in the game by giving them their own stuff in the game instead of listening to the community. Anything to monetise their game from within the game. I'm not saying that's a bad thing it's not. It's cool that they're doing this since it adds a connection to the game. However when that is prioritized over making the game better there's an issue. The cases are locked behind monetised keys similar to CSGO. However the chances of getting higher tier cosmetics are lower than the knives from CSGO. There are free cases but the loot from those are even harder to get. You're more likely to win the lottery than obtain a trenchcoat.Overall.The game is slowpaced the tournaments are boring to watch as everyone hides in bushes. But on the flipside the game can be fun with friends and can make some pretty memorable matches. Getting a Chicken Dinner in this game is something that I love even if I don't like the game much due to its flaws.However the nearby release of Call of Duty Black Ops 4 and its Blackout mode is most likely going to kill this game. Most of the major streamers of PUBG will switch over to Blackout making this game's sustenance be minimized dramatically. So I recommend this game if you dislike Call of Duty and don't mind playing a game that'll be forgotten like H1Z1. But I don't recommend this game in general. As Blackout is PUBG but on steroids. Better netcode better weapon variety better everything. So if I were you the reader I'd wait until Blackout on October 12 2018.My verdict on this game after it's long life 6.5/10.Good for a while but will die out after Oct 12.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: All the basics are here.....but the technical implementation still needs work.The game is pretty horribly optimized I'm on an i7 960 with 32GB of RAM and dual 970's in SLI and I can't get the game to play nice on any graphical setting there are some audio stream issues too but largely as this style of game goes and its early access nature...its pretty good.Its got all the control and gun play of a pretty streamlined Arma combat game with fluid and believable animations for movement and firing.The environment is pretty well designed and has a good amount of variety and functionality.If you don't have a beast rig I'd suggest giving this a week or two to sand off some of the performance issues it has but other than that this is pretty top option for competitive survival gaming.

review: Imagine H1Z1 but with far better graphics 5x the number of guns a better inventory system suppressors scopes (holo red dot 4x 8x etc.) wider variety in vehicles larger and more realistic map etc.Pros All the things listed above Rewards and ranking systems for Solo // Duo // SquadCons Slightly less FPS than H1Z1 Early Access Glitches and Bugs (I haven't encountered many but I've heard some things from community)General Points More challenging and higher learning curve that A3BR and H1 Really clean and rapid weapon customizations and inventory swapping Enjoyable and emmersive gameplay (especially with friends) Great graphics and textures Very cool map (flooded village lumber camp nuclear power plant etc.) Overall my experience has been very good and even though it's a early access game I have had less problems so far with this game over H1
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Besides the optimization server side setbacks this is a phenomenal early access game. It's already worth every bit of money I spent on it and I do expect to see that investment pay off in terms of having a load of fun.Between H1Z1 and Arma 3 BR this game balances the two and makes said balance work quite well. My favorite part of the game is how the guns are designed pistols are actually useful and there is an actual variety of guns with non predictable spray pattern and bullet drop. This is what makes H1Z1 suck compared to this game. In H1Z1 it's a battle of who has the most ammo and bandages whereas in this game you have to play your bullets and medical supplies smart and be conservative with health. Running around and getting loads of kills isn't nearly as beneficial in this game thought and tactic are key elements to winning.Other great aspects are downing and attachments. Downs really help out in team modes instant one tapping is incredibly annoying in other games but here it's reduced quite a bit. Teamwork is now encourages.Attachments are a great addition third person play is not as reliable now (which is good hybrid play is always nice) Extended mags and fast reload are somewhat generic but still good to have. You'll rarely face opponenets wielding identical guns there's always something different.Only complaing is vehicles they're a bit drifty and out of control at times and are a bit annoying to listen to. A bit of easier control would be an insta fix for me.At the moment I'd recommend a buy but if you're unsure give it 3 6 months and then see I can foresee a lot of optimization and lag fixing. The developer knows what NOT TO DO with a BR game as well as what TO DO. PUGB is great and a great future is in store for the game. #RIPH1Z1

review: I love the concept of this game and I will probably buy it (and keep it this time) in the future. That being said here's why I refunded this game Badly optimized This can be expected of any early access game but it runs like 20 25 on Very High 25 30 on High 40 45 on Medium and 50 60 on Low. And low looks like garbage especially paired with the many graphical errors this game has. Servers are pretty awful Rubber banding input lag and general connection issues plague this game. Yet again can be expected with early access but this really renders the game unplayable. The first two games I played I was kicked after about 10 minutes and then after about 5.As I said before the concept is AWESOME. Something I've always wanted yet sadly this game just doesn't quite do it. It has TONS of potential though and I plan on coming back to it after early access is over.

review: This game in its current state would clearly show that it is infact ''Early Access'' due to its unfished optimization and server sided lagg issues. However that doesn't change the fact that the base game in its current state is incredibly fun and immersive. Playerunkown's Battlegrounds has left a pretty good impression towards the majority of the players. I personally find the game a lot of fun immersive and rewarding. Incredibily tactical strategic and fair paced. The gun play seems incredibly realistic and somewhat hard but I personally had to get used to it when I just started playing. I've only encountered two bugs so far one of them was blood spatters on my screen appearing randomly as if I was getting hit by something but I wouldn't lose health. Insta death when you jump out of (slow) moving cars.I personally cannot wait until the game reaches its proper launch state cause the only things that are bugging me right now are the server sided registry and FPS dips issues that the game suffers from. Confirmed upcoming patches and features as revealed during the Twitch stream indicates that the game will only get better from here on out Player created mods E sports Ranking system and rewards for such Community made skins More...PROS Fast matchmaking Large variety of weapons attachments and vehicles Very balanced rewards/weapons/armor &amp vehicles wise Creative (free) cosmetic items Proper social support when it comes to playing with friends/squads Acceptable match lengthsCONS Mildly poor optimization Occasional server lag (US) FPS dips 35 100+ Reward chests costs double with each purchase (resets every Monday) I am fully aware as of their reasoning for the double costs per purchase of crates. (So that the cosmetic items won't lose value when they get a steam market)

There are large frame drops (not below 30) in the parts of the map with more assets. This is to be expected for an early access game however. Another issue I have is if you play with the foilage settings above very low you are at a severe disadvantage. I love how the foilage looks but I can't play with it on if I want to do well. Overall for an early access battleroyale the game is suprisingly stable and the gunplay is exceptional. This game has sucked this past weekend away from me and looks to take many more hours out of my life before I escape its clutches...

review: Sometimes i hate this game sometimes i love this game. BUT overall i would say this game is by far the best battle royale type game i have ever played below ill list some pros and cons for people who are on the fence.PROS1. Shooting is pretty smooth2. Updates are frequent ( they have a schedule posted for updates )3. No cash shop until release ( so ive been told ) so dont have to worry about devs sending all their attention to making skins rather than making / fixing issues ( im looking at you Daybreak )4. No car spam cars in this game are pretty terrible in terms of how ez they are to kill so ppl tend to not play it like h1z1.5. Hit Reg on shots is solid far more so than H1z1.6. Wide varity of guns! i hated in h1z1 how there are 4 total guns pretty much.7. Active devs who truely care about their game.Before i make this a novel on just the pros of the game i will go ahead and begin the cons list.Cons1. Can be slow placed if you're use to h1z1 this is most def a different play style sure you can get high kill games but its not a jump out of cars and start slaying people type of game2. Tend to get shot in the 3. Silencers are waaay to over powered4. No real hit indicators aside from sound ( why silencers are broken )5. Jumping out of a moving car ( even if going kinda slow ) will pretty much kill you6. Sometimes Desync is aids.7. The zone was made to screw over pretty much everyone but one lucky guy the rng way it moves can sometimes pull you 1 direction 4 5 times in a row with only like 1 minute to get to the next spot.

review: This game has gone downhill since januar 2018. It is amazing how much the speed damage and the variable timing of the blue zone/circle affects the gameplay. 1. Blue zone/killing circle moves too fast2. You can stay on the outside see in and shoot into the circle from the blue zone/killing circle until the very last circles3. The timing of the circle is variable by how many have died so there is no planning or timing possibilities. You can get ed just because 20 guys died in various gun fights4. Cheaters 5. Vehicles got nerfed. They are now slower than they used to be. Even your grandmothers Corolla can do more than 120 if you step on it6. Diving/swimming got nerfed to br&gt 7. Nades was funny/functional in that it moved the person being hit.. that is gone8. Nades do crazy damage now9. Nades can not flip a car/boat anymore. Due to the damage buff it simply explodes10. The circle does not move slower on the bigger map (miramar) which is obviously what it should do. You go on a big map to play longer.. it is not rocket science.11. They nerfed the silencer on the VSS. It is now like a normal ump/pistol in sound level 12. Helmets does not work. Everyone kills (cheaters?) in a single headshot it seems. Not just the sniper rifles which is ok13. No map selection anymore14. No fog or rain at all. Even as an map option/allowed situation15. They nerfed loot on Erangel. And they chanced parts of the map so it became more uniform/bland.16. Loot is everywhere on the Saigon map17. The game still runs poorly Map is not actually called Saigon..

review: If you came here looking for a review you have come to the wrong place but if you want some bomb brownies you have come to the right place. You're welcome for an actual recipe not a copy and paste pie recipe. Trust me nothing goes wrong with nutella.INGREDIENTS 1 c. unsalted butter2 c. sugar1/2 tsp. salt1 c. flour1 c. cocoa powder4 eggs1 (13 oz.) jar Nutella5 Ferrero Rocher candies unwrapped and crumbledDIRECTIONS 1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.2. Melt butter in a medium sized saucepan over medium heat. Add sugar stirring until combined. 3. Remove from heat and add salt flour and cocoa powder stirring to combine. Whisk in eggs stirring just until the mixture is combined into a batter. Set aside.4. Spray an 8" x 8" pan with cooking spray. Pour half of the batter into the pan. Spoon or lightly drizzle most of the Nutella on top of the batter forming an even layer over the brownie batter. 5. 5. Use a spoon or silicone spatula to cover the Nutella with the remaining brownie batter. (If you pour the batter straight on top of the Nutella it will sink into the Nutella and combine into one marbled yet delicious mess.)6. Bake until the top layer of brownies has browned and set 28 to 30 minutes. It shouldn t jiggle when you remove it from the oven. (The toothpick test doesn t work here since the toothpick will hit the Nutella layer making the brownies seem uncooked.)7. Let cool for 15 to 20 minutes then top with a drizzle of Nutella and crumbled Ferrero Rocher chocolates. Cut into squares and serve.

review: I wrote a review on this game many months ago and I gave it a thumbs down mostly because of glitches lag and just overall gameplay. Battle Royale style games are the new shooter out there and really it's a game about gambling. You gamble on whether you can find a gun before an enemy can. You gamble on whether it's safe to move positions or it's best to stay put and hold down the fort. You even gamble with microtransactions can you get a rare item to sell or just more junk? I've played this game quite a bit and I think it's safe to say that this game really isn't about skill or tactics. It's about if you are lucky will you come up behind an enemy for an easy kill or will you place yourself in a excellent position where you don't need to move. Will you land and find a good gun or will you land and search 25 buildings and find nothing. It's a gamble!!Speaking of gambles this game is FULL of players camping in fact it's the way Battle Royale style games are played. Oh sure you can run and gun but it really doesn't do you any good if the very next building or location you go someone is hiding in a bathroom or staring at you from a second story window. Another gamble! This of course does not include the huge rise in hackers. That has a many people upset and I understand. Hackers and cheaters can ruin a game in seconds. BUT what can you expect when you create a competitive game with currency that is awarded to you for kills and surviving? AND THEN you allow that currency to be spent on things that can be sold on the Steam Market Place. MONEY is to be made! And the Chinese are great at taking advantage of that. So Bluehole may have created the best shooter game ever but they also created a game in which hackers have the green light to make money. So yes the reviews you've read recently do reflect the rampant out of control hacker issue. It's for sure the number 1 issue right now. I'm not exactly sure how they are going to fix it either. They've been banning thousand of people and hacking is still on the rise! If you are even considering shelling out the cash for this game hold up! Stop! This game has a lot of work left before I'd say Yes Shut up and take my money! The best thing to do right now is put this game on your wishlist and wait! Wait until it finally releases and is no longer in early access. If things haven't improved by then then I just saved you some money! You are welcome! Final Verdict Two Thumbs Down!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: While the game itself proves to have everything a BR should have the structure around it makes it hard to enjoy the game. Constant fps stutters generally low fps fps drops lag and cheaters make it impossible to enjoy this game for a longer period of time without getting angry about it. Fortnite and Realm Royale might be fun but they dont provide the gunplay and just the overall FeelsGoodMan moment when you kill someone as in this game. Sadly most of the times any kill you get will be denied by someone lagging through and killing you or your 3 shotgun shots in his chest will not kill him ending up with you dying and being mad IRL.Dont waste your money on this game unless pubg decides to monumentally change the performance of their game which does not seem to be happening in the near future.

review: You earn BP (the currency in the game) by playing the game. BP can then be used to buy loot crate which contain cosmetic items. This is not inherently bad since cosmetics do not enhance your odds to win. The problem is that you have a chance and in my experience its more times than not of getting a crate that must be unlocked with a key which costs real world money and cannot be bought with the in game currency. This is unbelievably gross and shows that the developers priorities money over making the game a better experience. Such practices are common for a free to play game but not a game that you pay for and expect a full experience from. After paying the upfront cost for the game the game then sells you that crates that you ve earned. Also keep in mind that even if you do get a crate what you get inside is random and you may get doubles of things you already own. Overall its just a stingy system from a stingy developer who are making a game for their love of money on not their love for games.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: In its Early Access state I cannot recommend. You'd need a very strong PC to run this as smooth as butter.Pros 1. Fun to play with friends.2. Interesting concept.3. Rewarding when you kill enemies.4. Constant Updates by the Devs are great.5. Graphics have significantly improved well done to the devs for that. I now get aroudn 70 60 fps.Cons 1. Many things like the menu need more work but understandable in its current state.Edward (idLE)'s points (Thanks for the info Ed!) literally cannot assault someone camping on the second floor of a building. experienced players go to the northern part of the map where there's an underground bunker that has a ton of weapons/armour literally doezens of try hard groups in squad that usually have a 'captain' barking orders at their 'friends' literally no skill based matchmaking you could join a round with experts and it will be your first round after purchase. I can't think of anymore right now but this game really doesn't deserve the praise it's getting. I hope there's some genius out there making an even better battle royal arena simulator.At its current price no I do not recommend buying it. Wait for it to either be on sale or be in its final state of development.

To say the least though I was plesantly suprised the visuals were very crisp the idea of finding different attachements for different weapons was intense all the while gunshots are ringing through the streets. I would definitly recommend this game however I do have concerns about the servers when larger and larger groups start to jump into the game will the developers introduce ping locks where a player would be unable to fire their weapons when their ping rockets because if I play with friends in the same server but my ping is 108 compared to their 50 what will happen. So to wrap up I do really enjoy the game however I am concerned about how the developers will handle cheating and how they will attempt to sort through players with bad ping compared to people purposly forcing a laggy connection to win.

review: Read this if you want honest stone cold factsThis review only will solely be about the people that leave negative reviews with these bs reasons (please read in a y tone) OMG there are so manyyy chinese hakers in this game OMG the developers made a DLC that really included only skins OMG the game is soooo badly optimized my awesome computer can only run this gammmme in 50 FPS OMG there are still so many buggggggggs that I dieNow lets get real pubg does still have a lot of problems but these problems are the only thing that these negative reviewers focus on but they drastically DRASTICALLY make readers feels that these things happen much more frequently then they actually do. I will talk about each "point" I listed above that negative reviews focus on.Some of these cry babies that leave negative reviews are just triggered when they had one "alleged" chinese hacker kill them and say that this happens every day. I have about 450 hours in this game and have met no more than 10 hackers in different games. That seems bad but lets do some math. My average survive time per game is about 15 minutes which means 15 minutes one game. Which means I can play 4 games per hour which finally means I have about 1800 games I have played all together since 450*4. But this doesn't take account the waiting time in lobbies and so on so lets remove 180 games because I feel that I spend 10% of my playtime in the main menu and lobbies.That is about 1620 games I have played which means I have only been killed by 10 hackers in the 1620 games. To put it in percentage 10 hackers in 1620 games is about 0.6% which means that 99.4% of my games were hacker free. Yes cheating is a problem in pubg since one hacker can ruin 99 players' games but there are hackers in every game and the bluehole devs are constantly battling issue.Some hate the new DLC which contains zero content and really only skins which you shouldn't get mad at since bluehole is a company like every other company that ONLY makes games to make money if this wasn't true then there wouldn't be many games to play. Also skins give you zero benifts in the game and only makes bluehole more money that they can use to make this game better with more content. It is literally a ing win win situation and some babies are ing crying. Some say the game is still badly optimized and after every major update it gets worse which is partially true I have a old gpu (760) which can still run modern games at about 80 FPS at medium graphics but It can only run pubg at 65 FPS at every graphical setting at VERY LOW (with some tips from videos too) which is quite bizzare. But in the new map update I get 5 10 FPS more which has been quite satisfying and helped me win my first game in the new map. This is a problem but it is getting better and the ones having the problem with optimization are really people with graphics cards like me or people who think they can run the game at Ultra with 100 fps.My last point is that so many of these negative reviews focus on how many bugs there are in the game. This was true last year but now you really never see bugs. The only "bugs" are the game's bad physics with vehicles really which are not "bugs" and sometimes weird gun animations that are actually funny. The only bugs that can be found now happen infrequently and are harmless.People who are angry are more likely to leave a negative review than people who love the game. I myself would never really review this game until I saw that the steam reviews tanked to 30% and I just want people that read these reviews to discredit off players that leave negative reviews with t reasons.

review: As someone who has played this game for 739 hours i would say its worth it. BUT the big thing with pubg is that it is a tryhard game if you go into a game your expected to tryhard and win with every possible matter which compared to other BR's who focuse more on the moneymaking part of the game Fortnite skins dances etc. When you have bought this game you have all the content for it and you can go ahead and play hours into hours depending on how tiltproof you are. The main point is that pubg is not really child friendly since it has a steeper learning curve than most BR's and you can't master it after 200h i was still a noob and it requires triple that amount to get consistent wins and to perform good. To conclude pubg is good for those who want to invest time into the game and want to be really tryhard sure there is bugs and hacker but there is both those things in every game avaliable no game is perfect.

(But then again this is to be expected this early in the EA. As long as they don't take too long to fix these it's ok)Still I believe it has great potential and even with all these issues it's already far better than its competitors.Worth a shot right now if you're really into the genre and have a good PC. If not wait a few months to see if it's optimized any better (which I hope it should).

review: i love the theme of this game. there is no storage or stash to carry on from the previous game. the only thing you can earn are clothes to look different. you drop from a plane (F) to eject (F) to open chute and hope you are not dropping with to many others right on top of you. find a weapon and ammo and shoot the nearest player before she or he kills you. now you see where the safe zone is on your map (M) a white circle. loot as much gear as you can find (vest and backpack) increase your storage. and head for the circle. if you are to far out you find a vehicle in a garage or on the side of the road and head for the circle. If you run to an area with a lot of people this can make you an easy target. house to house looting and killing the shotgun and the sub machine guns are best just pick up lots of ammo.out in the open the m16s and the ak assult rifle have longer range (alwasys better with a scope) and for really long range the sniper rifles. make sure you have good ammo for the trip. once the circle is very small back to sub machine gun vector or shotgun. (don't be bashful about using grenades and molitofs. waiting for the server improvements this month and i think we will have an awesome game. so many people have and are enjoying this game there is a very minimal time to wait for 100 players to join. a just a little practice time before the game on an island waiting for the plane.

review: With only 8+ hrs I know some people may brush past this review but here me out....I am running this game with a poor processor and only a 4gb 960 nvidia graphics card however I have a whopping 24gb of RAM. The game is poorly optimized and thankfully I run the game smoothly at a low graphics settings. If you like a mix of ArmA and H1Z1 this is your game. Gun play is fantastic many guns and they all act and feel different from each other. I have extremely high hopes for this games future if the developer sticks on working with the game. He has already acknowledged the optimization issues and said that an EST time of a small fix (and more to come) to be April 14 2017 but we shall see how consistent him and his team is. The game is fun and hope it has a long life span. Despite the poor optimization I have no complaints. Try it out! PS play with friends for double the fun I enjoyed duos and squads a lot.

review: Please don't buy this game if you live anywhere other than where the servers are hosted. The game developers only care about getting your money. Don't kid yourself and think that they will give you servers where you live. There is a huge disadvantage having high ping and you won't have a very high chance of surviving late into the game. From getting shot while round a corner to simply getting around a corner and being outgunned you are going to get ed. Games with low latency are the way to go. Don't get frustrated and break your keyboard buy games with developers who actually care about their players' experience.

review: I tried the game back in fall 2017 and I wasn't a big fan due to several big issues at the time so i requested my money back. I bought it again on Sept 3rd 2018 and wow...the game is much better. Cheaters are gone as far as I can tell lag and other issues are gone performance is much better on my GTX 1060. It really is a lot of fun very intense game I am glad I decided i would give it another chance. PUBG mobile helped me with that decison as it seems to play very well on my galaxy s8.Don't let all the negative reviews dissuade you from getting the game. They are mostly haters. It really is a great game now.

review: for 20 $ best game at the moment. buy it practice it win it and have fun!Playing this game from day 1.this game just keeps improving (yes it started very low) and now its pretty much amazing. i love everything about it and its my main game now.What i love about it Amazing graphics (does require high end GPU but they keep improving it with every update)Realistic sound effectsadvanced shooting mechanic (bullet drop travel time and aim zeroing).squad play allows you to create amazing military tactics.Intense as **** your heart will be beating and you will get scared (seriously)!Huge maps!Tons of weapons and attachments.Endless skill curve.What I dislike about it As all battle royal games the randomness factor can drive you insane.Very hard to do the same things twice but that's part of the battle royal adventure.

review: We all get that this is an Early Access Game and there are still a lot of things to improve upon. That being said despite its obvious flaws it has a different feel to it compared to any other game I've played. I have never been so obsessed over a game since Fallout New Vegas (all of the Fallout games really). PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS has been a daily routine for me rain or shine work night or not. I highly recommend this game if you want to improve on multiple facets of your skills like communication &amp adapting to situations. Worth every penny baby.

review: Drops at Po i. Wow there's another guy nearby. Walks around and finds a shotgun and camps at the door. Meanwhile the other guy kills 2 others with an AR.Dude walks into the door and I shoot him in his face.Collects loot finds a SCAR and a suppresor.Rides motorboat into white circle.Hides in a bush for inventory management and sidestepped a buggy at the last moment. Dude probably didn't realise it was so loud.Ran further into the circle and found a house with a guy sniping in it.Decides to avoid the house and run further down.Hides in another bush and hears a vehicle sound.Circle closes in and I run out of the bush after vehicle sound dies down.Looks to the left and sees an UAV in the distance.Turns right and sees a guy on my right about 30m in front of me.The guy turns toward me and then hides behind a tree.After a half second delay I died by shotgun. Realises that there was some lag between him shooting me and the damage received.Starts a new game and drops in military base and got punched to death.11/10 will play more

review: Very similar to other Battle Royale games for obvious reasons. A slightly cleaned up version of H1Z1. In my opinion its faster paced than H1Z1 at the beginning. You cant rip up clothes and make bandages a lot less inventory management. You just quickloot what you need and leave the rest. Clothing fast equips on pickup etc. What does this mean to you? You can get into the fight A LOT faster! Compared to other similar titles (H1Z1 DayZ Warz etc...) its a lot quicker to get ingame during connection/ server searching. H1Z1 took over a year to make joining a game quick and painless. Because the game is new there seems to be a lot less hacking/exploiting. Overall you can go from the homescreen to fire fight in less than 5 mins.*** My one grief is the jumping. *** If I could give this game one hard criticism its that jumping over textures or just gaining the proper amount of momentum to navigate terrain is incredibly painful and its caused me to die several times.8/10. Nothing new about it but a polished version of what we've come to love in these deathmatch/battle royale shooters. Jumping needs a fix but otherwise gameplay is great. Perhaps a better ingame graph with stats on items/attachments so players can make a more educated selection but these are available through third party sources online.

review: I was sceptical at first when buying this game but i have played for about 10 hours and it is really fun despite its flaws. It is definitely a great battle royal game can could use some improvement. The guns shoot well and feel good sometimes the aim is off though which can cause problems because getting in close is not usually an option. You start by jumping out of an airplane onto a giant map and immediately feel the pressure of survival. I havent gotten more than 4 kills in a game yet but those kills feels grea. All in all I'd give this game a 9/10. One thing to beware though is the toxic community im new to PC coming from console and i dont understand why people even have mics on this game all they do is SCREAM things they heard on youtube and play soundboards! Honestly for me this is the biggest drawback for PC.

review: Issues mentioned below have been mostly fixed. The game is definately playable now. It's good fun buy it. Perhaps it's just me but apparently 4GB of vram isn't good enough on the lowest settings causing a "ran out of vram" message and subsequent crashing. GTA 5 on max settings doesn't do this so clearly this is a bug or some sort. Gameplay is good could use some more optimization however. I will not be playing this anymore untill this issue is fixed. Likewise if you have under 4GB of vram don't buy this untill this issue is fixed. Getting so far only to have it crash is enraging. TD LR wait for some updates. Don't buy now.

review: It sucks to see that the reviews for this game are not as they should and that's because people are complaining about the optimization. It's true though the optimization is not good but i feel that people should be writing reviews about gameplay and not about how their $2000 computer can't run this game at 90 fps at all times. I feel that while I play this game I feel more tense VS H1Z1. This game is a lot slower paced and you won't be searching for fights like H1Z1 players do you will actually find yourself trying to stay unnoticed by enemy players and this game does require strategy. One of my favorite things that this game is that as a newer player you can make it to very high ranks. I made it to third place on my 5th game and I still did not know what I was doing half the time I went with the flow. Overall I think this game is fantastic and it will beat H1Z1 anyday for me. Once they get this game fully optimized I will be confident that this will be a excellent game. All the players will come and protest that they perfer it over PUBG but it is all about preference. If you like fast paced games and want to get into the battle royale genre play H1Z1. If you like to take things a little slower and maybe you like Arma games or the DayZ mod and you like to think about what will be the best plan of attack PUBG is the way to go.

review: Terrible networking. Absolutely awful. How about instead of suing EPIC you ask them how to make a network layer?.. This game works 10% of the time. Frustrating laggy and unresponsive. Getting killed by laggy players from who knows where who are practically ivounerable (i guess because of their ping) is happening all the time. Almost every game you die behind a wall for unknown reason. Replays are absolutely useless. People shoot to the air in spots where i have never been and i die ( if they aimed at a spot where i was running from i would understand that there might be some dellay but i got killed by a player that was aiming 2 meters to the left of me and i was comming from the right. I've never been in a position that he shot at). People get hit in the head by Kar98 and live. Even on replay my aim is on point but this trash game is just so out of sunc that it doesnot count theese hits. PRO TIP Do yourself a favor and dont watch replays.But when the game works and bullets actually fly where you aim and ppl actually get hit when you shoot them its pretty ok. 1/10 for tragic networking

review: Great game and most importantly easy to play.I was sick of mods making groups passwords launchers and generally anything that meant I couldn't get involved in the the first minute. I was a staunch advocate of A3 KotH but even that feels put on a shelf right now. Couple of gripes with the weapons I'm either a very bad shot or I'm firing into a sponge but you can't have your cake AND eat it during 'Early Access'.Could be better optimised and does have some of those cringeworthy animations of the horrid DZSA but it's been a pleasure so far overall. Audio is accurate in game but trashed in spectator mode but maybe that's intentional to stop collusion?!Technically you will need a higher end PC to play it without issue. But there are tweaks and guides to help those with lower end systems. Expensive at 27 GBP but cheaper than a night in the pub!

review: Concept is interesting. VERY poorly optimized to the point where driving vehicule can lag down to very very low fps. I also wasnt to crazy about the flow of the game where you have to move to get in the circle but you almost have to camp to kill people or otherwise you get killed without even knowing where from. In the 8 or so games I played 3 times only I knew who killed me. and two times was only because we parachuted on the same exact spot and they got a gun before I did. Rest of the time is WTF just happened..At least have a replay to show who killed you and where he was for the last 5 10 secs....this would not only give satisfaction in understanding what killed you but also help you learn the game by perhaps seeing what others have success doing. As it is a loss feels mostly unrewarding as you do not really learn anything from it. Anyways its fun enough but I did ask a refund and will keep on my wishlist for later if it gets optimized.

review: This game used to awesome. It was a nice place away from all the little kids who play Fortnite and the community was pretty cool (aside from the occasional talking and loud pregame lobbies).This game is going downhill fast though. It started with the introduction of loot crates. You used to just earn the loot crate with in game curreny/purchase and then open it immediately. Then they slowly replaced each loot box behind a pay wall. Then they introduced weapon skins you could buy and sell on the community market. Now they have released an Event Pass which is unbelievably similar to Fortnite's Battle Pass with the tier progression unlocking a different mainly cosmetic reward.The game itself is still fun but if Blue Balls keeps adding this crap in it's just gonna be another royale game in the shadow of Fortnite.Edit This game has gotten a tad better with the introduction of a new map but the microtransactions still need to be halted.

review: I'm not normally a big fan of early access/survival type games but this game does something right. It's tense fairly well optimized for what it does and has solid mechanics for early access. Latency can be an issue sometimes but it hasn't stopped me from enjoying the game. Playing at 1440p with a GTX 1070 and getting between 40 60 FPS rarely drops below 40 and never under 35. My issue with survival type games is the amount of time it takes to enjoy them battle royale is the perfect mix. It's slow but fast paced if that makes sense I can jump in a match before work and quit with no issues. I'm a huge fan of Arma and you can certainly see the inspiration this game takes from that. It doesn't feel like a cheap knockoff rather a refined version of a fun game type. Can't wait to see this game's development over time and look forward to many hours of fun. If this is what we get at the beginning stages of EA it can only go from good to better.
