review: Wow what a game. I rarely find a game that gives me an adrenaline rush like this (see alien isolation). I've always been a fan of horror or RPG games that put your survival at stake. This game takes this to another level with a realistic MMO PvP fest.PUBG could become that itch that I'll never be able to stratch if they fix their netcode. I never want to have another experience where you run behind cover and think you're OK but the server didn't update so you're actually dead. Of course this is an EA game so if your dont want to be frustrated don't shell out the cash. Wait 6 months for the full game (their promise not mine). I can only hope this game is as popular/revolutionary in the future compared to what they've achieved now.To whomever reads this 7/10 current experience. We'll see where it ends up.

review: This is a good but broken game. Lots of hackers and bugs. I will change this review if the game improves. There are so many hackers that I do not trust the game. Every time you die there is that bit of doubt in the back of your head that it was not legit. It can be quite frustrating. Do not buy this game until these problems are fixed.edit as at 7th Dec 2017 the hacking teaming etc is still regularly happening in games. The game has not improved yet. I will update when it does.Edit 1.0 is worse than ever. Old problems still here. Things that used to work are now broken. There is still many hackers.I was killed by a hacker watched the replay and spotted another hacker as well. They are literally in every game29th Jan 2018 despite the recent waves of hacker banning I'm regularly dying to obvious hackers. 2 in 5 games tonight I died to hackers and in 1 of those games I died to a infinite fall damage bug. This is what happens everyday. Why do I keep playing? Because it is a fun game. I would love to reccomend it. But I cannot reccomend a game that is infested with hackers and is "out of Early Access" with regular game breaking bugs.10 Feb 2018 I still regularly see hackers in games. The hacker problem is not fixed yet.June 2018 things are still really bad. This is such a broken game. I love it pieces but I cannot reccomend it to anyone.And a new plague of spambots. Bluehole is "working on it" but for the last month there has been a chinese spammer selling hacks in lobby in nearly every game. Bluehole can do nothing to fix this. They are incompetent and haven't fixed the most basic of problems even as they add more.Edit nothing positive to add. Matchmaking is broken and has been for some time (OC).Edit PUBG will never be fixed and will never be out of Early Access and will NEVER EVER not be infested with hackers.

My specs go far and beyond the minimum requirement. Everything is fine. Every other game runs with ease. But Battlegrounds just isn't finished at this point.The developers need to step up their ****. Seriously. 'Cause I can understand a game this broken when it's in early access but if this goes live and it's still this cluster****ed it will fizzle and die. I am not the only one having these problems. Each and every one of the three people I know who bought this game have been crashing and crashing and crashing again. What's more the developers of this game don't care. The forums have about 100 000 people trying to fix their game and 2 trying to help them. It's madness. Do not buy this game yet. Wait then buy. I know it's hard but you really should.malfunctioning 10

review: I don't review a lot of games but I feel compelled to review PUBG. The gameplay loop is incredible. Unlike other online shooters (ahem CS) where you get killed and have to wait until the round ends and start over PUBG gets you right back into another game withiin a few minutes. Whatever happens in the session you were just playing in is of no concern to you because you're right back in the action more or less immediately playing a fresh game.While you're playing nearly all of your senses are engaged. You're listening for footsteps and distant gunfire. You're paying attention to the direction those sounds are coming from. You're peeking around corners. You're holding down ALT and looking behind you while you're running looking for enemies. You enter buildings ASSUMING there's someone in there already waiting to ambush you. Even with this heightened level of vigilance you still jump out of your chair when you get shot and you didn't expect it. The game does need a few improvments. Opening and closing doors can be clunky. As can getting into and out of vehicles. There are times where a 2 foot fence can slow you down when you should be able to get over it with ease. Worst of all players with poor graphics cards or those who are willing to drop their graphics quality actually have an advantage by turning down the setting for foliage. I think we all want the game to look it's best and having to turn down a graphics setting for a tactical advantage seems pretty flawed.Problems notwithstanding if you like online shooters you should be playing this game. It is pure elegance in simplicity. Pavlov would have been proud of PLAYERUKNOWN. The minute you get an electric shock from being killed you get another food pellet by getting back in the game in less time than it takes you to run to the bathroom and back.

review: Let me list in short the reasons why as a UK player at least you should not put up with this game.Servers are trash. You will never ever get the reponse times when looting the reg when shooting that US players do on their servers because as per usual UK players are forced to play on garbage servers on mainland Europe with horrible tick rates.The graphics even at max settings look bitty and unpolished the recently added sharpen feature makes me feel like it's peeling a layer off of my retinas.The Miramar map is absolute garbage.The Sanhok map is ok but nothing will beat the original map.The looting is horrible. Open 10 buildings find 10 shotguns 3 SMGS and 7 pistols somehow miraculously always encounter somebody else who landed on top of a Kar98k with a 4x Scope despite your permanently terrible luck.The mobile version of this game is astonishingly better at all of the above apart from the same garbage maps. That's a huge embarassment.Uninstalling shortly wish I could refund but I'm way past that point.

review: The last time I've felt like this for a game was back when playing Ultima Online as a young kid. There are so many gameplay stories shared among friends and as a squad. The quick time to kill looting sandbox MMO aspects and stellar gunplay make this game a must have. There is an amount of suspense at all times which I haven't felt replicated in a game for me in a long time. One moment you are running through a town SEAL Team Six style to next taking a road trip halfway across the map engaging in vehicle to vehicle gun fights to next laying prone in a field of high grass lobbing frags afraid to stand up because there are 12 left alive in a very small area. The sheer amount of excitement when you chicken dinner demonstrates how special winning matches become. Currently at 100ish hours played I've won 7 squad and 2 duos. Each one a special moment. This is a game of skill wit tactics and communication.

review: "I love this game!I hate this game!"Pretty much sums up my sentiments towards PUBG. While the game that started the battle royale craze PUBG looks amazing has great physics (bullet drop/recoil characteristics) but PUBG cannot seem to get away from all of the lag cheaters and BUGS. Bluehole doesn't have the server capacity nor the developer capacity to compete with companies like Epic when it comes to crafting a polished product. Yes we were aware that Alpha ended in 4th quarter of 2017 and we realize that there are going to be some growing pains involved but it gets ridiculous when loot crates and skins take precedence over bug fixing and snuffing out cheaters. For instance I've had 6 crashes this evening just playing with friends.At the moment I really want to recommend this game but until the bugs and lag are fixed I cannot.

review: Not worth the time or money guys. This game is so broken with loot crates and cheaters it's unreal the game isn't dead yet. I hopped on after months of not playing hoping for a change.....but no. Still broken...as always. The network is not well optimized even for folks that have decent connection the network causes too much delay so other player always get the upper hand. Second this game is a hayday for hackers can't even enjoy the game because ol single shot freddy shoots you through a mountain from across the map facing the opposite diretion you are. Third when you do get shot at you have no idea what direction it comes from so it makes acquiring a target harder than my d*** in a strip club. Just total crap. Make a different mode bluehole. Truthfully I think scum is going to oust PUBG. Much better optimization on the network. Gameplay is way better and its easier to find out where shots are coming from.

review: My first Battle Royale type game. It's excellent! The game is relatively simple in concept and raw content amount but it's full of tension and utilizes game mechanics superbly. It's what a game should be. It's simple but addicting and fun.My complaints are rather standard. Playing on one map(albeight a huge one) can get repeatitive. The game periodically stutters and hitches even on a PC with a powerful CPU and a rather strong GPU. It is a VRAM hog and I feel like it would use over 4GB of VRAM if I had a GPU with more. In general it doesn't run as well as you'd expect it to. 60ish FPS with a mix of ultra/high/medium looks good enough. Also getting into cars and opening doors or anything that involves the F key is a struggle. It's slow and unresponsive. Other than that excellent. At this points its still in Early Access so I expect most of this will be ironed out.

review: I do recommned this game just not for me. Love the concept the ease of getting into rounds the fact that rounds are relatively short (relative) and the way the game generates tension. Lots of people are having a blast with P Battlegrounds so there's a nice big population right now. The deal breaker for me is how quickly they funnel everyone into a single killzone during a round. I mean I get it...if not the rounds would last way too long and that's not what this game is about. But at the same time that's not fun for me and is really altogether immersion breaking. If there was a little more time to explore to scout and to strategize I could enjoy this game much more. But again that's not what the game is about and I don't fault the devs for what it is. Anyway refunded but that doesn't mean I don't think it's great at being what it is.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: After playing every survival game under the sun (DayZ Rust H1Z1) This is by far the best survival/battle royale game I have ever playedThere are some server issues and occassional rubber banding issues but even then I'm able to play with my friends in SA from a NA connection. The game feels incredibly balanced and I've never felt cheated of a life its rewarding to keep coming back and you feel like you're getting better each match as you progress to the top of the leaderboard.Check this game out if you really enjoyed H1Z1 or the old experience of DayZ
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I bought the original ARMA at release. Didnt purchase the sequels for the game client was never optimized. I enjoyed the game design behind DayZ and BR for ARMA yet never purchased it because of the poor engine optimization.Bought H1Z1 a year after release but uninstalled it in summer of 2015 because of the obvious bad hitreg.As a CSGO player and Pc FPS gamer since 1999 this game is the first game to properly mesh the features associated with ARMA with constant developer support tactics of CSGO and the ease of finding a BR match like H1Z1.Game has a obvious high skill ceiling. Newcomer FPS players will struggle. Arcade FPS players will need to adjust their playstyle to be more tactical while learning spray/recoil patterns. CSGO and ARMA players will need the least amount of adjustment.Edit Since early access release the game has had struggle after struggle to retain basic server side performance we experienced in closed beta. In its current state this game isnt worth the money.Game is approaching one month since being released in early access on Steam. Entire month has been the developers bug chasing releasing patches to fix said bugs then causing worse bugs in the process.Their ETA to full release is September'sh. Game will probably be ready for full release in March of 2018 that will take another year or two of further development to be in good condition. SOmething that will be extended further for once the Pc version is fully released they begin work on their console release.

review: Although the game is probably the best battle royale it has some really bad flaws. The game has a really bad tick rate at the beginning of matches. Which means fewer game state updates. Which makes the start of any match hit or miss. This game uses common game engine design practices when it comes to view distance. Less detailed lower polys further away. More detail closer up. Which means when you think you are behind cover you aren't and still get shot. The exact opposite is true directional sound. Locating enemies is easier further away than it is up close. Up close it is all mono. If you do get some directional que 50% of the time the gunshot from the right sounds like it came from the left. The sounds you make versus the sounds you hear. You are louder to enemies than you are to yourself. So you have no real idea that you have even been detected. Walking across a floor sounds like you have tap shoes on. A 500 lb fat man would make less noise under the same situation. Gun play. They are trying to go for some realism with the guns. Which really just makes some guns pointless to even have in this game at all. The ARs are way too inaccurate for thier real world counter parts and SMGS are way to accurate.

review: OK. Finally leaving a review after playing for about 3 days.First off if you like the literal heart pounding adrenaline rush that you experience in H1Z1 DayZ etc then you will enjoy this game. I don't think you can directly compare vanilla DayZ to any battle royale game but the the adrenaline rush I get is essentially the same.I was a fan of King of the Kill for the first several months it was out but I got bored with it. I'm honestly not sure what PUBG has that KotK doesn't but there is something unique about this game. I've never played Arma but I know a lot of people say there are similarities. If I had to guess at what makes this game special I would say that it has to do with the fact that you really have to create your own strategies for how you respond to different situations in game. When I first started playing I sucked. I still suck pretty bad but I'm getting better. I'm getting better because I keep playing it and I keep getting killed. But every time I get pinned down and flanked smoked out of a house with a molotov and shotgunned in the face pop up from prone to take a clean shot just to have another prone player to my side headshot me I learn... And as I learn I slowly get better. If $30 won't break your bank then you should try this game. It runs better (for me) than DayZ and H1Z1 on their best days. It has a great selection of weapons and gear the vehicles are great and the map has incredible character.Also if you have freinds you can play with this game is awesome. Solo games are way different than co op but they are both very fun.I just won my first solo game (though it isn't showing it in my stats for some reason). I look forward to hopefully winning more in the future.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is great. After watching and following through early stages of the game though it has grown into a money grab. By all means get the base game but be warned at the amount of micro transactions that you would have to pay for for ANY character customization. Play get points buy a crate with points only to still be locked which requires you to PURCHASE a key for $2.50. BTW this is after grinding points for a solid 2 or 3 hours to get your first crate (Unless you win). Oh and now after an update they want you to BUY a PASS for additional mission rewards?! WTF PUBG?! Who the heck is coming up with your decisions? I will not be spending ANY money on ANY of your micro transactions and frankly this will drive me away to other games as I just will get anoyed at just seeing your moneygrab.

Also this game has horrible damage and is inconsistant for the guns. Sometimes you could shoot someone 6 times or more and only take half of their health down and still live while other times u can two tap someone with full armour. So if you want to get triggered this is the game for you.

review: I have never seen an early access game with so much momentum towards being a fully released game. It caters to slow and fast paced gameplay depending on when and where you drop on the map. The gunplay is satisfying with lots of gun variety and attachments to compliment them. I feel that at times especially at the beginning of every game the game can feel choppy when trying to pick up items but it smooths out as the game goes on. The sound is probably where I feel the game faulters if there are too many sounds going on from the airstrikes and gunfire going on everything starts to sound choppy the plane noise at the start is way too loud. The dev's have addressed the extremely loud lobby noise which is great but gunshots in the lobby can still sound choppy. Great game worth investing early access but I really do recommend playing with people that you know because between solo and duo gameplay feels like two different games.

review: Extremely challenging but very enjoyable.Pros Each game is different. Never feels repetitiveA good amount of weapons and attachmentsHuge map (but only 1 map)Adrenaline rush once you're top 10 remainingVery easy to enter a gameEasy to drive vehiclesCons A little laggy at times (ex opening doors entering vehicles) Devs have worked on this. Feels way better than before.Jumping over fences and low walls can be quite a challenge. Wish you could vault over themOnly the one map but apparently more coming soonishHonestly its a great game. A personally believe a lot of people are negative about the game because they're having trouble winning. It's definitely not an easy game to win. I haven't come across any "hackers" or cheaters that I know of. Everytime I've died I felt like I was just beat by the better player. Hope they tweak a couple of things here and there but I've been really happy with the game and can't wait to see where it goes.

review: PUBG is a Battle Royale game much like H1Z1 but I wouldn't compare the two they play quite differently to me. H1 is fast paced while this game plays a bit slower. As of right now the game's performance is very bad which is to be expected from an early access game. The movement is also very clunky as of now. Along with the servers lagging very bad I don't think the game has east coast US servers which H1Z1 doesn't either. But I like how the game plays and I would recommend the game. Is it better than H1Z1? To me yes and no. It really is down to your preference of what type of gameplay you like.

review: This is my first of these types of games and I love it. The gunplay is so solid and well made though I don't know how any others could compare. Its very intense when you're trapped in a house by a player thats running around outside with an AKM and throwing grenades through the windows and you only have a 1911 with a measly 3 rounds left. Coming out victorious in a situation like that makes you feel a level of accomplishment no other shooter can. Personally I don't think they even need to add or really change anything. Just polish the game and optimize it and I would be happy.

review: I really wish I had someone to play this game with. I was skeptical of this game when it first came out I said "Oh another Battle Royale game for Twitch's massive armies of trolls can throw their underwear clad bodies at you and show off their ability to turn the gain all the way up on their microphones. After picking this game up on a late night spending spree in the Steam store I cannot tell you how wrong I was. The game is so simplistic and fun on a primal bloodthirsty level. Every instance in the game from the moment you jump out of the plane to the moment you are inevitably stopped cold by some bozo's 12 gauge is more tense than half of these self proclaimed "survival horror games" can do as a genre in 10 years. Not to forget Mr. PlayerUnknown himself who offers frequent and useful updates and we all know how lazy developers can ruin an early access title. It's nice to see a game with a nice foundation finally flourish both comercially and spiritually. No other PvP title is better if you want realism competition and non stop tension.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I want to love this game and one day I feel certain that I will. But not yet. I KNOW it's early access. But the developers seem to be concentrating on new content and the upcoming Xbox One launch rather than optimizing what they've already got. I cannot recommend the game in it's current state and unfortunately they are making the optimization process harder for themselves the longer this continues. In short there seems to be a strange set of priorities in the development of this game. Which is a pity because it could and should be spectacular. It's a real shame when this much potential awesomeness is falling short. On the other hand if you have a high end PC you should be able to get a decent frame rate. Maybe. And I doubt that'll clear up the glitches. But a quick look around Twitch shows that the game can be played and looks great! It just needs a fair bit of work to make it accessible to more gamers. Hopefully it's worth the wait.

review: Ok So lets try to help people make up their mind shall we?You are obviously here cause uve seen streams or youtube videos of pubg right?Let me clear sth for u out.Unless you are president trump on his whitehouse pc or a nasa engineer your game wont be as smooth as those streamers or utubers.You will probably be like me.Be like john u will play with 45 fps your game will lag AF when u fall down from the airplane u will have to play on all low (so game wont be smooth and pretty) and hope for player uknown to keep updating the game(which he does) and give you a very nice perfomance patch.But lets talk about cons and pros.Pros You actually have a LOT of ways to win/play the game which i think is really good since u dont have to be the badass 500 fps guy killing 50 people to win.I actually won so many games by just playing the zone right and killing when its necessary so theres a way to win even if ur not a crazy fps player.The guns are spray patterned so theres a huge difference between even the pistols.Loot system makes it fair and random for all people.Love the scopes make you have to take decisions.Lots of vehicles.Cons Its a living HELL if you got an avarage or bad pc.You wanna play but u cant its like bein teased from mia khalifa.Still a lot of hackers .You may get DCed randomly.You may freeze in game for 2 sec at the worst possible momment.You cant mute people 90% of the times the game starts and you wait for ur fall from the plane people are screaming in their mics so u will probably get deaf soon.No deathcam.Would i reccomend it? Yes. Would i to a normal pc yet?NOOOOOOOOOOOO...Dont buy it if u got a normal pc YET you will end up addicted to a game you cant play.just wait for optimal perfomance and then GET IT and become the next battle royal king.

review: Instead of writing a review I'll tell you one of my experiences with this game. I found a pistol an assault rifle 4x scope and a stun grenade with some ammo before making my way to one of the farms north of my position. I saw four people land there earlier during my parachute drop. As I approached the farm a car parked outside. When the driver stepped out I took a moment. "Do I shoot him?" I was well hidden in the field so I decided to stay unnoticed for a little longer. I crawled my way slowly towards the farm but when I was next to the pathway another car drove passed the farm and was going straight my direction nearly running me over! Luckily he didn't notice me or decided to leave me be. As I got closer I saw the driver from earlier who was sneaking about enter the farmhouse. After a few gunshots it went quiet. Someone was inside.When I snuck around the farm house I checked the player counter. "58 left." I am going to be in the last 10 I told myself as I too entered the building. Ground floor was clear I moved as quietly as possible since you can hear everything in this game which is amazing. I heard some movement upstairs and grabbed my pistol before switching to my stun grenade. Seven shots before reload better make them count. Once I positioned myself below the stairway I threw my stun grenade up onto the second floor went for cover and after the initial explosion I sprinted upwards. There I was greeted by a shower of bullets but my stun grenade worked he missed! I quickly aimed for his head and after a few good pistol shots he was down...I won. Time to reload and check his equipme "Better luck next time!" Was the message I read seconds later after I was shot from behind pumped by a shotgun. 50 players left.

review: Let's cut to the chase Do I recommend this game? Yes. But not in its current state.This game is incredible and the most fun I've had in any form of shooter in a good 7 years. But is a task to run. My PC isn't half bad (specs in Bio) and I struggle to run this on the lowest settings. Now I know it's early access and the devs update this game often which is amazing. I commend you for that P.U )But if you have a PC similar or less powerful to mine don't purchase the game just yet. Wait it out a little longer until a few little performance hiccups are sorted.The gameplay itself is slow to begin with. Around 99 people are dropped into this massive map almost as big as Arma 3's ALTIS map. You're ALL unarmed and must scavenge for Arms and Armor in nearby buildings and run to the PLayer Zone which is a zone the players must play in and shrinks every 2 4 minutes. This zone is bordered by a blue wall of lighting and if caught in it you slowly take damage that will increase over time the longer you're in there. The last player alive wins the game so a safe "out of sight out of mind" playstyle is highly recommended as the weapons kick like mules on full auto making single fire and bolt action your best bet at hitting anyone that isn't close enough to unzip your trousers.There are also Carepackages that can drop randomly during the match usually containing stockpiles of ammo rare 8x and 15x Scopes and even weaponry that can't be found through normal means such as a M249 which acn really give you the edge in a prolonged firefight.So to finish this I say buy this game. But only if you have a good PC. I myself struggle for 50 80fps with constant microstutters and no V Sync is present in this current build. PUBG is an incredible game by the original creator of the Battle Royale and cares deeply about making this game as good as he can. The only thing I will say is wait a little longer for the very few performance hiccups to get sorted )EDIT After the recent update the game is allot more stable. I now get a good 70 100 fps with extremely rare drops ) If you have a similar rig to mine I now recommend picking this game up!

For the love of all that it good though you gotta show me where the hell I get killed from. Playing this game so carefuly just to have yourslef shot down and have no idea where from is absolutely soul crushing. You heard the shots were close but you looked around everywhere before you moved and saw no one. I get that it could provide an advantage if you were playing with friends and maybe you could tell them where they were. If you are in a squad though and a shots are fired your team will be able to respond to the audio so its not really putting anyone at a disadvantage. Just do what battlefield 1 did and point the camera at the player that killed you.

review: Pretty fun game. I think the genre is "battle royale" and I've never played a game like it before. I kind of wish there were more modes or perhaps smaller maps or something but this is an early access game and it still feels pretty good to play in it's current build. The develeopers keep pushing out bug fixes and updates to balance and whatnot so that is always a good sign. Hopefully they find a way to get rid of the running grind because I find it absolutely atrocious. You will undoubtably spend more time running in this game than you will fighting other people or probably even looking for items to use. So beware of that I guess.However for $30 I think I would wait to a bit more things come out before picking this up. Also make sure you completely understand what type of game this is and what you will be doing in it before you pick it up

review: I typically don't review games but I feel this might be worth my time.The concept is great the idea is there but the main gameplay mechanics are not fluid at all.Firstly the gravity in the game is very awkward. You dont jump high enough for it to be low grav but you definitely don't fall fast enough for it to be regular gravity. The gravity of the game makes all the mechanics feel extremely sluggish. The core mechanics shooting and walking are far from perfect depending on your system you can/can't see people that other players might be able to see. Looking down the side is still extremely buggy especially if you are indoors prone or against an object such as a rock or tree.The friends/players menu is completely broken people will be online when they're not stuck in parties or you simply cannot invite people for not explainable reason. Lastly please add a dedicated grenade button no one will use grenades until you can toss one without losing your gun for several seconds. That being said the game is still playable and fun if you're in a co op setting with friends. Can't wait to see the final version of the game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've been playing this game since shortly after it was released on Steam. The game always had its problems but they weren't game breaking and besides it's early access. It was still very playable and extremely fun.That being said it's actually comical how broken this game is in it's current state. Virtually every time I attempt to play the game now it gives me a new error that almost always reslts in me just exiting the game. It's kind of impressive how difficult it is to actually play a game without some new error popping up ruining the experience. I'm not being hyperbolic. Literally EVERY game I try to play it crashes for some random reason. And no it's not just me. I play with a friend and he suffers the literal exact same issues. Yes I do have the proper PC specs to play the game.Not to mention the sound errors. I set my mic to always mute and apply the changes. Doesn't matter everyone around me can hear me. The microphone settings change every time I relaunch the game. It's incredibly frustrating because it completely gives your position away. Combine that with the ever present desync intermittent rubberbanding embarrassingly inaccurate ballistic damage profiles and you have a game that is basically a scam at this point. I don't know how they can accept people's money in good conscience with a game this laughably broken in so many distinct ways.When it does work it's a fun game. But that's basically never. Please fix your broken game. The fact that they're working on new maps rather than fixing the basic mechanics of this game sounds like a cruel joke but it's true. Until the game is actually playable don't buy it. It'll only bring you frustration.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is basically H1Z1 made harder to run but with a lot more to it. It's a lot more realistic however it still contains glitches and bugs. The fighting aspect is way more advanced than H1Z1 and I love how they included attachments in this game. Looting can be inconsistent but it has a lot of teamwork involved. This game is a great game to play with friends and will live up to what it is made out to be. Without a doubt I recommend this game to anyone who likes H1Z1 but also to anyone looking for a multiplayer shooter.

review: I played it a bit and thouroughly enjoyed it and inted to continue playing.The sound in the game is great. You can hear gunfire and vehicles at reasonable distances and tell where they're coming from. The gunplay with the weapons hasn't presented any problems and the variety of the weapons is good for what this is and where it's at. I can't speak for the models or textures as I have to play on very low settings for now but hopefully soon I'll be able to get a good look at things. It's a fun game model delivered in a way that's easy to enjoy.However I just have a few things.1 I would really appreciate if after you died it at least pointed the camera at who killed you if even for a moment. It's pretty frustrating to survive until the very end be prone in a bush looking for people and then a few snaps and you're dead and no way to verify and say "oh that's where he was". At least in solo games. I can understand how that could be bad in duo and squad.2. I sincerely hope the currency system in the game does not turn into microtransactions.3. It'd be nice to be able to change your appearance easier after the initial creation or maybe just a warning of the cost (if there was one and I missed it my bad)

review: Eye opening developmentMy first experiences with this game was pretty horrible. I had messy fps really bad loading times long waiting times to get into servers and generally many basic performance issues really made me almost hate this game.But with the new updates this game really shines. The gameplay is now smooth loading times are short and the game seems to actually being properly developed for a title in Early Access. New weapons are being added values are tweaked and everything just seems to generally be going really smooth. That being said an SSD is really still highly reccomended for fast loading times and general have an advantage over other players. If you enjoy Battle Royale games this one is highly reccomended!

review: I love this game. It can be very fustrating at times with loot spawns not always giving loot. Or not having time to loot because you got to push to the circle. But this game scraches an itch that Battlefield COD and even Arma cant quite reach. The no respawn quick pace of the game (but it can also take a slow pace if you dont need to push the circle) trying to reach a gun before the guy next to you does just fills me with adrenaline every time. Have about 40 hrs into it at the time of this writing and I cant get enough. I do recommend playing in a squad or a duo because the team work kind of smooths out the rough edges of solo play.

review: This game started out great and back when i started playing I would have given it a 10/10. I'm going to start with the pros since I feel I owe the game that. Great Replayability Every match runs different some games you drop and get all lvl 3 gear and great guns other games you spend the whole game fleeing and seraching for any sort of assault rifle. Some people don't like this aspect but it forces you to be creative and adapt which I find quite enjoyable. Looks good The graphics and the maps themselves look nice Contantly working to update their anti cheatNow we move onto the cons. The game was originally about and for the players. The game had loot crates but these were for looks only ( The way loot crates shout be ). spend in game points to get crates and open them for freen half the loot crates now require keys to open and keys must be purchased. 26mb update every day but never fix anything ( We are constantly getting updates in the game but the real issues are never fixed. China is not region locked This causes so many issues and I cannot count the number of times I had poor connection because of their lack of region locks. game frequently desyncs you will be shot around cornners through walls and other impossible ways. when you die your bullets stop doing damage. if you are killed/downed in the time that you bullet has left you gun and travels to your target the bullet no longer does damage. this causes numerous issues when in cobat and you are downed and then your bullet hits the guy adn he should also be downed but instead they now get to kill you. They promised new maps and take months to put them out. They do not meet their own set deadlines.At this point in time I would not suggest this game for anyone. THe company has lost sight of the originaly game they created and are now more concerened with trying to sue other compnaies and games for coppying them even though all their ideas are stolen as well. If the company can get back on track and start focusing on the game and the community again I feel that this game can thrive and grow expenentailly but at the current rate of things I wouldn't be supprised to see this game completely dead within the next 2 years. Bluehole or PUBGcorp will have no one to blame but themselves for this.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Absolutely terrible game that did originally have promise but was ultimately pushed in the wrong direction.Pros Most competent of a laundry list of incredibly incompetent battle royale games with a realistic aestheticCons Super buggy even after full release and the addition of two tiers of official test servers Abhorent poorly executed over monetization that comes AFTER a $30 price tag Very slow drip feed of content that is inexcusable for such a prolific and profitable game The most favorable playstyle is usually to just hide and run until you reach the final circle Dev team that doesn't listen as much as they honestly should Horrendous rampant hacker issues that have yet to be effectively solvedPlease just don't spend money on this game.

review: Alright so 90% of my hours are from august 2017 Feburary 2018. When i first got this game it was amazing a whole new experience and for a long time i thought i never would get bored of this game. Back from August up until 1.0 the game was great. Although there was the problem with all the Q qun accounts and chinese players that didnt really start until November. If Bluehole had focused on fixing the problems with the game like cheaters and the chinese community in general things may have turned out better but instead Bluehole felt like sueing their competetor Epic games because for the reason "We are worried that fortnite may be trying to replicate the feeling that PUBG is known for" which is an absolute bull reason. review: Overall amazing game! Sure it is not well optimized but I am content playing with low graphics on my current system as this game has not only spawned a host of other great games but it executed well in the beginning all things considered. MY BIGGEST COMPLAINT THOUGH IS EVENT MODES. I love the 8 player mode and grouping up with a bunch of friends and not being so limited by party size but for some reason PUBG Corp keeps deciding to do a Deathmatch mode. Don't they realize that if we wanted deathmatch we would play Battlefield Call of Duty or some other AAA title? The shooting mechanics and graphics are fine but when you compare it to Battlefield... It's just not as good. The hardcore team work focused unique game mode is what makes this game awesome.BRING BACK 8 PLAYER EVENT MODE! THROW AWAY DEATHMATCH!

review: Love the game. Definitly my most played game lately. It has some serious bugs though. It crashes a lot. I had to turn down my CPU OC that was very stable in every test and completely disable my GPU OC. I have a 7700k/1080ti. I was in the final 4 and it crashed earlier today. I almost got a refund. It also has network issues. It freezes and says lag detected and then I run a speed test and have 17ms ping and 110mbps/55mbps down/up. If you can deal with the bugs and are prepared to very rarely "win" this is a great game. It takes a lot of skill and patience. Hopefully it actually gets released unlike any other game in this genre.

review: Honestly this game is fantastic. For a game in Beta I've never had such a great experience. Rust has been in ALPHA for years and years and here you have a game that came out in March that's in Beta and shoots Rust off the charts. As much as I love Rust being a loyal player with over 460 hours I do think this game is amazing. You may think that these two games are nothing alike yet they share a similar concept the PvP aspect of listening is VERY Rust like. The community on this game just like any other PvP adult survival game has a community. But no matter because if you have friends to play with you have something to laugh at.You should 100% get this game. It requires some basic PvP experience though and it goes without saying that you need to play with someone. Solo is brutal and though it may be fun it get's boring if you don't have friends to play with. Once you do you're in for a treat.Good luck sickle slice and crack people!

review: This game _was_ extremely fun when it first came out.Since then the developers have continued to ignore customer feedback and break things with ASTOUNDING regularity all while trying to get people to take the game seriously as an esport title and adding new paid loot crates constantly.#FIXPUBG is a joke.They take away region select in favor of auto region select based on ping and completely mess up that code so that people are forced into matches with TERRIBLE game breaking latency. Don't worry though they fixed some bugs in the emote system!Because everyone knows how important it is to be able to use emotes in a battle royale game!&lt Golf clap&gt A friend of mine made an excellent point the other day when someone brings in their car for him to fix he doesn't give it back to them with 12 _new_ broken things. Because he's a profesional. Meanwhile it seems like _every_ hour is amateur hour for the developers of PUBG. Any system they try to modify seems to end up broken in some way. The result of all this is that people have been abandoning this game more and more and as a result the matchmaking times have gotten worse and worse.I would STRONGLY advise most people to not waste money on this title at this time.

review: I usually don't recommend Early Access titles as they have left a bad taste in my mouth (ARK Survival Evolved) especially. But the team behind PlayerUnknown's Battleground has delivered what I personally consider a remarkable product for an Early Access game.PROS + Dev team constantly keeps the community updated+ Weekly updates focused on bug fixing and optimization+ Monthly updates that include new features weapons and/or game modes+ Graphics are visually stunning for a Battle Royale game+ A whole lot of fun to play with friendsCONS Game has a tendency to lag on it's own after playing for a few hours and needs to have a full restart in order to run smoothly again. Some delay between performing an action and the game actually noticing the event triggerIn conclusion I highly recommend that anyone interested should acquire PUBG while it is in early access and work with others to help create an amazing final product. The price is also most likely going to go up when the game leaves Early Access anyways so best to buy it when it's expected to be lower.

review: *Go down to my quick edit first instead of reading this review. My opinion has changed overall.*I have almost 24 hours in this game and loved every second of it but the issue of hackers is a big one. In the past 3 5 hours I've already had to report 4 people because of suspicion of hacking. These people aren't just your typical "good at the game " these are the people that have numbers and letters as their name e.g. 01480 wlk1995 06020wea etc. Wlk1995 was a hacker that nailed my friend and I with 15 shots each in 2 seconds with an SKS. For those that don't know an SKS is a sniper rifle that averages about 1.5 2 bullets per second. That's a huge difference of fire rate. I really wish I had recorded the footage but sadly couldn't because my hard drive is out of space. This huge issue aside PUBG is a great game and its core mechanics are phenomenol but because it's still in Early Access all of it is still subject to change. As of the current state that I'm writing this review I would definitely recommend it to anyone that is into the Battle Royale genre. What I love the most about this game is that I feel compelled to queue into any game mode whether that be solo duo or squad. I love the weather change and I love the fog weather (I know I have a much different opinion compared to the majority). I still don't think that the prices of lootcrates should double every purchase though. Instead they should be a flat rate but still retain the same weekly cycle for which crate you get. In all honesty this is the game that H1Z1 should have been but still have their "arcade y" feel to it.If you don't have a PC that can run this game yet then I recommend saving up for one if you can. This is definitely one of the first games that you should test run your new rig with because of how empowered you'll feel when you get in a match.I won't lie if you're not familiar with Arma H1Z1 or those other big map/clunky mechanics games then this will be a new kick to your tastebuds. I can say that I recommend this game but with slightly gritted teeth. The only reason why I'm hesitant is because of the hackers that will show up every 3 5 games. You'll struggle you'll rage you'll quit but when you get it down you'll have fun. Good luck Tenno.EDIT I no longer recommend this game because Bluehole has made microtransactions and cosmetics as their main goal instead of fixing the core issues of the game. Such as optimization net code server issues etc. I personally think that the game is DYING (not dead) and the steam charts reflects this perfectly. Until Bluehole can give their consumers the game that they deserve I think this game is a pass. You may as well enjoy many other Battle Royale games out on the market right now.

review: Playerunknowns Battlegrounds is still in very early development but what iv learnt from the 100+ hours in which i have played of this game is there building something very impressivethe game is not perfect right now and they are soon to be adding vaulting to the game which will vastly improve the sketchy jump they currently haveso what is the game?its a battle royale where 100 players land on an island to be the last one standing.you parachute down and the idea is you have to loot as fast as you can to get one foot in the game backpacks guns armor are what you need to win this game and the quicker you get them the better.There is a zone which slowly closes in so that eventually all players meet at a location on the map to be the last one alive.The game is full of suspense and funny moments and much more fun when played in squad and duosall in all my first 2 months on this game have been great pick it up and expect a tonne of updates from the developers in the coming months!

review: It was really intimidating at first playing it solo but you get used to it and it takes some time to get used to. I didn't get my first kill til my 15th time playing or something like that. Now I'm getting 3 5 kills a game just a little while longer. If you have at least 1 3 friends who game on their PCs too then I suggest you tell them to buy this game as well and you will never regret it. (You won't regret it either way even if you play solo)You can play DUO mode with another friend or SQUAD mode with 3 friends. Both including you of course. It takes the game from being really fun to "I'm never going to do anything else in my entire life!" from having so much fun. Even though I'm a stranger and so is everyone else who reviewed this game I highly suggest you purchase this game and I know everyone on here would agree with me. You'll fall in love with it! TRUST US! JOIN US!

review: best skydiving simulator 2017 gotypart where you land into hordes of people with miltary gear was an interesting twist.Its a solid game however.Legit cons though 1. Latency.There seems to be a major trend with people going to higher ping servers to take advantage of the netcode. I am one of them.While I have a lot of fun on my local servers that for me is a compeditive but survival enviroment but nothing makes you feel like rambo more than going onto another regions servers and legit running wild though the streets with handguns and shotguns and taking down people with level 3 armor and the such.If you ever think that you just can't pull off the impossible stuff you see in streams and videos even though you're a decent gamer chances are that's likely the case.Unfortunately what this means is even having a decent connection to your local servers might be putting you at a disadvantage. I really hope they sort out the netcode issue or maybe even a max ping system.2. Hackers. All games have hackers and while there are some occasions where they can run rampant in other games in this game the minute you have one you have a very small chance of getting anywhere. That said hackers get banned relatively quickly the only problem is the game is so cheap its quite possible just as Dr Disrespect demonstrated to ban evade.3. Dev team starting to really show cracks.First off the head dev seems to be going on regular banning spree's of dr disrespect for team killing and people complaining on the forums about hackers and other things. I personally have not experienced it however there are a few threads out there with legitamate claims and more than adequte proof that its going on Also I've had friends that used the Reddit and the Pubg forums to ask questions and have learned they are a place to quickly get banned if you have a anything that borders on a complaint.4. Sudden decision for monitization This game has apparently sold 5m copies at an average of 29.99 a copy. needless to say that's over 150 million in just a few months. Shorter time than the years it took Star Citizen took to get its 150+ million. However they need to put some crates out because you know we gotta pay their way to go to gamescon? What. They have a TINY dev team their expenditures on everything but servers would be horribly low yet even though they made big promises about not doing anything like this until after release here we are about a week off paying out money for a lot of empty promises.5. At this point more promises than substance Remember though its early access.They have promised already a new map a vaulting and climbing system a zombie mode availablity on consoles and wait for it ipads? wtf? Also none of this stuff has actually arrived they just say that they are going to be doing it next patch and then nothing actually comes of it. There's a lot of intentional misinformation and hype being pumped up about the game. We're on the fast track to a bad situation. Only buy if you enjoy watching the world burn. I sinscerely hope I am wrong and the years of experience I have seeing this stuff happen is about to be shown up because I legitimately at this core love this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS This game called "PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS" is a very good game it's like ARMA H1Z1(without the moneygrabbing) and DayZ.PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a quite laggy game but that is normal as this game is very new.GamePlay Alot of People like so called meme's. this game has alot of players and it is full of fun do you not like to play as 1 but with a squad? CLICK SQUAD! and you get matched up with 4 randoms (unless u already got 4) the graphics are "good" not the best but it looks alot like H1Z1 this game is not that "buggy" but sometimes you find a little bug (1/1000 unless you are looking for them).Optimazations/How does it run? To run this game on ultra u need quite alot of power i currently am running everything at ultra on a GTX 1070 and a I5 4670K overclocked to 4.4Ghz.i get around 55 62 fps average (depends on were you are).Players... Most players here are memers and as you know can be a little toxic (not toxic like LOL but a memers toxic)The players are great most of the time your squad has a mic and makes play how2win but u end up dying in the redzone driving in your car.Conclusion I would highly recommend buying this game if you like H1Z1/ARMA/RUST/DAYZ Also Please support the dev's by buying the game trough steam (not the gray market) and u can also try the game for up to 2 hours (Steam Refound policy).i highly recommend buying this game! i in my opinion rate it 8/10 1 sometimes the game crashes 1 needs more optimazation like RUST (i get 80 144 fps on ultra average

review: This game is FANTASTIC! Brilliant game idea design and execution. There is a slight learning curve as you have to decide what playstyle YOU prefer and learn to play it. Do you jump asap? do you wait until you are forced to eject? will you rush the high loot areas and hunt other players? Or do you get TF away from everyone else and sneak your way to the final four? My personal favorite is exploring and finding areas that few know about and fewer visit. It's up to you! The game can be frustrating at first but once you start progressively reaching higher places it becomes a delightful expreince. Still having trouble after your first few hours of gameplay? Get some friends and squad up! playing with a group is what some players need to excel! I have seen a group of Noobs take down a pro just because of sheer weight of numbers!Nothing beats the taste of a good chicken dinner!10/10 Bloody fantastic game!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Review as at 08/05/2017This game is amazing. I mainly play solo and I get an adrenaline rush every single session whether because I've made it to the top 10 and I'm expecting to get my head blown off imminently or because I *think* I just heard some footsteps in the room next door.Each match can go up to just over half hour max so it's great if you don't have hours at a time to spare. When you do it can easily fill a whole evening and beyond however as it is very addictive "just one more go" time.It is Early Access so of course it won't be perfect right now but the devs communicate and put out patches on a regular basis.I wasn't sure if I would like the game or if it would be too buggy in it's current state but I blew way through the 2 hour refund mark the first time I played it it is highly recommended!

review: So 20 hours ey? Well even through I am tragic at writing these things I have to hand it to the PUBG dev team They did an amazing job at making what I like to call the love child of Arma 3 and H1Z1 King Of The Kill (Makes sense becuase from what i heard PlayerUnknown WAS part of the dev team for both games)Through the optimizations of PUBG is ing awful. The gameplay is amazing and with a mountain of updates coming its way I can say PUBG can survive the "I bought this early access game and forgot about it when it came out" ordeal. so should you buy this game? Yes. Because even if you are bad at the Battle Royale type of games PUBG is fantastic at bringing you straight back into action with its low queue time (Atlease where I am) for you to get shot once more. 7/10 Best early access game I played in a long time.

review: I'm going to recommend this game even though it still has some problems in the current state.You will need a medium to high end GFX card if you really want to enjoy it. Do not expect a reasonable experience on a low end GPU. I have a GeForce GTX 750 Ti which is barely middle class if at all and the game is actually too laggy and too slow even on low settings. I guess a 1050 (or comparable AMD card) is necessary for a good experience.Other than that crashes are frequent and sometimes you will desync from the server which will make it pretty much unplayable. These are issues that I expect to be resolved while the game matures.The game itself is fun if you can tolerate long periods of grinding camping and looting with not much action followed by a sudden death (usually) or triumph (rarely). There are plenty of streamers to watch on Twitch in order to find out if this type of game is your thing.

review: This is the first time I have written a review for any game so take it for what it is worth.The main reason why I am writing this review is to say how awesome this game is. Keep in mind that it is early access so there is some work that needs to be done but as it is right now its a great game.I was a little hesitant to get into DayZ or H1Z1 just because of all the negativity revolved around those games which was unfortunate because survival PvP games are my favorite. I haven't played many simply because people who play them typically ruin the game and it was hard to find out that leveled the playing field but still made it intense and fun enough to play. I personally do not use any cheating software and I have no idea how to get or have any desire to but I feel like this game does have some cheaters in it which is very disapointing.Besides that the game is really fun. With it only having one game mode I keep finding myself going back for more but I can only play 2 or 3 rounds every time just because you invest so much each time you play which I love!! You really have to think during the game and try to anticipate the other players moves. I saw a guy block one of the bridges to cross with vehicles and I was impressed that people come up with in game strategies to gain an upper hand. If you use outside sources to cheat then I wish your PC will spontaneously combust cause you ruin it for everyone else you low life.Over all the game is a great platform that levels the playing field for all players and its up to how skilled you are and some times how lucky you can get. I haven't played the game multiple times and each time there is a different out come or I go a different path. I highly recommend this game and this is why I wrote this review because I felt that I had an obligation to testify to the greatness and simplisty of this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I learned about this game long before it became popular. I used to play DayZ BR back in the day so when this game was announced I was immediately interested.Once I found out it was releasing to early access I was hesitant. I made the mistake of buying DayZ Standalone Rust Reign Of Kings and countless others on early access. All of which left a bad taste in my mouth. I waited for about a year before buying this game because I figured they would have added a bunch of new content in that time frame.What they actually did was added lootboxes and gimmicky cosmetic stuff. They did add new guns and two new maps but the only map that feels different is the newest one because it's much smaller than the others. The new weapons just change the meta everytime and it practically makes all existing weapons completely non viable. Nevermind them taking the time to finish the game polish bugs and genuinely exciting new content or anything that tangibly adds value to the game. They like most developers decided to go the greedy route and try and milk more money out of this game. The cherry on top of this is they decided to sue Epic Games because Fortnite is doing VERY well despite being a free to play game. I've only played 4 hours of this game but I feel like I've done everything it has to offer. Drop here either die or kill someone run around for a while and either win a match or lose. I don't feel incentivized to win because it's not exciting to win. This game is very luck based too it's not like other BR or survival type games. DayZ mod for example. You spawn on the map and pretty much any rifle you find can be viable. Theres obviously weapons that are way better but you could kill a fully geared player if you're smart. In this game the only time you can really kill with terrible weapons is if they have nothing.Finally the community of this game is toxic. Toxicity exists in all communities but it's especially bad in this one.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Nobody spends that much time playing a "bad" game. These people just have no social lives outside of gaming. If you ate your favorite food for every meal every single day for a year you'd eventually hate it too. Cheers.

review: Alright I'm going to flat out say this. Those people who gave a negative review clearly don t know what they are talking about. PlayerUnknown created the Battleground mod for Arma created H1Z1 KOTK and now gave us PUBG. Updates weekly to bi weekly and Optimization is getting better. I mean it s early access right? Bullet drop and Bullet time are present in this game. You can zero in on people 500KM away using Pg up and Pg down. Weapons are balanced and snipers hurt like a . Their dev teams focus on different things and one project doesn t affect the other teams project. For an Early Access game. They have it down pat since normally when you buy an Early Access game they are somewhat broken.8/10 Early Access review

review: I have almost 250 hours in this game. I may not be very good but hell I definitely enjoyed it. I loved playing it with my friends I loved the sheer pvp battle royale mechanic and I loved how it could get my heart racing. I hate writing a negative review for it but I'm truly hoping that it will help bluehole see just how off it's customers are. I have not been able to enjoy this game since the release of sanhok which in my humble opinion is when the game went from a slow downhill spiral to a complete jump off a ledge. Just to list off a few examples of why I am giving this game a bad review.Let's start off with the overall bugginess It is laggy I experience desync on a fairly decent rig running on good internet especially when running with friends. I usually have to quit my first match due to it freezing to the point of running what i would approximate around a quarter of a frame per second. Even when I try my graphics on the lowest settings I'm still lucky to achieve a stable 30FPS. Not to mention not being able to connect to the servers that are "too busy" despite PUBG running the lowest number of players it's seen in a while. Next let's talk about the devs There are so many cheaters in this game and bluehole refuses to fix it despite the fixes being seemingly simple. Bluehole launched a "Fix PUBG" campaign around 2 months ago. What a ing joke. It has only gotten worse. The final nail in the coffin that really solidified my opinion.... Loot Boxes. Enough saidI don't even know how to end this review so yeah... I don't reccommend this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The system requirements are t unless you have a 1070 or better you can only dream of playing this game with a somewhat stable performance. I usually get 60 80 FPS at lowest settings which would be nice howevet it takes a lot of time for the game to load objects or even pick up items. That means by the time I get to see the first weapon I could pick up everyone else with a better computer already runs around with a lot of loot. I have a bit above the minimum requirements yet stuff like this happens. And I didn't even talk about the server issues. It sure is a fun game if you exceed the recommended system specs but lying about the system requirements are not okay I was fine with performance issues in early access but for a released game this performance is laughable.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game was good about over a year ago when other battle royale games didn't really exist. Then more did they weren't necessarily better so I never fully transitioned. Then PUBG was put on Xbox which had me excited so I got it asap. Then that is when updates seemed to be a thing of the past I now regret honestly ever playing this game. Optimization broken promises senseless and dumb content and many more things I'm sure the creators are exhausted of hearing about. In all honesty "Fix PUBG" sounds like it will be a flop things may change but not necessarily will be fixed. I heard about fix PUBG and thought maybe I could try it again for old time's sake but once as the game crashes and even fails to start on my high end gaming computer I am once again disappointed by the outcome of this game and no progress. Maybe one day the games that are released will be actually finished and perfect. I used to remember when the price that one paid for a game was worth it. This is simply another example of how the gaming industry has become lazy. There's no fixing this game. In reality the only people who actually want to play this are the ones who want to be hype haters instead appreciating well made games. And surely PUBG is not a well made game. If anyone even considers getting this game don't. Go spend your money on any other game. This game is unfinished and never will be don't believe the marketing lies as optimization is within strong limits in this game. Don't disappoint yourself.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: As you can see I have many hours on this game. I've stood by this game through optimization amazingly game ruining glitches terrible desync network lag you name it. I upgraded my PC in order to play pubg with decent FPS. The demand on your pc is incredible due to code that is PUBG. The thing is when everything in this game goes right its incredibly fun. Fantastic team game to play with friends. However the problem is the game rarely goes well. Theres numerous reasons as to why this is the case. When BlueBalls does do a decent patch where things are relatively stable it doesn't take too long for them to it up and make everything Other basic glitches that have been around since May of last year are still there such as the forced down push when jumping from crate to crate. Desync is still a major thing ranging from a minor annoyance to complete ery thats utterly game breaking at times. I may not know how game development works in detail but for a game that made over 600 million in sales while in early access for these issues to still exist seems to me to be completely ridiculous. As if to spit on your face after already kicking your repeatedly while you're down blueballs then decides to start pushing their t crate system hard. I have 37 crates that I cant open because it costs 2.50 per key to open them. Because its random I cant even use BP to buy the free crates. What kind of utter lunacy and t is this? I get a chance to get some skin that I cant even see because I only play first person mode. I recently bought rocket league and then bought a bunch of skins. I see one I like eh whats 2 bucks and I buy it. Why not do that blue balls? Positives Can be great fun with friends.Firefights can be very intense.Getting that chicken dinner is so satisfying.Game actually looks pretty good. Negatives DESYNC. DESYNC. DESYNC. My biggest complaint. Lootboxes Cancer. The zone is often times straight crap. If you're on the out edge when it decides to close youre often times ed. Have fun running for 2 min to get into the zone manage to heal and then have it close on you again and leave you in the dust as it travels again to the corner. Then when you finally make it in using your 8 first aid kits someone camping the zone line will kill you. No trading. As in bullet trading. If your bullet is midflight and you die your bullet does no damage. How and why is this a thing? The slowest rolling vehicle is a highly trained ninja assassin that will one shot you. The recent change to helmets and headshot damage is ridiculous. A level 1 helmet is destroyed with one shot. A level 2 helmet is destroyed with 2 shots. And youre dead as well. I understand headshots hurt. They should be rewarded. But so often you die from 70% hp because someone got a lucky headshot while spraying you. This didnt seem to be an issue until about a month or two ago. All of a sudden everyone and their moms are landing headshots. Im not sure if the hitbox changed or what. Either way dying from 70% hp to 1 shot while you have a level 2 helmet on is ridiculous. The audio is horrendous. Someone will be about 25 feet away from you and their footsteps sound like their about to grab your shoulder. Cant judge position for because of it. After playing the new map I cant go back to the old ones due to the low amount of loot. This is supposed to be a battle royale yet it feels like for so much of the game all your doing is looting so you can actually heal up after a fight. The game isnt supposed to be a post apocalyptic survivor where all youre doing is scrounging for basic necessities yet thats what it feels like far too often. Also make sure your pc is top of the line if you want any sort of decent of fps.In conclusion this is a fun game if youre willing to put up with all the t that BlueBalls is putting out. It is however rather frustrating and still broken. Dont let the lack of the early access banner fool you this is still early access quality imo. Personally Im hoping for the Black Ops Battle Royale to put this game into its well deserved grave. Maybe then BlueBalls will manage to get its head out of its and do some major fixes instead of adding more t skins we dont want or need.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is one of my favorite games. It takes everything good about Battle Royale type games and concentrates them into a single game with frequent updates. The physics are great the visuals are great the sounds are great. My only significant complaints are regarding content. I wish there were more game modes than just those regarding team size or singles (you can chose to play as a 1 2 or 4 man squad). If there were some different game modes or other goals in game (like a more plausible reward system as the current one is too demanding and very under rewarding) then the game would be a lot better. My only other complaint is about freezing in game which even with my beefy system tends to happen a little more often than I'd like. It's not game breaking and it doesn't happen all the time but if the performance can be a little more polished by official release time that would be great. The start menu also needs to be fixed as the game essentially reboots after almost every match.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I recently decided to get this game to see what all the fuss is about and Holy $hit I was not disappointed. This is my first kind of battle royal style game and although I need a lot more practice I am loving this game. The learning curve for a n00b like me is quite steep but it certainly doesn't stop me enjoying it. There are some bugs etc but it's EA so I would expect some issues. Graphics are good and the game play is great. It can be really tense but amazing fun at the same time. If you haven't played this style of game before then I can definitely recommend this! You won't regret it.

But I guess it depends on your rig. I was skeptical because of the somewhat steep price and like many others I grow exceedingly tired of early access games that promise this and that but inevitably die but In Playerunknowns current state I gaurentee you'll have a fun with it epsecially if you have a friend(s) to play with.

review: This game is amazingly awesome to play. it's tense rewarding pretty balanced with good mechanics. however in it's current pre release state it is so poorly optimized that even with the settings mostly all on very low and the framerate limited to 60 it still has my cpu/gpu running at 212 degrees F (100 degrees C). I can play other similar games in 4k at high settings or at least 1080p with near max settings with no issues so hopefully time and patches will fix things. Current hardware Toshiba i7 2.5 gHz 16gb ram GTX950m 8gb GPU memory Ultra 4k laptop.9/10 gameplay4/10 current optimization
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I haven't played a game where I can go solo in matchmaking and still have a lot of fun in a long time.PUBG is one of the most fun games I've played. Period. My ONLY gripe with it is the performance. I cant seem to run it past 30 50 FPS despite PC specs however Its still a ing amazing game. The idea of it is really generic but its executed so well. Its the same map every time and the same weapons but the map is so large and theres such a large skill disparity that no two matches will ever play alike. Every single choice you make matters and plays a huge part in everything you do. All of the items you get from crates are strictly cosmetic. Theres no P2W at all. I'm in love with PUBG.

review: Despite thte amount of praise for this game along with the reminder's that it is early access I would NOT recommend this game. It is FULL of bugs. The sound issues are endless. The FPS is inconsistent even on a good rig. It is laggy. It reminds me of Second Life with the glitchy movement and clunkiness of gameplay. Even if by some chance you get it to work for you and you encounter someone expect hit detection issues. You spend 10 minutes gathering gear and traveling only to encounter bad hit detection once you come across someone. Game over. If you have never actually played a good game before then sure this game might be ok for you. The standards are clearly set very low for those that praise the game. Don't buy the hype. The developers will be the same as the other games that promise improvements but never deliver. AND as of right now 3 months since it's early access release it is still as buggy as it was since release. Save your money until they bother to work out the infinite amount of bugs.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So to start with Ill cover all 3 game modes as Ive played each one for a decent period and have a good amount of kills in each mode.Single Basically your typical battle royal but it feels complex as you dont have a team or partner with you to help in guinfights.It is challenging and really fun.Playing this by yourself is a good way to sharpen your skills.Duos In this you have to not worry about yourself but your friend too.You are twice as deadly now and you also can both help eachother in finding gear.But when you are shot or hurt you get downed which can give you a second shot.Teams This is hard and you will die most likley.Strategy is key and if one person is careless then you may kick the bucket much earlier than youd like to.Essentially its like every battle royale but has more features.The zone is cool and I like how close it can get.The range in this game is good as there are hotspots all over the map but you can still get good gear in houses.The attachments can give you a very unfair advantage like the suppressor.Overall its really fun and expands upon the battle royale scene more so than say H1Z1 or Arma.A general summary is that its fun with friends but gets more complex.Id give it a 10/10 for a battle royale and a 8/10 for a normal game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: When a person first buys this game and you play a couple matches you will truly learn what fear is when you hide in a room and listen as the sound of footsteps and opening doors comes ever closer. You spray your gun and just watch as all your bullets miss due to both fear and lack of aim skills. You eventually die and step away from your computer to breathe as your heartrate slows down. Those were my first 10 (or so) rounds in solo. I've played alot of games in my life (Halo Series COD Battlefield LoL Dota CS etc) and this game has beaten all of them for me in terms of inducing heart rate. (Except maybe the first time around i played Halo 1 and had to drive the warthog off the Halo ring with a time limit I was 4 and it scared the out of me.) Once you get past the fear and heart attack inducing games you start to realize how incredibly this game plays for both fast paced and slow paced players. Fast paced players can easily have the option to jump into high combat start zones and slow paced players can head to the edge of the map. Once you get past the looting stage of things decision making and correct management of meds/zone control are what decides the good players and the bad players. If you are a fast paced player head to the zone immediately and try to kill people coming into it. If you are a slow paced player decide your correct moment of entering the zone and the angle of entrance. In the end proper management of the zone is what will decide your fate of winning or not. Duo's and Squads Holy The things that happen in this game for both duos and squads is something that every group of friends has to experience. You will truly be amazed by how fun and tactical this game is if you have even just 1 person to play with. The playstyle of solo's and duos/squads is vastly different and it can lead to some incredible matches. TL DR I paid $30 for this game. And it may be more enjoyable than any game i ve ever played. Honestly with the amount of time and joy i've gotten from this game i would have paid $100 for it. It's truly that special.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game has some of the worst bullet registration in the entire sphere of online shooters. The netcode cannot handle simple registry with guns that are encoded to do certain damage values. Multiple times stronger guns such as snipers fail to do more damage and register that damage than a simple rifle or SMG. You might as well not value loot and just enjoy being a random idiot running around because you are more likely to obtain more kills. This game really has not done anything to revolutionize the deathmatch / king of the hill / last man standing gameplay and has only created increasingly more bugs weaker netcode and larger amounts of people that take advantage of said horrible coding. Honestly if your system is worse you are likely to get aided by the awful coding and networking. While I understand there are limitations I would have thought that offering this game at a premium price and having such large amounts of sales would have at least driven the devs to attempt to fix these problems instead of throwing more useless features that do not take into account the mountain of awfulness that they are continuing to ship out. Another Early Access money grab.

review: Prepare to spend 30 minutes of your life in a match getting loot and walking across the whole map only to get one shotted by someone hidden behind a wooden pallet pixel peaking you at 18Km from you completely unable to be seen. Don't even bother shooting at anything but the head you either one hit kill your enemy or he one hit kills you.5 out of 10 times your gun will fire plastic pellets that bounce off of the enemy and do no damage 9 out of 10 of the times your opponend will one shot kill you through several walls. There is no poing in single firing just hold down the left mouse button and hope that the desync hits your enemy while he's behind cover it works for me. Every action takes 2 5 seconds making simple things like going through a doorway a gamble will my guy get stuck in a rock? will my guy hit the wall and take 15 seconds to change direction? You never know how badly this game will work that's what makes it fun.I use this game to warm up for Fortnite.
